attitude.author: Eva Chen
attitude.text: A good attitude is really important. And a sense of optimism, someone who has ideas and isn't afraid to pitch them no matter what level she is. Someone who is proactive. Someone with efficiency and common sense. They don't always go hand-in-hand, common sense and, well, everything else.

attitude.author: Adriana Lima
attitude.text: You don't have to have an attitude if you're famous.

attitude.author: Loretta Lynn
attitude.text: My attitude toward men who mess around is simple: If you find 'em, kill 'em.

attitude.author: Robert Harris
attitude.text: Social mores change all the time. In the mid-1970s, it would've been astonishing, say, to see two men holding hands in the streets. And the attitude to having a fling with a girl, or whatever, was quite different then.

attitude.author: Ali Krieger
attitude.text: I can only control myself, my actions, my work ethic, and my attitude.

attitude.author: Will Self
attitude.text: This is the paradox for me: in failure alone is there any possibility of success. I don't think I'm alone in this - nor do I think it's an attitude that only prevails among people whose work is obviously 'creative'.

attitude.author: Alvin Adams
attitude.text: Unfortunately, the attitude of many towards the press, humanitarians included and especially government workers, is often one of suspicion, if not outright fear.

attitude.author: Eric Davis
attitude.text: I was fortunate to play for Pete Rose and have teammates like Ken Griffey Sr., Tony Perez and Dave Concepcion. I grew up in the game with a mature attitude. I've always known it was better to be seen and not heard.

attitude.author: W. Clement Stone
attitude.text: Sales are contingent upon the attitude of the salesman - not the attitude of the prospect.

attitude.author: Richard Hell
attitude.text: It's really interesting with art-movies too, but art especially - to see how your attitude toward artists and works and your level of appreciation of them is always shifting and changing over the years.

attitude.author: Tom Petty
attitude.text: I don't think it's a good attitude in your life to feel that you have to be rich to have self-esteem.

attitude.author: John C. Maxwell
attitude.text: Your attitude towards failure determines your altitude after failure.

attitude.author: Rick Riordan
attitude.text: Every child's taste is different. Don't worry if they're not reading 'War and Peace' at age 12. First, build a good foundation and a positive attitude about reading by letting them pick the stories they enjoy. Make friends with a bookseller or librarian. They are a wealth of information on finding books that kids enjoy.

attitude.author: Martin Jacques
attitude.text: The world is fortunate - for the time being, at least - that it has an American president in Obama who is prepared to take a conciliatory and concessive attitude towards America's decline and that it has a Chinese leadership which has been extremely cautious about expressing an opinion, let alone flexing its muscles.

attitude.author: Paul Mooney
attitude.text: I think I have a mental nappy attitude.

attitude.author: David Joseph Schwartz
attitude.text: The 'Okay-I'll-give-it-a-try-but-I-don't-think-it-will-work' attitude produces failures.

attitude.author: Henry Kissinger
attitude.text: The attitude of the West and of Russia towards a crisis like Ukraine is diametrically different. The West is trying to establish the legality of any established border. For Russia, Ukraine is part of the Russian patrimony.

attitude.author: Ani DiFranco
attitude.text: When I first started writing songs and being very explicit, it was hard, but one of the main things people respond to in my writing is that 'just say it' attitude of my songs. There really is nothing personal or private; it's all universal, if you can just find the courage to be open about your life.

attitude.author: Richard LaGravenese
attitude.text: How do you survive living in a cell knowing you are innocent? Many of those exonerated whom I have met seem to have a more benign, grateful attitude toward life than those of us who walk free. Many find a religious or spiritual stronghold.

attitude.author: Jez Butterworth
attitude.text: My father got a trade union scholarship to Oxford; he lived and breathed politics; he was always watching current-affairs programmes. But I have a five-year-old child's attitude towards the news. Mainly, that it absolutely turns me off.

attitude.author: David Stern
attitude.text: You walk into the playgrounds in Shanghai and Beijing, and you see youngsters who are shorter, shaking and baking and having attitude. And Jeremy Lin is going to inspire all of them.

attitude.author: Dean Cain
attitude.text: Hollywood's a very weird place. I think there's less of everything except for attitude.

attitude.author: Jeffrey Archer
attitude.text: I think my attitude to human beings has changed since leaving prison.

attitude.author: George Herbert Mead
attitude.text: To so enter into it in nature and art that the enjoyed meanings of life may become a part of living is the attitude of aesthetic appreciation.

attitude.author: Naveen Jain
attitude.text: In the business world today, failure is apparently not an option. We need to change this attitude toward failure - and celebrate the idea that only by falling on our collective business faces do we learn enough to succeed down the road.

attitude.author: Andrew Weil
attitude.text: Gardening is not trivial. If you believe that it is, closely examine why you feel that way. You may discover that this attitude has been forced upon you by mass media and the crass culture it creates and maintains. The fact is, gardening is just the opposite - it is, or should be, a central, basic expression of human life.

attitude.author: Ambrose Bierce
attitude.text: We submit to the majority because we have to. But we are not compelled to call our attitude of subjection a posture of respect.

attitude.author: Mel B
attitude.text: Look, everything that you experience as a kid is the foundation of how you are today. I was brought up in a working class family in Leeds and when it comes to money both my parents worked hard and instilled the same attitude into me.

attitude.author: Mike Love
attitude.text: I know there's millions of problems in the world, but if you dwell on those, then you're going to be miserable. I think my meditation helps me to transcend and get beyond the grip of all the negativity and regenerate from within a more positive attitude, which comes in very handy when you're going to do 150 concerts a year.

attitude.author: James Mercer
attitude.text: Maybe it's just parenthood that puts you in a situation where you just have to develop a new attitude, I guess, about things.

attitude.author: Joyce Meyer
attitude.text: Choosing an attitude of faith will release peace out of your spirit and into your soul.

attitude.author: Steve Vai
attitude.text: Along with its enchanting and exquisite melodies, West Side Story has attitude and a tremendous amount of frenetic energy. It's emotional, theatrical and technical. It's everything.

attitude.author: Jimmy Carter
attitude.text: I separated from the Southern Baptists when they adopted the discriminatory attitude towards women, because I believe what Paul taught in Galatians that there is no distinction in God's eyes between men and women, slaves and masters, Jews and non-Jews - everybody is created equally in the eyes of God.

attitude.author: Pope Francis
attitude.text: Vanity, showing off, is an attitude that reduces spirituality to a worldly thing, which is the worst sin that could be committed in the church.

attitude.author: Simon Cowell
attitude.text: Money brings you security and choice. You can make decisions in a different way if you have a lot of money. But when you have nothing, you have a naivety, and a more fearless attitude because you have nothing to lose.

attitude.author: Joe Penny
attitude.text: I'm not changing because I'm part of a hit. People around me have changed in their attitude toward me, but I haven't changed. And I won't.

attitude.author: Michael Korda
attitude.text: The purely agitation attitude is not good enough for a detailed consideration of a subject.

attitude.author: Joel Osteen
attitude.text: People in tough times - it doesn't mean they don't have a great attitude.

attitude.author: Mike Judge
attitude.text: I don't return anybody's calls unless it's going to mean extra money for me. And I've completely cut off all relationships with any friends that I had before the show. And I've copped an attitude.

attitude.author: Charles Bock
attitude.text: In English, I never did the reading when it was assigned. If a paper was due on Friday, my attitude was, read half the book on Tuesday, the second half on Wednesday, and write the paper Thursday night. Sometimes, I'd just read the Cliff's Notes and skip the book altogether.

attitude.author: Megan Boone
attitude.text: I'm allergic to attitude.

attitude.author: Robert Evans
attitude.text: When a parent shows up with an attitude of entitlement, understand that under it is a boatload of anxiety.

attitude.author: Steven Spielberg
attitude.text: You can't start a movie by having the attitude that the script is finished, because if you think the script is finished, your movie is finished before the first day of shooting.

attitude.author: Jocko Willink
attitude.text: We named the book 'Extreme Ownership' because we really found that when we looked at not only at leaders but at teams that were the most successful, we found that the ones that had this attitude of extreme ownership were the ones that did the best, and it's definitely an attitude that I had.

attitude.author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee
attitude.text: My denial and irresponsible attitude about asthma put me at great risk and caused me so much needless suffering. My hope is that the kids I talk to learn to open up about their asthma, become educated about their condition, and seek help.

attitude.author: Pat Riley
attitude.text: There's always the motivation of wanting to win. Everybody has that. But a champion needs, in his attitude, a motivation above and beyond winning.

attitude.author: E. F. Schumacher
attitude.text: An attitude to life which seeks fulfillment in the single-minded pursuit of wealth - in short, materialism - does not fit into this world, because it contains within itself no limiting principle, while the environment in which it is placed is strictly limited.

attitude.author: Abhishek Bachchan
attitude.text: I'm not a model; hence I don't see the reason to have a six-pack abs. I can pull off a tough and rugged look of a cop in 'Dhoom' series without taking my shirt off. Cops don't have to move around without a shirt to flaunt their machismo. What makes the character of a cop stand out is his attitude and not his six-pack abs.

attitude.author: E. P. Thompson
attitude.text: I think that the U.S. does have this very much more open attitude, and I admire it very much and I think it's very important to the world. But the information and the discussion sometimes come too late, after the effective decision has been made.

attitude.author: Karan Johar
attitude.text: I am always acting, be at a party, at work or in office. My attitude changes from meeting to meeting, from being serious to intense to funny, depending on who is in the room.

attitude.author: Raf Simons
attitude.text: I couldn't go now to a brand that had a niche attitude like... gothic. I couldn't do that. Well, I could do it, but I wouldn't find it interesting, challenging.

attitude.author: John Wall
attitude.text: I had a real bad attitude after my dad passed of liver cancer. I was 9, and we were really close.

attitude.author: Steve Wynn
attitude.text: This generation... they have a different attitude. Instead of sitting and watching something, they want to be a part of it - they're very hedonistic and sensual.

attitude.author: Donald Judd
attitude.text: The attitude and capacity of the factory, the old metal table and the new ideas of the wooden furniture quickly and naturally suggested the possibility of metal furniture.

attitude.author: Kevin Plank
attitude.text: Your attitude is contagious.

attitude.author: Zubin Mehta
attitude.text: An American orchestra doesn't want to play more than it has to. I respectfully disagree with that attitude.

attitude.author: Mariella Frostrup
attitude.text: Quite honestly, if we do manage to destroy the planet with our devil-may-care attitude to natural resources, I'd suggest we leave, as a dossier in our defence, the collected letters to agony aunts and uncles down the generations. It would certainly prove that we weren't all bad!

attitude.author: Sonam Kapoor
attitude.text: I may not be the number one movie star, or my films might not be doing too good. I am grateful for what life has offered me. I have got a great family, parents are together, have a great sister, I get to holiday. All these things make me grateful towards life, for everything. I always say - have an attitude of gratitude.

attitude.author: Iker Casillas
attitude.text: I understand that some people might think differently, but my duty is to take confidence from playing well. And I'm convinced that with my attitude and ability, everything will go back to being the way it was before. That's what we all want. The Madrid fans and me.

attitude.author: Dustin Lance Black
attitude.text: Although my mom and I had often disagreed politically and personally, she'd led our family by example, instilling in us a can-do attitude that often defied reason - an optimism many would call foolish, ignorant, and naive, but an optimism that occasionally shocked our neighbors and our world with its brazen veracity.

attitude.author: Earl Nightingale
attitude.text: A great attitude does much more than turn on the lights in our worlds; it seems to magically connect us to all sorts of serendipitous opportunities that were somehow absent before the change.

attitude.author: Sue Wicks
attitude.text: Players should know that if you can't make the contribution of the winning shot, that your attitude every day when you come to practice, or the positive contribution you make through cheering and keeping up team morale, is just as important in the overall picture.

attitude.author: Rupert Murdoch
attitude.text: No one's going to be able to operate without a grounding in the basic sciences. Language would be helpful, although English is becoming increasingly international. And travel. You have to have a global attitude.

attitude.author: William Shatner
attitude.text: Over the years, I've become barraged by comments from people, such as, 'Beam me up, Scotty!' and I became defensive. I felt they were derisive and engendered an attitude. I am grateful for the success, but didn't want to be mocked.

attitude.author: Edgar Ramirez
attitude.text: I think that, in the end, the military behavior and intelligence services are not very different from each other. It's an attitude of hunters; they're observing the prey.

attitude.author: Michael Kinsley
attitude.text: In 1977, at least, he wished to have people believe that he shared and was proud of an attitude toward women that is not acceptable in a politician. In 2003, all he has said is that he doesn't remember the interview.

attitude.author: Matt Hancock
attitude.text: Entrepreneurship is not only about starting businesses but is an attitude to life.

attitude.author: George Takei
attitude.text: We have to remember that Putin was a member of the KGB. He has already demonstrated that kind of macho, dictatorial attitude. Russia has breached their pledge to uphold the Olympic charter. This is a great opportunity for the IOC to say we cannot, given the situation that exists currently, allow the Olympics to take place in Russia.

attitude.author: Bebe Buell
attitude.text: I think the term 'rock chick' is more about an attitude than an actual look.

attitude.author: James Garner
attitude.text: I think my attitude has always been to put food on the table.

attitude.author: Charles R. Swindoll
attitude.text: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.

attitude.author: Ritchie Blackmore
attitude.text: I was impressed by Hendrix. His attitude was brilliant. Even the way he walked was amazing.

attitude.author: William James
attitude.text: There must be something solemn, serious, and tender about any attitude which we denominate religious. If glad, it must not grin or snicker; if sad, it must not scream or curse.

attitude.author: Kim Cattrall
attitude.text: Have you seen some of the women - and the men - in Los Angeles? They pay surgeons to make them look completely different in the hope of finding their youth. But youth comes from within. If you have a young attitude, then that can show in your face, the way you walk and move.

attitude.author: Willem de Kooning
attitude.text: The attitude that nature is chaotic and that the artist puts order into it is a very absurd point of view, I think. All that we can hope for is to put some order into ourselves.

attitude.author: Walter Cronkite
attitude.text: Part of the new morality of the '60s and '70s is a new attitude toward homosexuality. The homosexual men and women have organized to fight for acceptance and respectability.

attitude.author: Kathleen Turner
attitude.text: Being a sex symbol has to do with an attitude, not looks. Most men think it's looks, most women know otherwise.

attitude.author: Christopher Nolan
attitude.text: I'm taking a bit of a wait-and-see attitude towards 3D.

attitude.author: Christian Bale
attitude.text: I met my grandfather just before he died, and it was the first time that I had seen Dad with a relative of his. It was interesting to see my own father as a son and the body language and alteration in attitude that comes with that, and it sort of changed our relationship for the better.

attitude.author: Dick Cheney
attitude.text: The Senator from Massachusetts has given us ample grounds to doubt the judgment and the attitude he brings to bear on vital issues of national security.

attitude.author: Terrence Malick
attitude.text: I film quite a bit of footage, then edit. Changes before your eyes, things you can do and things you can't. My attitude is always 'let it keep rolling.'

attitude.author: David Leitch
attitude.text: There are a lot of big action movies that we've worked on where the attitude has been, 'Let's just get through this scene.' Then you get those jumpy, what-were-they-thinking action sequences.

attitude.author: Wladimir Klitschko
attitude.text: All the champions - you go and ask Mike Tyson or Joe Louis, Rocky Marciano, Lennox Lewis and myself included, and I'm sorry for putting myself in line with all the other great names - but the champion's attitude is it doesn't matter who is in front of me, I am going to conquer this person and win the fight and knock the person out.

attitude.author: Mekhi Phifer
attitude.text: I grew up in a rough environment. You want to be strong and have your presence felt out there. That attitude reflects how people see you.

attitude.author: Octavia E. Butler
attitude.text: Every story I write adds to me a little, changes me a little, forces me to reexamine an attitude or belief, causes me to research and learn, helps me to understand people and grow.

attitude.author: Billy Idol
attitude.text: Part of the punk attitude was that you should project your music through your whole body... show your personality as much as possible.

attitude.author: Katrina Kaif
attitude.text: I have a very positive attitude in life. My insecurity, fear and need to know about tomorrow has fortunately eased. What is going to happen will happen anyway. So why break my head over it?

attitude.author: Stephane Rolland
attitude.text: I love a woman with a relaxed attitude.

attitude.author: Vernon A. Walters
attitude.text: Americans have always had an ambivalent attitude toward intelligence. When they feel threatened, they want a lot of it, and when they don't, they regard the whole thing as somewhat immoral.

attitude.author: Joyce Meyer
attitude.text: I want to look my best for God. So many people have the attitude that if you're a Christian you've got to dress bad, wear an old color, not do anything to your hair, have nothing. It's no wonder that Christianity is not very attractive. I mean, how many people do you know in a Western culture that's going to go, 'Yeah, give me some of that?'

attitude.author: Keith Flint
attitude.text: If you like energy, if you like attitude, if you like tough beats with black rhythms with a bit of soul and a bit of realness, come and check out the Prodigy.

attitude.author: William Griffith Wilson
attitude.text: We will see that our new attitude toward liquor has been given to us without any thought or effort on our part. It just comes! That is the miracle of it.

attitude.author: Christopher Lloyd
attitude.text: I had kind of an attitude, which was not uncommon in New York. Theater people who went to Hollywood to do sitcoms were selling out. That was the attitude. And I didn't really relish the idea of being cast in a sitcom, because I shared that attitude.

attitude.author: Tom Lehman
attitude.text: I think the attitude I was trying to learn myself was to really try hard, to give a great effort, to really care, and to let the results go where they are going to go. But at the same time, I don't have to be happy, and I shouldn't be happy, with less than my best.

attitude.author: Richard Hayne
attitude.text: Psychographics speaks more to an attitude, a lifestyle.

attitude.author: Jeffrey Gitomer
attitude.text: My readers and my audiences have turned into my followers. They are more than interested in what I have to say in the subjects of sales, loyalty, attitude, networking, business social media, and becoming a trusted advisor.

attitude.author: Edward Sapir
attitude.text: The attitude of independence toward a constructed language which all national speakers must adopt is really a great advantage, because it tends to make man see himself as the master of language instead of its obedient servant.

attitude.author: Craig Sager
attitude.text: If you're running around with a negative attitude all the time, you're going to feel down; you're going to have negative results.

attitude.author: Joel Parkinson
attitude.text: You tell your kids that no matter what, you set your goals and you go for them. Whatever it is you achieve, never give up. You want your kids to have that good attitude, the confidence, and the will power to believe in themselves.

attitude.author: June Jordan
attitude.text: That attitude that fighting is probably not fair, but you have to defend yourself anyway and damage the enemy, has been profoundly consequential as far as my political activism goes.

attitude.author: Evel Knievel
attitude.text: I like to help kids, work with kids in detention homes. Don't tell a kid what's right and wrong. He knows what's right and wrong. Find out what his attitude and his aptitude are; try to help him where he wants to go.

attitude.author: Nicole Trunfio
attitude.text: I truly love Australia; I miss Aussie kids and their attitude!

attitude.author: Ben Stokes
attitude.text: I love playing against these guys who have the same attitude to the game that I have.

attitude.author: Christie Brinkley
attitude.text: After the first miscarriage, I tried to take the attitude that it was my body's way of telling me that this pregnancy wasn't meant to be.

attitude.author: Jim Breuer
attitude.text: The energy of the metal is what I've always loved and the energy I do on stage with standup, I mean, I'm not Metallica, but I've always extremely attracted and driven by that energy and the thought-provoking lyrics and drive. That's an attitude every standup show I go in. I go in to crush your face.

attitude.author: Clarence Seedorf
attitude.text: Bolatelli is an exciting player, but his stupid attitude sometimes attracts attention from the crowd - nothing more, nothing less.

attitude.author: Herbert Read
attitude.text: The characteristic political attitude of today is not one of positive belief, but of despair.

attitude.author: Marianne Faithfull
attitude.text: France has been very good for me. It has given me a very worldly-cool attitude.

attitude.author: Laura Carmichael
attitude.text: The Twenties have this sort of attitude where you never know what's around the corner.

attitude.author: Ben Elliot
attitude.text: My father instilled in me an attitude that you couldn't really enjoy yourself unless you had done something to deserve it. So, my childhood was spent working on farms or local shops or, when I got older, in banks.

attitude.author: Timothy F. Cahill
attitude.text: I want to work with kids and help develop them, show them the right way, the right morals and attitude into how to become a better footballer. Australia has many different cultures but I'd like to bring in the indigenous style, bring their competitiveness, athleticism and raw ability into the frame.

attitude.author: Joel Osteen
attitude.text: I believe that when you think of the negative, and you get up discouraged - 'There's nothing good in my future' - I really believe it almost ties the hands of God. God works where there's an attitude of faith. I believe faith is all about hope.

attitude.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
attitude.text: Neither the Christian attitude of love for all mankind nor humane hopes for an organized society must cause us to forget that the 'human stratum' may not be homogeneous.

attitude.author: Peter Criss
attitude.text: For me, music is all about emotion and attitude.

attitude.author: Coretta Scott King
attitude.text: Non-violence is a permanent attitude we bring to the breakfast table and bring to bed at night.

beauty.author: Confucius
beauty.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.

beauty.author: Audrey Hepburn
beauty.text: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mode but the true beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows. The beauty of a woman grows with the passing years.

beauty.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
beauty.text: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.

beauty.author: John Ray
beauty.text: Beauty is power; a smile is its sword.

beauty.author: Charles Lamb
beauty.text: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.

beauty.author: Saint Augustine
beauty.text: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.

beauty.author: Ashley Smith
beauty.text: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.

beauty.author: Francis Bacon
beauty.text: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.

beauty.author: Laetitia Casta
beauty.text: Real beauty is to be true to oneself. That's what makes me feel good.

beauty.author: Conrad Hall
beauty.text: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.

beauty.author: Dante Alighieri
beauty.text: Beauty awakens the soul to act.

beauty.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
beauty.text: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.

beauty.author: Rabindranath Tagore
beauty.text: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

beauty.author: Anatole France
beauty.text: If the path be beautiful, let us not ask where it leads.

beauty.author: Anne Frank
beauty.text: I don't think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains.

beauty.author: Akhenaton
beauty.text: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.

beauty.author: Edmund Burke
beauty.text: Beauty is the promise of happiness.

beauty.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
beauty.text: People are like stained - glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.

beauty.author: Jawaharlal Nehru
beauty.text: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.

beauty.author: Jean Anouilh
beauty.text: Things are beautiful if you love them.

beauty.author: John Keats
beauty.text: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.

beauty.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
beauty.text: In life, as in art, the beautiful moves in curves.

beauty.author: Maria Mitchell
beauty.text: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.

beauty.author: Khalil Gibran
beauty.text: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.

beauty.author: Joan Collins
beauty.text: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.

beauty.author: Aristotle
beauty.text: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.

beauty.author: Alex Comfort
beauty.text: A women's greatest asset is her beauty.

beauty.author: Victor Hugo
beauty.text: To love beauty is to see light.

beauty.author: Jacqueline Bisset
beauty.text: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.

beauty.author: H. G. Wells
beauty.text: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.

beauty.author: Anne Roiphe
beauty.text: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.

beauty.author: Edgar Allan Poe
beauty.text: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.

beauty.author: David Hume
beauty.text: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.

beauty.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
beauty.text: The more often we see the things around us - even the beautiful and wonderful things - the more they become invisible to us. That is why we often take for granted the beauty of this world: the flowers, the trees, the birds, the clouds - even those we love. Because we see things so often, we see them less and less.

beauty.author: Socrates
beauty.text: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.

beauty.author: Juvenal
beauty.text: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.

beauty.author: Liv Tyler
beauty.text: There is no definition of beauty, but when you can see someone's spirit coming through, something unexplainable, that's beautiful to me.

beauty.author: Thomas Leonard
beauty.text: Integrity reveals beauty.

beauty.author: Maya Angelou
beauty.text: It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.

beauty.author: Leo Tolstoy
beauty.text: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.

beauty.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
beauty.text: Beauty is whatever gives joy.

beauty.author: Aldous Huxley
beauty.text: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.

beauty.author: Albert Camus
beauty.text: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.

beauty.author: Ovid
beauty.text: Beauty is a fragile gift.

beauty.author: George Meredith
beauty.text: A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power.

beauty.author: Emily Dickinson
beauty.text: Beauty is not caused. It is.

beauty.author: Kevyn Aucoin
beauty.text: Beauty has a lot to do with character.

beauty.author: Priscilla Presley
beauty.text: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.

beauty.author: Hosea Ballou
beauty.text: It is easy to be beautiful; it is difficult to appear so.

beauty.author: Ivana Trump
beauty.text: Gorgeous hair is the best revenge.

beauty.author: Groucho Marx
beauty.text: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.

beauty.author: Voltaire
beauty.text: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.

beauty.author: Walter Scott
beauty.text: Faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.

beauty.author: William Butler Yeats
beauty.text: I heard the old, old, men say 'all that's beautiful drifts away, like the waters.'

beauty.author: Havelock Ellis
beauty.text: The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw.

beauty.author: Alicia Machado
beauty.text: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.

beauty.author: Homer
beauty.text: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!

beauty.author: Albrecht Durer
beauty.text: What beauty is, I know not, though it adheres to many things.

beauty.author: Ernest Hemingway
beauty.text: You're beautiful, like a May fly.

beauty.author: Christopher Morley
beauty.text: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.

beauty.author: Julie Newmar
beauty.text: Ecstasy and beauty are eternal.

beauty.author: Emile Zola
beauty.text: I am little concerned with beauty or perfection. I don't care for the great centuries. All I care about is life, struggle, intensity.

beauty.author: Kurt Vonnegut
beauty.text: When a man becomes a writer, I think he takes on a sacred obligation to produce beauty and enlightenment and comfort at top speed.

beauty.author: W. H. Davies
beauty.text: As long as I love Beauty I am young.

beauty.author: Aaron Rodgers
beauty.text: The beauty of our country is that when it was founded that they took some time to lay out civil liberties in the first 10 Amendments - the Bill of Rights. I'm a firm believer in those civil liberties and the ability to have your own opinion.

beauty.author: Leon Battista Alberti
beauty.text: Beauty: the adjustment of all parts proportionately so that one cannot add or subtract or change without impairing the harmony of the whole.

beauty.author: Elie Wiesel
beauty.text: If I were in the government, I would persuade the prime minister to see the beauty in the fact that people see Israel as a haven - from their sadness to their hope.

beauty.author: Philip Rosenthal
beauty.text: Life is about travel, and beauty in life, the love we find, the joy we have the laughs we have together. That's what I'm dedicating the rest of my life to.

beauty.author: Thomas Carlyle
beauty.text: Secrecy is the element of all goodness; even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.

beauty.author: Francis Bacon
beauty.text: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.

beauty.author: Chris Rock
beauty.text: The thing that surprised me the most is just how much money women that weren't rich were paying for their hair. When you're in a beauty parlor in Harlem next to abandoned buildings and somebody's paying five grand for a weave, that's a bit much.

beauty.author: Evelyn Underhill
beauty.text: All things are perceived in the light of charity, and hence under the aspect of beauty; for beauty is simply reality seen with the eyes of love.

beauty.author: Mother Angelica
beauty.text: Each angel that God created was in himself a masterpiece. Each one possessed his own degree of intelligence and his own beauty.

beauty.author: Walter Pater
beauty.text: One of the most beautiful passages of Rousseau is that in the sixth book of Confessions, where he describes the awakening in him of the literary sense. Of such wisdom, the poetic passion, the desire of beauty, the love of art for its own sake, has most.

beauty.author: Alexander Alekhine
beauty.text: I believe that true beauty of chess is more than enough to satisfy all possible demands.

beauty.author: Saint Augustine
beauty.text: Love is the beauty of the soul.

beauty.author: Nia Jax
beauty.text: Our bodies are always going to change, and we might not always love that, but it really has nothing to do with true beauty. True beauty comes from within.

beauty.author: Tom Udall
beauty.text: The sport of horse racing which, at its best, showcases the majestic beauty of this animal and the athleticism of jockeys, has reached an alarming level of corruption and exploitation.

beauty.author: Kay Ivey
beauty.text: Alabama is a land of bountiful natural beauty, and our state and local trails are a means to experience and enjoy that outdoor splendor.

beauty.author: Isabeli Fontana
beauty.text: Being on an airplane a lot can dry out your skin, so it's important to bring a good mask to help refresh it. Also, I never go without SPF. It's one of the most important things to include in your daily beauty routine, no matter where you are in the world.

beauty.author: Joan Rivers
beauty.text: The ideal beauty is a fugitive which is never found.

beauty.author: Khalil Gibran
beauty.text: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.

beauty.author: Grimes
beauty.text: I like creating beauty out of scary things.

beauty.author: Rumi
beauty.text: Beauty surrounds us, but usually we need to be walking in a garden to know it.

beauty.author: Robert Green Ingersoll
beauty.text: Beauty is not all there is of poetry. It must contain the truth. It is not simply an oak, rude and grand, neither is it simply a vine. It is both. Around the oak of truth runs the vine of beauty.

beauty.author: Christie Brinkley
beauty.text: When you feel great, you emanate a certain energy that translates as beautiful. I don't care if you have the standard beauty or not; it's that X-factor that comes through, and the basis of that is good health.

beauty.author: Lynsey Addario
beauty.text: As a war correspondent and a mother, I've learned to live in two different realities... but it's my choice. I choose to live in peace and witness war - to experience the worst in people but to remember the beauty.

beauty.author: Fernando Botero
beauty.text: All my life, my girlfriends are always skinny. Beauty in art has nothing to do with beauty in reality. Why do you like primitive art? Because there is beauty in the deformity. Sometimes paintings that people consider realistic are not at all. Raphael figures look realistic, but in real life, they were deformed.

beauty.author: Arthur Cayley
beauty.text: As for everything else, so for a mathematical theory: beauty can be perceived but not explained.

beauty.author: Alice Morse Earle
beauty.text: Salem houses present to you a serene and dignified front, gracious yet reserved, not thrusting forward their choicest treasures to the eyes of passing strangers; but behind the walls of the houses, enclosed from public view, lie cherished gardens, full of the beauty of life.

beauty.author: Lucy Larcom
beauty.text: From the first opening of our eyes, it is the light that attracts us. We clutch aimlessly with our baby fingers at the gossamer-motes in the sunbeam, and we die reaching out after an ineffable blending of earthly and heavenly beauty which we shall never fully comprehend.

beauty.author: Ani DiFranco
beauty.text: Sometimes the beauty is easy. Sometimes you don't have to try at all. Sometimes you can hear the wind blow in a handshake. Sometimes there's poetry written right on the bathroom wall.

beauty.author: Gian Carlo Menotti
beauty.text: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.

beauty.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
beauty.text: So much has been said and sung of beautiful young girls, why doesn't somebody wake up to the beauty of old women.

beauty.author: Oscar Wilde
beauty.text: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.

beauty.author: Janelle Monae
beauty.text: I believe it's time that women truly owned their superpowers and used their beauty and strength to change the world around them.

beauty.author: Dennis Prager
beauty.text: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?

beauty.author: Maya Hawke
beauty.text: I want to tell stories that are true and that resonate and move people, that highlight both the tremendous beauty and ugliness available in the human experience.

beauty.author: Catriona Gray
beauty.text: Being a beauty queen was never on my radar.

beauty.author: Thornton Wilder
beauty.text: It is very necessary to have markers of beauty left in a world seemingly bent on making the most evil ugliness.

beauty.author: Liu Wen
beauty.text: People probably think I'm cute because I have dimples and am friendly and always smiling. But beauty is different. In Chinese, people say I have chi ze, which means aura or a strong sense of presentation. It's not about my look.

beauty.author: Benjamin Disraeli
beauty.text: Teach us that wealth is not elegance, that profusion is not magnificence, that splendor is not beauty.

beauty.author: Romesh Ranganathan
beauty.text: Having curry for breakfast is a thing of beauty.

beauty.author: Jessica Mendoza
beauty.text: The beauty of a game like softball is you're failing every day. You might have a .300 batting average, but you're still failing seven out of 10 times. But you're still good.

beauty.author: Chris Pine
beauty.text: I feel prematurely old. I'm actually having this major belated quarter-life crisis. I'm turning 30 in a couple of weeks. I've been thinking a lot about mortality. A lot about what I'm going to do with my life and how to enjoy it. One of the things I'm going to work on is being more spontaneous, letting go, embracing the beauty of come-what-may.

beauty.author: Umberto Eco
beauty.text: Beauty is boring because it is predictable.

beauty.author: John Constable
beauty.text: The landscape painter must walk in the fields with a humble mind. No arrogant man was ever permitted to see Nature in all her beauty.

beauty.author: Boris Johnson
beauty.text: The beauty and riddle in studying the motives of any politician is in trying to decide what is idealism and what is self-interest, and often we are left to conclude that the answer is a mixture of the two.

beauty.author: Andy Warhol
beauty.text: I always hear myself saying, 'She's a beauty!' or 'He's a beauty!' or 'What a beauty!' but I never know what I'm talking about.

beauty.author: Alfred Jarry
beauty.text: It is conventional to call 'monster' any blending of dissonant elements. I call 'monster' every original inexhaustible beauty.

beauty.author: Elias James Corey
beauty.text: To a synthetic chemist, the complex molecules of nature are as beautiful as any of her other creations. The perception of that beauty depends on the understanding of chemical structures and their transformations, and, as with a treasured work of art, deepens as the subject is studied, perhaps even to a level approaching romance.

beauty.author: Edward Steichen
beauty.text: Photography records the gamut of feelings written on the human face, the beauty of the earth and skies that man has inherited, and the wealth and confusion man has created. It is a major force in explaining man to man.

beauty.author: Cory Booker
beauty.text: The beauty of having your ego checked as many times as my ego was checked in Newark made me recognize how much I needed other people who were very different than me in order to get big things done.

beauty.author: Joshua Bell
beauty.text: We live in a very chaotic world that sometimes we - it just seems like a mess. One of the reasons why we listen to music, and to great classical music in particular, is that everything is in an order and in a place and has a beauty that you see in nature, that you see and that people look for when they look for God.

beauty.author: John Piper
beauty.text: The best news of the Christian gospel is that the supremely glorious Creator of the universe has acted in Jesus Christ's death and resurrection to remove every obstacle between us and himself so that we may find everlasting joy in seeing and savoring his infinite beauty.

beauty.author: Vince Gilligan
beauty.text: 'Breaking Bad'... the beauty of it is, some people are always going to love 'Breaking Bad' more. But I run into people every day now who say 'Better Call Saul' is their favorite of the two. I love hearing that. I don't know where I fall personally on that scale, that continuum - I try not to choose.

beauty.author: Piet Mondrian
beauty.text: Things are beautiful or ugly only in time and space. The new man's vision being liberated from these two factors, all is unified in one unique beauty.

beauty.author: James Dean
beauty.text: I also became close to nature, and am now able to appreciate the beauty with which this world is endowed.

beauty.author: Constantin Stanislavski
beauty.text: Do not try to push your way through to the front ranks of your profession; do not run after distinctions and rewards; but do your utmost to find an entry into the world of beauty.

beauty.author: Andrew Garfield
beauty.text: I sincerely want to help create beauty in the world and move a culture of separateness back towards community. I really, really do, and I think art is a powerful way of doing that.

beauty.author: William Cullen Bryant
beauty.text: A sculptor wields The chisel, and the stricken marble grows To beauty.

beauty.author: Charles Lindbergh
beauty.text: How long can men thrive between walls of brick, walking on asphalt pavements, breathing the fumes of coal and oil, growing, working, dying, with hardly a thought of wind, and sky, and fields of grain, seeing only machine-made beauty, the mineral-like quality of life?

beauty.author: Carrie-Anne Moss
beauty.text: Self-care is so much more than a beauty regimen or an external thing you do. It has to start within your heart to know what you need to navigate your life. A pedicure doesn't last, but meditating every day does.

beauty.author: Chrisette Michele
beauty.text: Truth is, I cut my hair for freedom, not for beauty.

beauty.author: Liam Neeson
beauty.text: For all of nature's wonder and beauty, it is also hostile and unpredictable.

beauty.author: Beyonce Knowles
beauty.text: If I weren't performing, I'd be a beauty editor or a therapist. I love creativity, but I also love to help others. My mother was a hairstylist, and they listen to everyone's problems - like a beauty therapist!

beauty.author: Comte de Lautreamont
beauty.text: Throughout the centuries, man has considered himself beautiful. I rather suppose that man only believes in his own beauty out of pride; that he is not really beautiful and he suspects this himself; for why does he look on the face of his fellow-man with such scorn?

beauty.author: Philomena Kwao
beauty.text: The curvy community has really given me a voice because people want to see someone who looks like they do. They want to know their beauty is valid.

beauty.author: Iris Apfel
beauty.text: I don't do very much for beauty. I use very simple things on my skin. I haven't got time. I would always get facials and then come home laden with product, and pay a lot of money and never use it. Anyway, one day a dermatologist told me to use Cetaphil to clean my face and as a moisturizer, and that's what I do.

beauty.author: Jean Paul
beauty.text: Beauty attracts us men; but if, like an armed magnet it is pointed, beside, with gold and silver, it attracts with tenfold power.

beauty.author: Eliza Farnham
beauty.text: The human face is the organic seat of beauty. It is the register of value in development, a record of Experience, whose legitimate office is to perfect the life, a legible language to those who will study it, of the majestic mistress, the soul.

beauty.author: Marina Abramovic
beauty.text: We make such terrible mistakes with visual choices about beauty.

beauty.author: James Hillman
beauty.text: Depression opens the door to beauty of some kind.

beauty.author: Westside Gunn
beauty.text: I come from Eastside Buffalo and prison cells. That's the beauty about hip-hop. It just brings everybody together.

beauty.author: Raza Murad
beauty.text: Jammu and Kashmir has a scenic beauty and I feel that the film industry rather than going abroad in countries like Switzerland and Australia, should visit Kashmir - which is the only Heaven on Earth for the shoots.

beauty.author: Victor Hugo
beauty.text: Great perils have this beauty, that they bring to light the fraternity of strangers.

beauty.author: Andre Breton
beauty.text: Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all.

beauty.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay
beauty.text: The English Bible - a book which, if everything else in our language should perish, would alone suffice to show the whole extent of its beauty and power.

beauty.author: Albrecht Durer
beauty.text: I hold that the perfection of form and beauty is contained in the sum of all men.

beauty.author: Thomas Jefferson
beauty.text: Wisdom I know is social. She seeks her fellows. But Beauty is jealous, and illy bears the presence of a rival.

beauty.author: Alice Coltrane
beauty.text: You're creating ' it comes from the heart, the spirit, the soul. You're not manufacturing somebody else's plan, somebody else's blueprint, somebody else's idea that's not yours. So when you're creating, that's the beauty side of art, you know? It comes from within you.

beauty.author: Frank Deford
beauty.text: Majesty is a thing of beauty to behold, whatever the particular enterprise.

beauty.author: Becca Kufrin
beauty.text: The Bahamas is a beautiful place, but half of that beauty is found in the clear warm ocean that surrounds the Islands.

beauty.author: Annie Besant
beauty.text: What, after all, is the object of education? To train the body in health, vigor and grace, so that it may express the emotions in beauty and the mind with accuracy and strength.

beauty.author: Princess Nokia
beauty.text: My definition of God is the highest supreme feeling of beauty and light and happiness.

beauty.author: Hannah Bronfman
beauty.text: I'm obsessed with the vegan beauty brand RMS - their concealer is amazing.

beauty.author: Lew Wallace
beauty.text: Beauty is altogether in the eye of the beholder.

beauty.author: Sarah Pinborough
beauty.text: We all love a bit of 'true love conquers all,' and when I started on 'Poison,' 'Charm' and 'Beauty,' that was one rule of the fairy tale formula that I didn't want to break.

beauty.author: Rebecca Gayheart
beauty.text: My beauty routine is basically plenty of sleep and lots of water.

beauty.author: John Muir
beauty.text: The more I see of deer, the more I admire them as mountaineers. They make their way into the heart of the roughest solitudes with smooth reserve of strength, through dense belts of brush and forest encumbered with fallen trees and boulder piles, across canons, roaring streams, and snow-fields, ever showing forth beauty and courage.

beauty.author: L'Wren Scott
beauty.text: Enhancing a woman's silhouette and enhancing a woman's beauty - both contribute to enhancing her confidence, so they're synonymous, really.

beauty.author: Amanda de Cadenet
beauty.text: When I look at a woman through my camera, I see her with complete admiration and appreciation of her beauty, strength, and power - and that's how I do my best to represent her.

beauty.author: Honore de Balzac
beauty.text: Children, dear and loving children, can alone console a woman for the loss of her beauty.

beauty.author: Bettany Hughes
beauty.text: Venus, ancient goddess of love and beauty, is an apparently irrelevant, invented deity of the long dead. But Venus merits scrutiny. Chart her life story across 5,000 years and you chart the evolution of our conflicted relationship with sex and with the female body.

beauty.author: George Sand
beauty.text: The beauty that addresses itself to the eyes is only the spell of the moment; the eye of the body is not always that of the soul.

beauty.author: Michael J. Knowles
beauty.text: Beauty is not generic, bland, and clinical. It isn't all things to all people. The Cathedral of Notre Dame in its endlessly intricate detail was beautiful. Modern office buildings are not.

beauty.author: Ouida
beauty.text: Familiarity is a magician that is cruel to beauty but kind to ugliness.

beauty.author: Helena Christensen
beauty.text: There will always be a desire for something new, fresh and innovative, as well as a yearning and respect for timeless elegance and beauty.

beauty.author: Priyanka Chopra
beauty.text: Beauty and fashion are not really local anymore. You really have to be a global citizen to know what trends are. Now, it's pretty much the same designers and the same kind of trends, whether I am in New York, Milan, or Mumbai - it's the same.

beauty.author: Mstislav Rostropovich
beauty.text: People are craving this great progress in electronics, going after computers, the Internet, etc. It's a giant progress technologically. But they must have a balance of soul, a balance for human beauty. That means art has an important role.

beauty.author: Shonda Rhimes
beauty.text: The beauty of being a feminist is that you get to be whatever you want. And that's the point.

beauty.author: Marc Jacobs
beauty.text: I don't love Photoshop; I like imperfection. It doesn't mean ugly. I love a girl with a gap between her teeth, versus perfect white veneers. Perfection is just... boring. Perfect is what's natural or real; that is beauty.

beauty.author: Amanda Schull
beauty.text: The worst beauty advice that I have ever taken has been from people who have told me that sunscreen isn't necessary. Not true!

beauty.author: Elliott Erwitt
beauty.text: I appreciate simplicity, true beauty that lasts over time, and a little wit and eclecticism that make life more fun.

beauty.author: Julia Margaret Cameron
beauty.text: I longed to arrest all beauty that came before me, and at length the longing has been satisfied.

beauty.author: Lucien Bourjeily
beauty.text: If you want to get into the shoes of someone, it's not just about seeing and hearing. It is also about what you touch and what you smell. Smell is so specific and so powerful. And this is the beauty of immersive theatre - it's something you cannot get in any other art form. I think this is the real future for theatre.

beauty.author: Liz Cheney
beauty.text: In Wyoming, the beauty of our mountains is matched only by the grit of our people.

beauty.author: Yuna
beauty.text: Embrace the color of your skin and your own beauty.

beauty.author: Colin Quinn
beauty.text: That's the beauty of being a comedian - it's the one job you're allowed to do that. We're lucky. We're really lucky.

beauty.author: Matthew Arnold
beauty.text: Poetry; a criticism of life under the conditions fixed for such a criticism by the laws of poetic truth and poetic beauty.

beauty.author: Lorraine Hansberry
beauty.text: I am a writer. I suppose I think that the highest gift that man has is art, and I am audacious enough to think of myself as an artist - that there is both joy and beauty and illumination and communion between people to be achieved through the dissection of personality.

beauty.author: Doris Day
beauty.text: Well I do find the beauty in animals. I find beauty everywhere. I find beauty in my garden.

beauty.author: Eva Chen
beauty.text: Beauty is the lowest common denominator: I don't care what they say - every girl, every woman, wants to feel pretty and empowered and beautiful, within their own definition of beautiful. I love fashion, I love shopping, but I love beauty more because I love the science of it.

beauty.author: David Hume
beauty.text: Beauty, whether moral or natural, is felt, more properly than perceived.

beauty.author: John Keats
beauty.text: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.

beauty.author: Mickalene Thomas
beauty.text: Beauty has always been an element of discussion for black women, whether or not we were the ones having the conversation.

beauty.author: John Philip Sousa
beauty.text: Grand opera is the most powerful of stage appeals and that almost entirely through the beauty of music.

beauty.author: Gerard Butler
beauty.text: I was amazed and upset by the looks I got just walking around the studio... It illuminates the ugliness and the beauty that exists within each of us, and that's what this story represents to me.

beauty.author: Taboo
beauty.text: That's the beauty of Black Eyed Peas, we don't pigeonhole ourselves into just one category. We're the chameleons of hip-hop.

beauty.author: Alice Greczyn
beauty.text: As we all know, there is inner beauty and outer beauty. If we examine inner beauty, to me there is nothing more beautiful than inner peace, in a man or a woman.

beauty.author: John C. Maxwell
beauty.text: Talent grips us. We are overtaken by the beauty of Michelangelo's sculpture, riveted by Mariah Carey's angelic voice, doubled over in laughter by the comedy of Robin Williams, and captivated by the on screen performances of Denzel Washington.

beauty.author: Phoebe Tonkin
beauty.text: Natural beauty products are a must! I use coconut oil-based RMS makeup, and I slather almond oil on my hands to soak while I watch a movie.

beauty.author: Sowcar Janaki
beauty.text: My sister was the glamourous one and her movies portrayed her beauty and glamour. As a person, she has enormous patience and has single-handedly supported my mother and my siblings. I have always admired her loyalty to the family.

beauty.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
beauty.text: I have been overcome by the beauty and richness of our life together, those early mornings setting out, those evenings gleaming with rivers and lakes below us, still holding the last light.

beauty.author: Richard Armour
beauty.text: Beauty is only skin deep, and the world is full of thin skinned people.

beauty.author: Walter Hagen
beauty.text: It is the addition of strangeness to beauty that constitutes the romantic character in art.

beauty.author: Kevyn Aucoin
beauty.text: Today I see beauty everywhere I go, in every face I see, in every single soul.

beauty.author: Francois Nars
beauty.text: Find your own way, have an open spirit, and believe in your own beauty.

beauty.author: Caterina Murino
beauty.text: My favourite animal is the koala, but his life would be boring. I would rather be a giraffe so that I could contemplate the beauty of Africa.

beauty.author: Jerry Saltz
beauty.text: Abstraction brings the world into more complex, variable relations; it can extract beauty, alternative topographies, ugliness, and intense actualities from seeming nothingness.

beauty.author: Bette Midler
beauty.text: A lot of people have no access to beauty. When I was growing up, my mother had only a few pretty things to look at.

beauty.author: William Shenstone
beauty.text: Grandeur and beauty are so very opposite, that you often diminish the one as you increase the other. Variety is most akin to the latter, simplicity to the former.

beauty.author: JR
beauty.text: The beauty of an art project is that you cannot always measure the impact, but one day it can become clear.

beauty.author: Charles Baudelaire
beauty.text: An artist is an artist only because of his exquisite sense of beauty, a sense which shows him intoxicating pleasures, but which at the same time implies and contains an equally exquisite sense of all deformities and all disproportion.

beauty.author: Erin O'Connor
beauty.text: I am concerned about ageism and the loss of beauty - the perception that as you grow older, you 'lose your looks,' which I think is diabolical.

beauty.author: Roberto Benigni
beauty.text: I'm a storyteller: the crux of the matter is to reach beauty, poetry; it doesn't matter if that is comedy or tragedy. They're the same if you reach the beauty.

beauty.author: Edward Witten
beauty.text: One of the basic things about a string is that it can vibrate in many different shapes or forms, which gives music its beauty.

beauty.author: Mattie Stepanek
beauty.text: People are fighting over how our heartsongs are different. But they don't need to be the same. That's the beauty. We are a mosaic of gifts. Each of us has our inner beauty no matter how we look.

beauty.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
beauty.text: In particular I want to talk about natural black hair, and how it's not just hair. I mean, I'm interested in hair in sort of a very aesthetic way, just the beauty of hair, but also in a political way: what it says, what it means.

beauty.author: Isla Fisher
beauty.text: Being proud of who we are as people is more important than cutting into ourselves to create this false idea of beauty.

beauty.author: Fan Bingbing
beauty.text: I always carry lip balm and lipstick. Lipstick is a very important beauty product because I find that lips are the most beautiful feature of anyone's face.

beauty.author: Morgan Wootten
beauty.text: That's the beauty of coaching. You get to touch lives, you get to make a difference. You get to do things for people who will never pay you back and they say you never have had a perfect day until you've done something for someone who will never pay you back.

beauty.author: Miuccia Prada
beauty.text: Fashion fosters cliches of beauty, but I want to tear them apart.

beauty.author: Anthony Kiedis
beauty.text: It seems like the chaos of this world is accelerating, but so is the beauty in the consciousness of more and more people.

beauty.author: Ekta Kapoor
beauty.text: The beauty about history is that it's open to perception.

beauty.author: Chrissy Metz
beauty.text: Size doesn't equate to beauty. I don't understand why that's a thing. Well, I do, because the media has told us thin is beautiful. But is it?

beauty.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
beauty.text: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.

beauty.author: Deb Haaland
beauty.text: Like many New Mexicans, I enjoy spending time outdoors and understand how important New Mexico's natural beauty and resources are.

beauty.author: Lindsay Wagner
beauty.text: Once you go inside and weed through the muck, you will find the real beauty, the truth about yourself.

beauty.author: Oscar Wilde
beauty.text: If a work of art is rich and vital and complete, those who have artistic instincts will see its beauty, and those to whom ethics appeal more strongly than aesthetics will see its moral lesson. It will fill the cowardly with terror, and the unclean will see in it their own shame.

beauty.author: Edgar Allan Poe
beauty.text: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.

beauty.author: Ally Brooke
beauty.text: My Barbie doll is definitely a reflection of me and my personality. My doll is so detailed, she even has my same beauty marks.

beauty.author: Max Roach
beauty.text: Jazz is a very democratic musical form. It comes out of a communal experience. We take our respective instruments and collectively create a thing of beauty.

beauty.author: Gregory Porter
beauty.text: You could spend your time with your nose buried in a guidebook, but Amsterdam really is best explored on foot, so you can stumble upon the city's hidden gems. The architecture and the beauty of some of the buildings is also wonderful.

beauty.author: Franz Kafka
beauty.text: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.

beauty.author: Greg Lynn
beauty.text: What's interesting about architects is, we always have tried to justify beauty by looking to nature, and arguably, beautiful architecture has always been looking at a model of nature.

beauty.author: Yves Saint Laurent
beauty.text: When I was young in the 1960s, all the world watched the youth. Everywhere was the sensation of wanting to break the chains but to do something beautiful. It is my privilege to have beauty always near me.

beauty.author: Michelle Phan
beauty.text: Just like hair frames our face, brows frame our eyes. I see so much potential in harmonized beauty whenever I see a woman who's not filling in her brows, and I just want to go in with my brow pencil and just be like, 'Filling in eyebrows, OK, done - look in the mirror and be inspired.' That's one of my pet peeves, but beauty is subjective.

beauty.author: Melina Matsoukas
beauty.text: It's important for women to embrace their beauty and sexuality. Females are victimized and made to feel ashamed of their bodies, or they can't be smart and beautiful, and I try to work against that.

beauty.author: Moses Mendelssohn
beauty.text: Instead, it appears to be a particular mark of beauty that it is considered with tranquil satisfaction; that it pleases if we also do not possess it and we are still far removed from demanding to possess it.

beauty.author: Paul Watson
beauty.text: I have been honoured to serve the whales, dolphins, seals - and all the other creatures on this Earth. Their beauty, intelligence, strength, and spirit have inspired me.

beauty.author: Shaun White
beauty.text: I think everybody can agree that you can hear a certain song and it will put you in a certain mood, and that's just the beauty of music and I am so inspired by that.

beauty.author: Edwin Markham
beauty.text: Use and beauty - these should be the ends of all human effort. But the competitive struggle swings us away from this high ground and plunges us into a quagmire fight for cheap goods and cheap labor.

beauty.author: Jeffree Star
beauty.text: I always keep a damp beauty blender and a powder compact in my purse, and I touch up a lot.

beauty.author: Gaston Bachelard
beauty.text: A special kind of beauty exists which is born in language, of language, and for language.

beauty.author: Imelda Marcos
beauty.text: People say I'm extravagant because I want to be surrounded by beauty. But tell me, who wants to be surrounded by garbage?

beauty.author: Mary McDonnell
beauty.text: We have to get back to the beauty of just being alive in this present moment.

beauty.author: Flume
beauty.text: I think Sydney has so much natural beauty; it's just a beautiful city.

beauty.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
beauty.text: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.

beauty.author: Hugh Jackman
beauty.text: The first show I ever did, singing and dancing, was 'Beauty and the Beast.' I was playing Gaston. Gaston has red tights, knee high boots, and it's very physical. I had headaches every day for two months.

beauty.author: Justin Cronin
beauty.text: My theory of characterization is basically this: Put some dirt on a hero, and put some sunshine on the villain, one brush stroke of beauty on the villain.

beauty.author: Marilyn Monroe
beauty.text: Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour; it's based on femininity.

beauty.author: Socrates
beauty.text: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.

beauty.author: George Herbert Mead
beauty.text: The beauty of a face is not a separate quality but a relation or proportion of qualities to each other.

beauty.author: Liv Tyler
beauty.text: Solitude has its own very strange beauty to it.

beauty.author: Rabindranath Tagore
beauty.text: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.

beauty.author: Polykarp Kusch
beauty.text: Science shows us truth and beauty and fills each day with a fresh wonder of the exquisite order which governs our world.

beauty.author: Dean Haglund
beauty.text: The beauty of any conspiracy theory is that because it can't be proved, that just makes it more 'real.' It's not a question of believing or not believing, really; it's more a question of just accepting a series of probabilities that lead to an undeniable conclusion.

beauty.author: Meryl Streep
beauty.text: I didn't have any confidence in my beauty when I was young. I felt like a character actress, and I still do.

beauty.author: Winnie Harlow
beauty.text: I love to play with make-up. I adapt my beauty look to my outfit, so as soon as I know what I'm wearing, I know if I want to go for a red lip or a smoky eye. I usually won't put those two together, but it all depends on what outfit I'm going for.

beauty.author: Stone Gossard
beauty.text: I think it's evident that expensive neighborhoods in Seattle are surrounded by natural beauty. That elevates city life. So if we can make cities more attractive in the long run, we can be smarter about issues like development, zoning and economics.

beauty.author: Joan Collins
beauty.text: We live in a quick-fix society where we need instant gratification for everything. Too fat? Get lipo-sucked. Stringy hair? Glue on extensions. Wrinkles and lines? Head to the beauty shop for a pot of the latest miracle skin stuff. It's all a beautiful £1 billion con foisted upon insecure women by canny cosmetic conglomerates.

beauty.author: William Hazlitt
beauty.text: Grace in women has more effect than beauty.

beauty.author: Lauren Bacall
beauty.text: I don't look in the mirror; don't like what I see; never have. I am not my idea of a beauty. Never was. This is not false modesty. I've just never been enamoured of my face, which of course is magnified umpteen times on screen.

beauty.author: Janis Ian
beauty.text: I learned the truth at seventeen, That love was meant for beauty queens, And high school girls with clear skinned smiles, Who married young and then retired.

beauty.author: Joy Harjo
beauty.text: I don't see the desert as barren at all; I see it as full and ripe. It doesn't need to be flattered with rain. It certainly needs rain, but it does with what it has, and creates amazing beauty.

beauty.author: Maryse Mizanin
beauty.text: I am a natural beauty. I can wear sweatpants and running shoes and I stop traffic on the street - people have accidents when they drive and they spot me.

beauty.author: Phyllis Diller
beauty.text: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.

beauty.author: Alessandro Michele
beauty.text: Fashion should be genderless; how people perceive the idea of beauty can vary from one to another.

beauty.author: Boris Pasternak
beauty.text: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.

beauty.author: Jodie Evans
beauty.text: I feel truth, beauty, love, grief, anger, intimacy & alive in my body... Women in the global south live in their bodies much more than we in the global north. Not as distracted by patriarchy's controlling images - They know power is in their bodies. I am deeply grateful for the women who showed me the way home.

beauty.author: Shanina Shaik
beauty.text: Look after yourself from within, and your beauty will shine through on your skin.

beauty.author: Naomi Wolf
beauty.text: No matter what a woman's appearance may be, it will be used to undermine what she is saying and taken to individualize - as her personal problem - observations she makes about the beauty myth in society.

beauty.author: Michelangelo
beauty.text: If in my youth I had realized that the sustaining splendour of beauty of with which I was in love would one day flood back into my heart, there to ignite a flame that would torture me without end, how gladly would I have put out the light in my eyes.

beauty.author: Fred MacMurray
beauty.text: Just because a woman is beautiful doesn't mean she can't be a good wife. If her beauty affects her personality, then it's her mentality that's at fault... not the tilt of her nose.

beauty.author: Virginia Woolf
beauty.text: The beautiful seems right by force of beauty, and the feeble wrong because of weakness.

beauty.author: Banks
beauty.text: My approach to beauty is all about moods. If you want to feel sexy, if you want to feel feminine or, I don't know, boyish - it's all about how you feel at that point in time. My mood changes.

beauty.author: Jean-Luc Godard
beauty.text: Beauty is composed of an eternal, invariable element whose quantity is extremely difficult to determine, and a relative element which might be, either by turns or all at once, period, fashion, moral, passion.

beauty.author: Catriona Gray
beauty.text: Let's cultivate an environment, not just in beauty pageants but in society in general, where we argue like we're right but listen like we're wrong.

beauty.author: George Santayana
beauty.text: The lover knows much more about absolute good and universal beauty than any logician or theologian, unless the latter, too, be lovers in disguise.

beauty.author: Langston Hughes
beauty.text: Beauty for some provides escape, who gain a happiness in eyeing the gorgeous buttocks of the ape or Autumn sunsets exquisitely dying.

beauty.author: Kelly Rowland
beauty.text: It took a long while for me to know that I'm beautiful. I remember going through this phase when I was younger of wanting to pass by mirrors and not look at them. That was so ridiculous. I've learned now that beauty starts from within.

beauty.author: Alek Wek
beauty.text: Beauty is subjective and should not be limited to only what we see on the outside.

beauty.author: Travis Bradberry
beauty.text: The beauty of social awareness is that a few simple adjustments to what you say can vastly improve your relationships with other people.

beauty.author: Martha Beck
beauty.text: Standards of beauty are arbitrary. Body shame exists only to the extent that our physiques don't match our own beliefs about how we should look.

beauty.author: Brie Larson
beauty.text: In my personal opinion, you miss out on the beauty of the moment if you go in planning what the moment is. It's like having a vacation too jam-packed with activities. You miss all of the sunsets.

beauty.author: Amanda Shires
beauty.text: Because the beauty of songs, I think, is if you do it right a lot of people can relate to it in their own way and make their own meaning out of things.

beauty.author: Anton Corbijn
beauty.text: I have never understood models. I find it really hard to find beauty in that or to discover beauty because the beauty was so obvious.

beauty.author: Alessandra Ambrosio
beauty.text: One of my favorite beauty products is Vincent Longo Water Canvas creamy blush. I have it in every color and I've been using it for 5 years and that's all I put on when I leave the house. It looks so natural I just put a little bit on my cheeks to give them some color.

beauty.author: Christian Louboutin
beauty.text: Cinderella is not only an iconic character when it comes to beauty, grace and fairytale love, but also shoes.

beauty.author: Maria Mitchell
beauty.text: We especially need imagination in science. It is not all mathematics, nor all logic, but it is somewhat beauty and poetry.

beauty.author: Miranda Kerr
beauty.text: When I pray, I always thank Mother Nature for all the beauty in the world. It's about having an attitude of gratitude.

beauty.author: Faith Hill
beauty.text: I think beauty comes from within. If you're happy and look at life in the best way you can, even when there are problems, it can make you beautiful on the outside.

beauty.author: David Linley
beauty.text: I've seen that, over the centuries, India has still got its passion and its soul. Wherever you go, people have such inner strength and beauty.

beauty.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
beauty.text: Obscenity, which is ever blasphemy against the divine beauty in life, is a monster for which the corruption of society forever brings forth new food, which it devours in secret.

beauty.author: Louie Schwartzberg
beauty.text: Beauty and seduction, I believe, is nature's tool for survival, because we will protect what we fall in love with.

beauty.author: Marie Curie
beauty.text: We should not allow it to be believed that all scientific progress can be reduced to mechanisms, machines, gearings, even though such machinery also has its beauty. Neither do I believe that the spirit of adventure runs any risk of disappearing in our world.

beauty.author: Guillermo del Toro
beauty.text: There is art and beauty and power in the primal images of fantasy.

beauty.author: Naya Rivera
beauty.text: I will admit to hoarding beauty products. I'm a beauty lady.

beauty.author: Mario Cuomo
beauty.text: The beauty of America is that I don't have to deny my past to affirm my present. No one does. We can love this nation like a parent and still embrace our ancestral home like cherished grandparents.

beauty.author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola
beauty.text: But, when the work was finished, the Craftsman kept wishing that there were someone to ponder the plan of so great a work, to love its beauty, and to wonder at its vastness.

beauty.author: Celine Dion
beauty.text: There's no such thing is aging, but maturing and knowledge. It's beautiful, I call that beauty.

beauty.author: Morten Harket
beauty.text: I do love beauty. I love beautiful tilings. I grow orchids and collect butterflies. But when it comes to relationships, you have to find the person inside.

beauty.author: Nayeon
beauty.text: Beauty is what I believe in. I want to act and make decisions based on what I believe.

beauty.author: Thomas Mann
beauty.text: For I must tell you that we artists cannot tread the path of Beauty without Eros keeping company with us and appointing himself as our guide.

beauty.author: Emily Mortimer
beauty.text: Los Angeles is like a beauty parlor at the end of the universe.

beauty.author: Simone Weil
beauty.text: Humanism was not wrong in thinking that truth, beauty, liberty, and equality are of infinite value, but in thinking that man can get them for himself without grace.

beauty.author: Marina and the Diamonds
beauty.text: Even when I see a beautiful woman, I think, 'Aw, her life must be amazing.' Everyone does it. That's human nature to believe that beauty is everything.

beauty.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
beauty.text: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.

beauty.author: Maryam Mirzakhani
beauty.text: You have to spend some energy and effort to see the beauty of math.

beauty.author: Carre Otis
beauty.text: I'm proud that today, at 43 years old, I've come to value the aging process and focus on inner rather than outer beauty.

beauty.author: Rudolf Otto
beauty.text: A child does not notice the greatness and the beauty of nature and the splendor of God in his works.

beauty.author: Kate Winslet
beauty.text: The happiness I feel in having a family has brought me a real beauty.

beauty.author: Rita Levi-Montalcini
beauty.text: I say to the young, be happy that you were born in Italy because of the beauty of the human capital, both masculine and feminine, of this country... No other country has such human capital.

beauty.author: Francois Nars
beauty.text: My mother never wore much make-up, and she was a kind of natural beauty; she knew just how to enhance what she had.

beauty.author: Albert Camus
beauty.text: The artist forges himself to the others, midway between the beauty he cannot do without and the community he cannot tear himself away from. That is why true artists scorn nothing: they are obliged to understand rather than to judge.

beauty.author: Moshe Safdie
beauty.text: Beauty connotes humanity. We call a natural object beautiful because we see that its form expresses fitness, the perfect fulfillment of function.

beauty.author: Erin Heatherton
