dreams.text: Never in my wildest dreams I thought I would work with Dharmendra sir. I remember the first selfie I took with him, I posted on our family WhatsApp group. My father couldn't stop beaming with joy. I could feel it. Everytime I see them proud, it makes everything so worth it.

dreams.author: Maximillian Degenerez
dreams.text: No wishes are silly, no dreams remain dreams, for those committed to clear and definitive goals.

dreams.author: Ben Simmons
dreams.text: I was in school to play basketball; I wasn't trying to be a doctor. It's hard to talk about the NCAA rules and everything that happened in the past because I've just been focused on practicing and getting ready... I was trying to reach my dreams, and that's to play in the NBA.

dreams.author: Ellen Goodman
dreams.text: Those inevitable dreams where you can't get your column in, you know, and at first they were the Xerox telecopy, and then they were the fax machine, and then they were, you know, email. The anxiety remains the same, but the technology has changed.

dreams.author: Joe Calzaghe
dreams.text: Every fighter, when they box, wants to leave a mark in their sport, or a legacy, and I managed to do that beyond my wildest dreams.

dreams.author: Martin Garrix
dreams.text: I want to show everyone that if you pursue your dreams, they can come true no matter what. That's what I want to do.

dreams.author: Kim Elizabeth
dreams.text: My imagination completely controls me, and forever feeds the fire that burns with dark red light in my heart by bringing me the best dreams. I've always had a wild imagination, a big heart and a tortured soul so I feel that dark fantasy, love and horror are in my blood.

dreams.author: Megan Rapinoe
dreams.text: My mom, whether it's right or wrong, she had dreams for me to have a certain life. It takes time to get used to that. But they've been really supportive, and they love me for exactly who I am.

dreams.author: Clarence Seedorf
dreams.text: Everyone dreams of winning a European Cup final, and I was lucky to do it at just 19.

dreams.author: Jonny Kim
dreams.text: Going into the Navy was the best decision I ever made in my life because it completely transformed that scared boy who didn't have any dreams to someone who started to believe in himself.

dreams.author: Luvvie Ajayi
dreams.text: I am a firm believe in the power of dreams, because the world is basically one giant realization of people's collective dreams come true. We need to dream to aspire to do something that keeps us striving. But those dreams and ideas and wants mean nothing without execution, which doesn't usually happen without a plan.

dreams.author: Werner Herzog
dreams.text: Technology has a great advantage in that we are capable of creating dinosaurs and show them on the screen even though they are extinct 65 million years. All of a sudden, we have a fantastic tool that is as good as dreams are.

dreams.author: J. K. Rowling
dreams.text: I just write what I wanted to write. I write what amuses me. It's totally for myself. I never in my wildest dreams expected this popularity.

dreams.author: James Blunt
dreams.text: You can't break my spirit, it's my dreams you take.

dreams.author: Lupita Nyong'o
dreams.text: Dreams are the foundation of Hollywood. And dreams are the foundation of America.

dreams.author: Gary Ross
dreams.text: I don't understand people who dream in black and white. I just don't get it. My dreams have always been vivid color.

dreams.author: Salvatore Quasimodo
dreams.text: In opposition to this detachment, he finds an image of man which contains within itself man's dreams, man's illness, man's redemption from the misery of poverty - poverty which can no longer be for him a sign of the acceptance of life.

dreams.author: J. D. Vance
dreams.text: At a pivotal time in my life, Barack Obama gave me hope that a boy who grew up like me could still achieve the most important of my dreams. For that, I'll miss him and the example he set.

dreams.author: Debbie Ford
dreams.text: Divorce is a time of change. It really rocks a foundation of most people's lives. When we have our heart broken or our dreams taken away from us, it is a time of growth and change.

dreams.author: Patty Mills
dreams.text: I'm trying to help inspire kids to achieve their dreams and never give up.

dreams.author: Suze Orman
dreams.text: Understand and accept the cycles of money. The setbacks you may have today or next year will not keep you from financial freedom. If you hold on to your goals and dreams, you will get there.

dreams.author: Brian Blessed
dreams.text: I have marvelous dreams! I meet Buddha, I meet Jesus, I meet Mohammed. I constantly dream of space, stars and planets: we are the children of stardust.

dreams.author: Bibi Bourelly
dreams.text: Think about how many dreams die with people - if you don't believe in yourself, whatever you're doing is for no reason.

dreams.author: Julio Cortazar
dreams.text: Only in dreams, in poetry, in play do we sometimes arrive at what we were before we were this thing that, who knows, we are.

dreams.author: Gaby Hoffmann
dreams.text: I loved being on the set of 'Field of Dreams' because I hung out with the baseball players all day, played cards, flirted with Ray Liotta, and had a ball.

dreams.author: Jacob Latimore
dreams.text: Keep God first, chase your dreams, and everything will pay off.

dreams.author: Jewell Parker Rhodes
dreams.text: I would love for there to be a 'Voodoo Dreams' movie, especially after seeing the glorious 'Beasts of the Southern Wild.' I so admired how the filmmakers captured Louisiana and the magical atmosphere. I cried.

dreams.author: Christopher Voss
dreams.text: The moment you've convinced someone that you truly understand her dreams and feelings, mental and behavioral change becomes possible, and the foundation for a breakthrough has been laid.

dreams.author: Daniel James
dreams.text: Coming out at the Theatre of Dreams is unbelievable. I'll always love it and never get used to the sound of the fans.

dreams.author: Octavia Spencer
dreams.text: You cannot live to please everyone else. You have to edify, educate and fulfill your own dreams and destiny, and hope that whatever your art is that you're putting out there, if it's received, great, I respect you for receiving it. If it's not received, great, I respect you for not.

dreams.author: Gregory David Roberts
dreams.text: More dreams are realised and extinguished in Bombay than any other place in India.

dreams.author: Jose Altuve
dreams.text: I don't think I'm the face of the city or the Houston Astros. I'm just another guy who is playing hard to make dreams come true.

dreams.author: Samuel Butler
dreams.text: Mr. Tennyson has said that more things are wrought by prayer than this world dreams of, but he wisely refrains from saying whether they are good or bad things.

dreams.author: Ally Carter
dreams.text: At the core, I try to write characters who are real people with real insecurities, fears, hopes, and dreams, which is why hopefully readers can identify with them.

dreams.author: Maxine Waters
dreams.text: I've seen a lot of poverty - coming up as a young child, lost hopes and dreams and people that never had a chance to have a decent quality of life. I believe we can do a lot greater than that.

dreams.author: Allen Tate
dreams.text: I am not ridiculing verbal mechanisms, dreams, or repressions as origins of poetry; all three of them and more besides may have a great deal to do with it.

dreams.author: Mike Lindell
dreams.text: I get my stuff from dreams from God.

dreams.author: Patrick Dempsey
dreams.text: I think dreams can come true, but not necessarily like fairy-tales. It's not always so perfect like that.

dreams.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg
dreams.text: Much can be inferred about a man from his mistress: in her one beholds his weaknesses and his dreams.

dreams.author: Zawe Ashton
dreams.text: Dreams of a Life' and 'Fresh Meat' have left me on such a high. I'm not complaining but I'm not complacent either.

dreams.author: Sasha Banks
dreams.text: When you have little girls bringing you your action figures for you to sign, it's like, 'Wow, things are happening, and dreams do come true.'

dreams.author: Clara Shih
dreams.text: As entrepreneurs, we must constantly dream and have the conviction and obsession to transform our dreams into reality - to create a future that never existed before.

dreams.author: Paige
dreams.text: I want everyone to know that they can accomplish anything they want at any age if they just be themselves. I want to encourage millions to chase their dreams and to never change. Everyone should also know how to throw a good right hook!

dreams.author: Chris Van Allsburg
dreams.text: My ideas are not meant to suggest dreams or reality, but a surreal quality.

dreams.author: Ingmar Bergman
dreams.text: I am extremely suspicious of dreams, apparitions and visions, both in literature and in films and plays. Perhaps it's because mental excesses of this sort smack too much of being 'arranged.'

dreams.author: Leon Redbone
dreams.text: Lonesome. Lonesome. I know what it means. Here all by my lonesome, dreaming empty dreams. Weary. Weary at the close of day, wondering if tomorrow brings me joy or sorrow.

dreams.author: David Cohen
dreams.text: I'm most proud of helping so many others achieve their dreams as founders.

dreams.author: Amy Purdy
dreams.text: In my dreams, whatever I am doing, I look down to see if I have prosthetics. It sets my time frame in my dream, I think. I'd have these dreams that I am running and launching myself, and I look down and see that I have prosthetics. I have a lot of those, where I do great, amazing things with my prosthetics.

dreams.author: Jennifer Hudson
dreams.text: Dreams do come true. If anyone's proof of that, it's me.

dreams.author: Susie Wolff
dreams.text: Every racing driver in the world dreams of making it to F1, there's only 22 spots on the grid.

dreams.author: Rick Yune
dreams.text: To be here today is just beyond my wildest dreams.

dreams.author: Kaley Cuoco
dreams.text: I don't have kids, but I know that you want them to follow their dreams, while at the same time, you don't want them to be sitting around, hoping that dream is just going to come. I'm sure that's hard to tell your kids.

dreams.author: Ally Brooke
dreams.text: I very well could not be here right now. So I'm so grateful for every day I have, especially in living out my dreams.

dreams.author: Christopher Lee
dreams.text: 'The Impossible Dream' is, in my opinion, one of the greatest songs ever written. Here is a man, an old man, a very old man full of daring, bravery, courage, determination, romanticism and dreams.

dreams.author: Christine and the Queens
dreams.text: I'm often lost in my dreams.

dreams.author: Gustave Meyrink
dreams.text: Man is firmly convinced that he is awake; in reality he is caught in a net of sleep and dreams which he has unconsciously woven himself.

dreams.author: Rahul Kohli
dreams.text: I love the Western genre. In fact, one of my dreams is to play a cowboy on screen, like Clint Eastwood. I don't think it's going to happen, but you can always hope.

dreams.author: Armstrong Williams
dreams.text: Sports nurtures dreams of achieving self confidence and masculine striving for the skinny kid watching a boxer dance around the ring with sublime ease.

dreams.author: Elliott Yamin
dreams.text: I think the fact that I am living my dream and being really productive and embarking on all my lifelong aspirations is proof enough that if I can do it, anyone can. I try to tell everybody to dream big and go after their dreams.

dreams.author: Sam Raimi
dreams.text: I'm not certain, but I have a little gypsy blood in me. And my mother always told me that her grandma could give someone the evil eye, and I'd better not cross her because she had some of that blood in her. Mother always believed that she could predict the future, and she had dreams that came true.

dreams.author: Lindsey Stirling
dreams.text: If your mom asks you to do the dishes, do not pull out your pirate attitude. But if someone tells you you're not good enough, says your dreams are too lofty, or claims there is no room in showbiz for a dancing violinist - well then, by all means, pull out your eye patch, my friend, and take to the high seas.

dreams.author: Maneet Chauhan
dreams.text: It is a lot easier to stay focused and keep your head above water when you are pursuing your ultimate dreams!

dreams.author: Anthony Yarde
dreams.text: My dreams are to unify the world light-heavyweight titles like Roy Jones did and then at cruiserweight before then possibly the heavyweight division.

dreams.author: Eugenie Bouchard
dreams.text: I have very vivid dreams, and often - this happens to me at least a few times a week - I don't know if something happened in real life or in a dream. I'm like, 'Mom, did this neighbor come over, or was it a dream?' And she's like, 'No, what are you talking about?'

dreams.author: Paul Allen
dreams.text: If you have the chance to realize some of these dreams you had as a kid, and you have the opportunity, why not pursue that?

dreams.author: Barbara Billingsley
dreams.text: Don't think your dreams don't come true, because they do. You'd better be careful what you wish for. And I truly and honestly - one day I am doing the 'Beaver' show and I said, 'This is the show I have always wanted to do.'

dreams.author: Jarvis Cocker
dreams.text: I think basically becoming famous has taken the place of going to Heaven in modern society, hasn't it? That's the place where your dreams will come true. It's an act of faith now; they think that's going to sort things out.

dreams.author: Sean Evans
dreams.text: I always had dreams that I could be on television. I used to watch 'The Late Show' with my dad, and I'd make him pause the VHS whenever the audience laughed to explain jokes to me. But it's hard to just 'get into TV.'

dreams.author: Liu Yifei
dreams.text: It's important for people to know what they want, to know who they are, to follow their dreams and be the best versions of themselves.

dreams.author: Marsilio Ficino
dreams.text: Books that distribute things... with as daring a freedom as we use in dreams, put us on our feet again.

dreams.author: Magic Johnson
dreams.text: I do not have bad days. I don't wake up in the morning and think that I'm going to get AIDS. I don't dream bad dreams about it. If I did, I'd be giving in to the negativity.

dreams.author: Cam'ron
dreams.text: Go to school and get your education and follow your dreams.

dreams.author: J Balvin
dreams.text: Dreams are the ones that really keep me moving all the time. That's what drives me.

dreams.author: Laura Ingraham
dreams.text: The wise policymaker doesn't assume that any policy adopted in good faith will have good results. Instead, he or she weighs the likely outcome of any new policy based on facts and experience - not sentiments and dreams.

dreams.author: Siri Hustvedt
dreams.text: Most of us accept that although we may believe our dreams to be real events, upon waking, we can tell the difference between nocturnal hallucinations and reality.

dreams.author: Patrick Roy
dreams.text: I adore this adventure, I adore working with youth. For me it's a daily challenge, working to help these youths realize their dreams.

dreams.author: Maddie Marlow
dreams.text: I have a really weird thing with my dreams. I've had vivid dreams in the past that actually came true days after the dream.

dreams.author: Alison Sweeney
dreams.text: I save my dreams and hopes for my kids. When I'm making a wish under a bridge or tunnel, it's always for them.

dreams.author: Chris Kamara
dreams.text: I never thought in my wildest dreams I'd ever be offered a record deal, and to get a Christmas No. 1 would be huge for any performer, let alone an ex-footballer.

dreams.author: P. V. Sindhu
dreams.text: My period days didn't make me falter: they made me more determined to pursue my dreams.

dreams.author: Alphonso Davies
dreams.text: I arrived in Europe with so many dreams and already Bayern have helped me achieve many of them.

dreams.author: Pierce Brosnan
dreams.text: A man becomes what he dreams. And I dreamed of being in the movies. I was brought up on Steve McQueen, Clint Eastwood, Warren Beatty, and Cary Grant.

dreams.author: Sergio Leone
dreams.text: In my childhood, America was like a religion. Then, real-life Americans abruptly entered my life - in jeeps - and upset all my dreams.

dreams.author: Marcus Buckingham
dreams.text: Passion isn't something that lives way up in the sky, in abstract dreams and hopes. It lives at ground level, in the specific details of what you're actually doing every day.

dreams.author: Wilma Rudolph
dreams.text: I have spent a lifetime trying to share what it has meant to be a woman first in the world of sports so that other young women have a chance to reach their dreams.

dreams.author: Dick Cavett
dreams.text: The emotions in all true anxiety dreams are next to unbearable.

dreams.author: Ritesh Agarwal
dreams.text: I was good at studies and played sports. The only difference was I had big dreams even as a child - I always knew I wanted to be an entrepreneur.

dreams.author: Christina Aguilera
dreams.text: To be given the opportunity to help shape new artists' careers and mentor them to see their dreams come to fruition is a task I welcome with open arms.

dreams.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca
dreams.text: For even in dreams a good deed is not lost.

dreams.author: Rickey Henderson
dreams.text: To all the kids out there: Follow your dream. Believe in your dream. Because dreams do come true.

dreams.author: Smokey Robinson
dreams.text: As a kid, this is what I wanted my life to be. Not in my wildest dreams did I ever dare to dream that it would be this.

dreams.author: Andy Ruiz Jr.
dreams.text: It doesn't matter how you look. As long as you train hard, you focus and you're hungry, and that drive is in you to follow your dreams, everything is possible.

dreams.author: Domhnall Gleeson
dreams.text: The idea of having dreams that don't come true is really terrifying.

dreams.author: Maya Angelou
dreams.text: When younger writers and poets, musicians and painters are weakened by a stemming of funds, they come to me saddened, not as full of dreams and excitement and ideas. I am then weakened and diminished, and made less rich.

dreams.author: Milo Yiannopoulos
dreams.text: As a foreigner, I used to think all of Michigan was a post-apocalyptic wasteland of burning buildings, trashed cars, abandoned factories and broken dreams. But now I know that's just Detroit. It's only the Democrat-controlled areas that are a disaster.

dreams.author: Ingmar Bergman
dreams.text: My pictures are always part of my thinking, and my emotions, tensions, dreams, desires.

dreams.author: Oscar Pistorius
dreams.text: I can have my goals, and I can have my dreams. My goal is to make the finals and improve my position. I want to run all decent races. I don't want to look back and say I ran a terrible race.

dreams.author: Mary Ellen Mark
dreams.text: I've always been interested in photographing traditions and customs - especially in America. The prom is an American tradition, a rite of passage that has always been one of the most important rituals of American youth. It is a day in our lives that we never forget - a day full of hopes and dreams for our future.

dreams.author: Christie Hefner
dreams.text: Before I went to work for 'Playboy,' I planned to apply to Yale to get a public policy master's. I felt drawn to go into politics. Even before that, my dream was to wind up either in the Senate or on the Supreme Court. I had big dreams as a little girl.

dreams.author: John Amery
dreams.text: Not only the priceless heritage of our fathers, of our seamen, of our Empire builders is being thrown away in a war that serves no British interests - but our alliance leader Stalin dreams of nothing but the destruction of that heritage of our fathers?

dreams.author: Christopher Nolan
dreams.text: But I have been interested in dreams, really since I was a kid. I have always been fascinated by the idea that your mind, when you are asleep, can create a world in a dream and you are perceiving it as though it really existed.

dreams.author: David Bryan
dreams.text: You start out with your eyes wide open, and you've got dreams, and we worked really, really hard, and ours came true. So - and we're fortunate enough to keep putting out number one records, and we're fortunate enough to get out there and keep playing, and we truly have a blast.

dreams.author: Felix Bloch
dreams.text: Thanking you once more, I want to wish you the best of luck for your future life and to conclude by saying to you: Dream your dreams and may they come true!

dreams.author: Christian Louboutin
dreams.text: I was born in Paris in the mid-1960s, and by the time I was 12 I had started going to the movies by myself. Most of the movies of that period never appealed to me. I didn't like the 'naturalism,' the sad or the 'down-to-earth' characters. What I wanted from film was fantasy, dreams, funny situations, extravagant decor - and beautiful women.

dreams.author: Rivers Cuomo
dreams.text: I had rock-star dreams from 8 or 9 almost nonstop. I thought it was going to be like being a god on earth: having as many women as you want whenever you want them, having super powers, being incredibly wealthy, never doing laundry.

dreams.author: Rudy Ruettiger
dreams.text: There are two kinds of people. There are the ones who believe in your dreams and there are the ones who think it's their job to crush those dreams.

dreams.author: Peter Diamandis
dreams.text: After more than a decade as the editor of 'Wired' magazine, Chris Anderson started the company of his dreams - a robotics manufacturing company called 3D Robotics - to produce the autonomous flying vehicles coming out of DIY Drones.

dreams.author: Hugh Bonneville
dreams.text: Am I athletic? In my dreams.

dreams.author: Claire Messud
dreams.text: My mother turned 40 in 1973. So in 1970 - when 'The Female Eunuch' came out and Ms. magazine was founded - my mom was 37 with two children, and she was just that little bit too old, and the circumstances of her life were set up in a certain way that for her to fulfill her ambitions and dreams, she would have had to break with the family.

dreams.author: Eugenie Bouchard
dreams.text: I don't really think dreams have real meaning. Some people believe in that. I just think it's your brain, after a day of crazy random pieces of information jumbled together, creating interesting stories. I just view it as entertainment.

dreams.author: Robin Leach
dreams.text: The public's appetite for what sensible newspapers call 'personality journalism' and what I call gossip is insatiable. It will never, ever stop growing because everybody dreams.

dreams.author: Anthony Hopkins
dreams.text: My life turned out to be beyond my greatest dreams.

dreams.author: Karen Civil
dreams.text: Nobody is going to love and honor your dreams like yourself. It's really not looking for someone to be your superhero but for us to save ourselves and to really understand that. I've been at the lowest of lowest of my life, and it took that for me to realize that I want to do better and to be better.

dreams.author: John Astin
dreams.text: My work is to reach people with ideas, hopes, dreams, encouragement, insight, and revelation. That's what an actor wants to do.

dreams.author: Alison Sudol
dreams.text: When you have goals and dreams and things that you've been wanting your whole life, and then they actually start happening and you start checking things off your list, it's like, whaaat? Huhhh?

dreams.author: David Brooks
dreams.text: America is not just a democracy, it represents a certain culture of competitive mobility and personality aspirations, politics is not merely a clash of interests, but a clash of dreams.

dreams.author: Christen Press
dreams.text: I've always felt like my job is to protect my sister. Even growing up, on the playground, when my sister was too shy, I would speak for her... I even had dreams where I had to save her, growing up, all the time - like, she was falling, and I had to save her.

dreams.author: Dan Pena
dreams.text: The truth is, successful people are not ten times smarter than you. They don't really work ten times harder than you. So why are they successful? Because their dreams are so much bigger than yours!

dreams.author: Keiynan Lonsdale
dreams.text: You can live your dreams, and you can believe in magic. You can live your dreams, and you can be yourself.

dreams.author: Billy Wilder
dreams.text: You have to have a dream so you can get up in the morning.

dreams.author: Walter Scott
dreams.text: To all, to each, a fair good-night, and pleasing dreams, and slumbers light.

dreams.author: Thomas Merton
dreams.text: A daydream is an evasion.

dreams.author: Paracelsus
dreams.text: Dreams must be heeded and accepted. For a great many of them come true.

dreams.author: Stefano Gabbana
dreams.text: Dreams can still come true; you need a great deal of energy and determination, and a little bit of luck.

dreams.author: D. H. Lawrence
dreams.text: The world of men is dreaming, it has gone mad in its sleep, and a snake is strangling it, but it can't wake up.

dreams.author: Florence King
dreams.text: People are so busy dreaming the American Dream, fantasizing about what they could be or have a right to be, that they're all asleep at the switch. Consequently we are living in the Age of Human Error.

dreams.author: Mary Shelley
dreams.text: My dreams were all my own; I accounted for them to nobody; they were my refuge when annoyed - my dearest pleasure when free.

dreams.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
dreams.text: God's gifts put man's best dreams to shame.

dreams.author: Rene Descartes
dreams.text: I am accustomed to sleep and in my dreams to imagine the same things that lunatics imagine when awake.

dreams.author: Brian Schweitzer
dreams.text: I challenge you to be dreamers; I challenge you to be doers and let us make the greatest place in the world even better.

dreams.author: Paul Wellstone
dreams.text: Sometimes, the only realists are the dreamers.

dreams.author: Margaret Fuller
dreams.text: Only the dreamer shall understand realities, though in truth his dreaming must be not out of proportion to his waking.

dreams.author: Usher
dreams.text: Strivers achieve what dreamers believe.

dreams.author: Lope de Vega
dreams.text: Dreaming of a tomorrow, which tomorrow, will be as distant then as 'tis today.

dreams.author: Mary Webb
dreams.text: Saddle your dreams before you ride em.

dreams.author: Anne Campbell
dreams.text: You can plant a dream.

dreams.author: Grover Cleveland
dreams.text: Sometimes I wake at night in the White House and rub my eyes and wonder if it is not all a dream.

dreams.author: Joan Didion
dreams.text: Was it only by dreaming or writing that I could find out what I thought?

dreams.author: Katie Holmes
dreams.text: We all keep dreaming, and luckily, dreams come true.

dreams.author: George Santayana
dreams.text: The dreamer can know no truth, not even about his dream, except by awaking out of it.

dreams.author: Abraham Cahan
dreams.text: I was a great dreamer of day dreams.

dreams.author: Amos Bronson Alcott
dreams.text: Our dreams drench us in sense, and sense steeps us again in dreams.

dreams.author: Emma Goldman
dreams.text: When we can't dream any longer we die.

dreams.author: Madonna Ciccone
dreams.text: I stand for freedom of expression, doing what you believe in, and going after your dreams.

dreams.author: Michel de Montaigne
dreams.text: Those who have compared our life to a dream were right... we were sleeping wake, and waking sleep.

dreams.author: Valentina Tereshkova
dreams.text: Anyone who has spent any time in space will love it for the rest of their lives. I achieved my childhood dream of the sky.

dreams.author: Khalil Gibran
dreams.text: Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.

dreams.author: Gary Busey
dreams.text: I'll tell you this: You have to remember to chase and catch your dreams, because if you don't, your imagination will live in empty spaces, and that's nowhere land.

dreams.author: Herb Brooks
dreams.text: You know, Willie Wonka said it best: we are the makers of dreams, the dreamers of dreams.

dreams.author: E. V. Lucas
dreams.text: One of the most adventurous things left us is to go to bed. For no one can lay a hand on our dreams.

dreams.author: George Herbert
dreams.text: Night is the mother of counsels.

dreams.author: Anais Nin
dreams.text: Dreams are necessary to life.

dreams.author: Novalis
dreams.text: We are near waking when we dream we are dreaming.

dreams.author: Les Brown
dreams.text: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.

dreams.author: Elias Canetti
dreams.text: All the things one has forgotten scream for help in dreams.

dreams.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
dreams.text: Great dreams of great dreamers are always transcended.

dreams.author: Charley Pride
dreams.text: I was always a dreamer, in childhood especially. People thought I was a little strange.

dreams.author: Drew Barrymore
dreams.text: I've always said that one night, I'm going to find myself in some field somewhere, I'm standing on grass, and it's raining, and I'm with the person I love, and I know I'm at the very point I've been dreaming of getting to.

dreams.author: Amy Lowell
dreams.text: Take everything easy and quit dreaming and brooding and you will be well guarded from a thousand evils.

dreams.author: Bill Watterson
dreams.text: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can play together all night.

dreams.author: Gene Cernan
dreams.text: To become an astronaut, someone has to have a dream of his own to do something that he or she has always wanted to do, then commit himself to making that dream come true.

dreams.author: Henry David Thoreau
dreams.text: Dreams are the touchstones of our character.

dreams.author: Jesse Jackson
dreams.text: No one should negotiate their dreams. Dreams must be free to fly high. No government, no legislature, has a right to limit your dreams. You should never agree to surrender your dreams.

dreams.author: Donald G. Mitchell
dreams.text: Married or unmarried, young or old, poet or worker, you are still a dreamer, and will one time know, and feel, that your life is but a dream.

dreams.author: Luigi Pirandello
dreams.text: In bed my real love has always been the sleep that rescued me by allowing me to dream.

dreams.author: Zhuangzi
dreams.text: I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.

dreams.author: Erma Bombeck
dreams.text: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.

dreams.author: Langston Hughes
dreams.text: Hold fast to dreams For when dreams go Life is a barren field Frozen with snow.

dreams.author: Anais Nin
dreams.text: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.

dreams.author: John Locke
dreams.text: Reverie is when ideas float in our mind without reflection or regard of the understanding.

dreams.author: Andre Breton
dreams.text: I have always been amazed at the way an ordinary observer lends so much more credence and attaches so much more importance to waking events than to those occurring in dreams... Man... is above all the plaything of his memory.

dreams.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
dreams.text: Judge of your natural character by what you do in your dreams.

dreams.author: Debi Thomas
dreams.text: I tell people I'm too stupid to know what's impossible. I have ridiculously large dreams, and half the time they come true.

dreams.author: Erich Fromm
dreams.text: We all dream; we do not understand our dreams, yet we act as if nothing strange goes on in our sleep minds, strange at least by comparison with the logical, purposeful doings of our minds when we are awake.

dreams.author: Victor Hugo
dreams.text: Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.

dreams.author: Herbert Kaufman
dreams.text: Only things the dreamers make live on. They are the eternal conquerors.

dreams.author: Paracelsus
dreams.text: The interpretation of dreams is a great art.

dreams.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
dreams.text: It's when children are 15, 16 or 17 that they decide whether they want to be a doctor, an engineer, a politician or go to the Mars or moon. That is the time they start having a dream, and that's the time you can work on them. You can help them shape their dreams.

dreams.author: Olive Schreiner
dreams.text: Our fathers had their dreams; we have ours; the generation that follows will have its own. Without dreams and phantoms man cannot exist.

dreams.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
dreams.text: Dream manfully and nobly, and thy dreams shall be prophets.

dreams.author: William Butler Yeats
dreams.text: Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.

dreams.author: Khalil Gibran
dreams.text: The most pitiful among men is he who turns his dreams into silver and gold.

dreams.author: Michael Bloomberg
dreams.text: This is the city of dreamers and time and again it's the place where the greatest dream of all, the American dream, has been tested and has triumphed.

dreams.author: Stephen Vincent Benet
dreams.text: Dreaming men are haunted men.

dreams.author: Alfred Eisenstaedt
dreams.text: I dream that someday the step between my mind and my finger will no longer be needed. And that simply by blinking my eyes, I shall make pictures. Then, I think, I shall really have become a photographer.

dreams.author: Jane Roberts
dreams.text: Dreaming or awake, we perceive only events that have meaning to us.

dreams.author: Jim Bakker
dreams.text: Oh, I was never a businessman. I was a visionary, a dreamer.

dreams.author: Lenny Wilkens
dreams.text: We should never discourage young people from dreaming dreams.

dreams.author: Dorothy Gilman
dreams.text: People need dreams, there's as much nourishment in 'em as food.

dreams.author: Jerry B. Jenkins
dreams.text: Writers write. Dreamers talk about it.

dreams.author: Robyn Hitchcock
dreams.text: Dreams are a scientific fact.

dreams.author: John Lithgow
dreams.text: Everybody's a dreamer.

dreams.author: Joseph Barbera
dreams.text: That's what keeps me going: dreaming, inventing, then hoping and dreaming some more in order to keep dreaming.

dreams.author: Pope John XXIII
dreams.text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.

dreams.author: Lisa
dreams.text: Never give up on your dreams, no matter how painful and difficult your journey is.

dreams.author: Ashley Smith
dreams.text: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.

dreams.author: Gail Devers
dreams.text: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.

dreams.author: David Bailey
dreams.text: A positive attitude can really make dreams come true - it did for me.

dreams.author: Khalil Gibran
dreams.text: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.

dreams.author: Thomas Jefferson
dreams.text: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.

dreams.author: Rachel Corrie
dreams.text: Follow your dreams, believe in yourself and don't give up.

dreams.author: Jeremy Irons
dreams.text: We all have our time machines. Some take us back, they're called memories. Some take us forward, they're called dreams.

dreams.author: Les Brown
dreams.text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.

dreams.author: LL Cool J
dreams.text: Stay focused, go after your dreams and keep moving toward your goals.

dreams.author: Oprah Winfrey
dreams.text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.

dreams.author: Phillip Sweet
dreams.text: Stay true to yourself, yet always be open to learn. Work hard, and never give up on your dreams, even when nobody else believes they can come true but you. These are not cliches but real tools you need no matter what you do in life to stay focused on your path.

dreams.author: Napoleon Hill
dreams.text: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.

dreams.author: P. V. Sindhu
dreams.text: Your dreams are what define your individuality. They have the power to give you wings and make you fly high.

dreams.author: Donovan Bailey
dreams.text: Follow your passion, be prepared to work hard and sacrifice, and, above all, don't let anyone limit your dreams.

dreams.author: Sergio Ramos
dreams.text: To become a great player, you've got to show real dedication and commitment to football, and you've got to be very humble and hard-working. And, above all, you've got to fight to make your dreams come true.

dreams.author: Kalpana Chawla
dreams.text: The path from dreams to success does exist. May you have the vision to find it, the courage to get on to it, and the perseverance to follow it.

dreams.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
dreams.text: Never give up on what you really want to do. The person with big dreams is more powerful than the one with all the facts.

dreams.author: Robert Fulghum
dreams.text: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.

dreams.author: Britney Spears
dreams.text: I've always followed my heart and pursued my dreams, and I imagine that people find that inspiring. I hope that is the effect I have on my fans and people in general. I definitely want to project a positive energy out into the world.

dreams.author: Wilma Rudolph
dreams.text: Never underestimate the power of dreams and the influence of the human spirit. We are all the same in this notion: The potential for greatness lives within each of us.

dreams.author: Jonas Salk
dreams.text: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.

dreams.author: Jimmy Carter
dreams.text: We become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.

dreams.author: James Allen
dreams.text: Dream lofty dreams, and as you dream, so you shall become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall one day be; your ideal is the prophecy of what you shall at last unveil.

dreams.author: William Shakespeare
dreams.text: We are such stuff as dreams are made on; and our little life is rounded with a sleep.

dreams.author: J. Cole
dreams.text: I always feel like it's two key ingredients when it comes to following your dreams, making something happen that the average person deems difficult. If you truly believe it, that's step one. Step two, is, you know, the hard work that goes along with it.

dreams.author: Dan Pena
dreams.text: Life without dreams is like a bird with a broken wing - it can't fly.

dreams.author: Ben Carson
dreams.text: Through hard work, perseverance and a faith in God, you can live your dreams.

dreams.author: Bill Gates
dreams.text: I really had a lot of dreams when I was a kid, and I think a great deal of that grew out of the fact that I had a chance to read a lot.

dreams.author: Carles Puyol
dreams.text: Every player dreams of winning the World Cup, and there are very few who are fortunate enough to actually do it.

dreams.author: Joao Moutinho
dreams.text: Believe in yourself and believe in your dreams. Follow them, never give up, that's the most important thing. If you believe you can get there, then one day you will.

dreams.author: Sasha Cohen
dreams.text: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.

dreams.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca
dreams.text: What is life? A madness. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a story. And the greatest good is little enough; for all life is a dream, and dreams themselves are only dreams.

dreams.author: Paulo Coelho
dreams.text: Remember your dreams and fight for them. You must know what you want from life. There is just one thing that makes your dream become impossible: the fear of failure.

dreams.author: Anais Nin
dreams.text: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.

dreams.author: Fidel Castro
dreams.text: The equal right of all citizens to health, education, work, food, security, culture, science, and wellbeing - that is, the same rights we proclaimed when we began our struggle, in addition to those which emerge from our dreams of justice and equality for all inhabitants of our world - is what I wish for all.

dreams.author: Pindar
dreams.text: Men are the dreams of a shadow.

dreams.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
dreams.text: Dreams about the future are always filled with gadgets.

dreams.author: Theodore Roosevelt
dreams.text: The only time you really live fully is from thirty to sixty. The young are slaves to dreams; the old servants of regrets. Only the middle-aged have all their five senses in the keeping of their wits.

dreams.author: Malala Yousafzai
dreams.text: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality.

dreams.author: Travis Bradberry
dreams.text: Grit is that 'extra something' that separates the most successful people from the rest. It's the passion, perseverance, and stamina that we must channel in order to stick with our dreams until they become a reality.

dreams.author: Edward Kennedy
dreams.text: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.

dreams.author: Bo Burnham
dreams.text: I would say don't take advice from people like me who have gotten very lucky. We're very biased. You know, like Taylor Swift telling you to follow your dreams is like a lottery winner telling you, 'Liquidize your assets; buy Powerball tickets - it works!'

dreams.author: Frida Kahlo
dreams.text: I never paint dreams or nightmares. I paint my own reality.

dreams.author: Mark Victor Hansen
dreams.text: You control your future, your destiny. What you think about comes about. By recording your dreams and goals on paper, you set in motion the process of becoming the person you most want to be. Put your future in good hands - your own.

dreams.author: Jawaharlal Nehru
dreams.text: Without peace, all other dreams vanish and are reduced to ashes.

dreams.author: Sudha Chandran
dreams.text: My bedroom is my favorite chill out zone, where after a hectic day, I sign off to land in my dreams.

dreams.author: Friedrich Schiller
dreams.text: Keep true to the dreams of your youth.

dreams.author: Emmitt Smith
dreams.text: Vision gets the dreams started. Dreaming employs your God-given imagination to reinforce the vision. Both are part of something I believe is absolutely necessary to building the life of a champion, a winner, a person of high character who is consistently at the top of whatever game he or she is in.

dreams.author: Jack Johnson
dreams.text: Don't let your dreams be dreams.

dreams.author: Federico Fellini
dreams.text: Talking about dreams is like talking about movies, since the cinema uses the language of dreams; years can pass in a second, and you can hop from one place to another. It's a language made of image. And in the real cinema, every object and every light means something, as in a dream.

dreams.author: Suzy Kassem
dreams.text: A heart without dreams is like a bird without feathers.

dreams.author: Claudette Colvin
dreams.text: I always tell young people to hold on to their dreams. And sometimes you have to stand up for what you think is right even if you have to stand alone.

dreams.author: John Wooden
dreams.text: Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.

dreams.author: Laurie Colwin
dreams.text: We need time to defuse, to contemplate. Just as in sleep our brains relax and give us dreams, so at some time in the day we need to disconnect, reconnect, and look around us.

dreams.author: Charlotte Bronte
dreams.text: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.

dreams.author: Marilyn Manson
dreams.text: When all of your wishes are granted, many of your dreams will be destroyed.

dreams.author: Tim Burton
dreams.text: Visions are worth fighting for. Why spend your life making someone else's dreams?

dreams.author: Herb Caen
dreams.text: A city is not gauged by its length and width, but by the broadness of its vision and the height of its dreams.

dreams.author: Ferdinand Porsche
dreams.text: I couldn't find the sports car of my dreams, so I built it myself.

dreams.author: Tecumseh
dreams.text: When the legends die, the dreams end; there is no more greatness.

dreams.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
dreams.text: A man is a god in ruins. When men are innocent, life shall be longer, and shall pass into the immortal, as gently as we awake from dreams.

dreams.author: Stephen Colbert
dreams.text: Thankfully, dreams can change. If we'd all stuck with our first dream, the world would be overrun with cowboys and princesses.

dreams.author: H. P. Lovecraft
dreams.text: Ocean is more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the dreams of Time.

dreams.author: Bear Bryant
dreams.text: There's a lot of blood, sweat, and guts between dreams and success.

dreams.author: Ryunosuke Satoro
dreams.text: Let your dreams outgrow the shoes of your expectations.

dreams.author: Juice Wrld
dreams.text: I feel as though, if you're able to control your dreams, you have more power and control over your mind, like you could reach more areas of your mind. Therefore, I feel like it creates the ability for you to achieve more things in reality.

dreams.author: Bob Dylan
dreams.text: I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.

dreams.author: William S. Burroughs
dreams.text: The way to kill a man or a nation is to cut off his dreams, the way the whites are taking care of the Indians: killing their dreams, their magic, their familiar spirits.

dreams.author: Nelson Mandela
dreams.text: If there are dreams about a beautiful South Africa, there are also roads that lead to their goal. Two of these roads could be named Goodness and Forgiveness.

dreams.author: Emil Zatopek
dreams.text: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.

dreams.author: Katie Ledecky
dreams.text: I would encourage you to set really high goals. Set goals that, when you set them, you think they're impossible. But then every day you can work towards them, and anything is possible, so keep working hard and follow your dreams.

dreams.author: Jimmy O. Yang
dreams.text: Growing up, my dad was 'get a real job, don't go pursuing your dreams, that's how you become homeless.' So, do I pick my family or do I pick my own happiness, and how much does my own happiness depend on my family?

dreams.author: John Lennon
dreams.text: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?

dreams.author: Jon Bon Jovi
dreams.text: Believe in love. Believe in magic. Hell, believe in Santa Clause. Believe in others. Believe in yourself. Believe in your dreams. If you don't, who will?

dreams.author: Ralph Lauren
dreams.text: I don't design clothes, I design dreams.

dreams.author: Corin Nemec
dreams.text: Never let life impede on your ability to manifest your dreams. Dig deeper into your dreams and deeper into yourself and believe that anything is possible, and make it happen.

dreams.author: Jim Carrey
dreams.text: It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?

dreams.author: Chris Brown
dreams.text: Follow your dreams. Just make sure to have fun too.

dreams.author: Vin Scully
dreams.text: Don't let the winds blow your dreams away... or steal your faith in God.

dreams.author: Madeline Stuart
dreams.text: I am just a girl chasing her dreams and having an amazing adventure.

dreams.author: James M. Barrie
dreams.text: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.

dreams.author: Sugar Ray Leonard
dreams.text: Within our dreams and aspirations we find our opportunities.

dreams.author: Louis V. Gerstner, Jr.
dreams.text: Computers are magnificent tools for the realization of our dreams, but no machine can replace the human spark of spirit, compassion, love, and understanding.

dreams.author: Tadashi Yanai
dreams.text: If you always think about your dreams or goals, work steadfastly towards them and continue to challenge yourself, you will definitely be able to realise those dreams or goals.

dreams.author: Shanice Williams
dreams.text: Go out and chase your dreams no matter how crazy it looks.

dreams.author: J. K. Rowling
dreams.text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.

dreams.author: Jack Canfield
dreams.text: When your dreams include service to others - accomplishing something that contributes to others - it also accelerates the accomplishment of that goal. People want to be part of something that contributes and makes a difference.

dreams.author: Black Elk
dreams.text: Sometimes dreams are wiser than waking.

dreams.author: Debby Boone
dreams.text: Dreams are the seeds of change. Nothing ever grows without a seed, and nothing ever changes without a dream.

dreams.author: Sylvia Mathews Burwell
dreams.text: Job training empowers people to realize their dreams and improve their lives.

dreams.author: Jesse Jackson
dreams.text: Our dreams must be stronger than our memories. We must be pulled by our dreams, rater than pushed by our memories.

dreams.author: Joey King
dreams.text: You have to keep going and pursue your dreams.

dreams.author: Kyla Reid
dreams.text: Dreams do come true if you work hard and you get your head down.

dreams.author: Dexter Gordon
dreams.text: Jazz to me is a living music. It's a music that since its beginning has expressed the feelings, the dreams, hopes, of the people.

dreams.author: Marian Wright Edelman
dreams.text: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.

dreams.author: J. G. Ballard
dreams.text: The American Dream has run out of gas. The car has stopped. It no longer supplies the world with its images, its dreams, its fantasies. No more. It's over. It supplies the world with its nightmares now: the Kennedy assassination, Watergate, Vietnam.

dreams.author: Giorgio de Chirico
dreams.text: To become truly immortal, a work of art must escape all human limits: logic and common sense will only interfere. But once these barriers are broken, it will enter the realms of childhood visions and dreams.

dreams.author: Lindsey Vonn
dreams.text: Follow your dreams. If you have a goal, and you want to achieve it, then work hard and do everything you can to get there, and one day it will come true.

dreams.author: Elie Wiesel
dreams.text: No one may speak for the dead, no one may interpret their mutilated dreams and visions.

dreams.author: Adam Duritz
dreams.text: If dreams are like movies, then memories are films about ghosts.

dreams.author: Paul Gauguin
dreams.text: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.

dreams.author: James Arthur
dreams.text: Everyone loves a comeback story, and everyone loves the underdog as well. I kind of feel like I've been the underdog. Hopefully that inspires people to not give up on themselves and their lives and not give up on their dreams.

dreams.author: Jennie
dreams.text: I would like to say every moment counts for you, so make the time that you spend for your dreams a very special moment, make sure that you do something that you'll be happy with when you go back and look at yourself.

dreams.author: Penny Johnson Jerald
dreams.text: If you dream of becoming an eagle, you follow your dreams and not the words of a bunch of chickens.

dreams.author: Steven Spielberg
dreams.text: You have many years ahead of you to create the dreams that we can't even imagine dreaming. You have done more for the collective unconscious of this planet than you will ever know.

dreams.author: John H. Johnson
dreams.text: Dream small dreams. If you make them too big, you get overwhelmed and you don't do anything. If you make small goals and accomplish them, it gives you the confidence to go on to higher goals.

dreams.author: DaBaby
dreams.text: It's just the risk that I take and the sacrifice that I make: Putting myself, my career, my family's peace of mind on the line just to do right by my fans. It ain't no gray area: You're either with that and willing to go out of your way to make people who contribute to your dreams coming true happy or you aren't.

dreams.author: Neil Gaiman
dreams.text: Short stories are tiny windows into other worlds and other minds and dreams. They are journeys you can make to the far side of the universe and still be back in time for dinner.

dreams.author: Ralph Marston
dreams.text: Dare to visualize a world in which your most treasured dreams have become true.

dreams.author: Alan Turing
dreams.text: I have had a dream indicating rather clearly that I am on the way to being hetero, though I don't accept it with much enthusiasm either awake or in the dreams.

dreams.author: Marsha Norman
dreams.text: Dreams are illustrations from the book your soul is writing about you.

dreams.author: Wim Hof
dreams.text: We are built to be happy, strong and healthy. I fear not to live. We have everything to live up to our dreams. You have everything to achieve that, and in a very short period of time you can get all the tools to manifest who you want to be.

dreams.author: Soren Kierkegaard
dreams.text: Old age realizes the dreams of youth: look at Dean Swift; in his youth he built an asylum for the insane, in his old age he was himself an inmate.

dreams.author: Rudolph Valentino
dreams.text: Women are not in love with me but with the picture of me on the screen. I am merely the canvas on which women paint their dreams.

dreams.author: Terry Fox
dreams.text: I just wish people would realize that anything's possible if you try; dreams are made possible if you try.

dreams.author: Larry Page
dreams.text: I think it is often easier to make progress on mega-ambitious dreams. Since no one else is crazy enough to do it, you have little competition. In fact, there are so few people this crazy that I feel like I know them all by first name.

dreams.author: Jonathan Sacks
dreams.text: Dreams are where we visit the many lands and landscapes of human possibility and discover the one where we feel at home. The great religious leaders were all dreamers.

dreams.author: Alphonse Karr
dreams.text: Love is the most terrible, and also the most generous of the passions; it is the only one which includes in its dreams the happiness of someone else.

dreams.author: Tabatha Coffey
dreams.text: We have to stand up for what we believe in, even when we might not be popular for it. Honesty starts with being ourselves, authentic and true to who we are and what we believe in, and that may not always be popular, but it will always let you follow your dreams and your heart.

dreams.author: Mick Jagger
dreams.text: Lose your dreams and you might lose your mind.

dreams.author: Umberto Eco
dreams.text: The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else.

dreams.author: Otto Dix
dreams.text: All art is exorcism. I paint dreams and visions too; the dreams and visions of my time. Painting is the effort to produce order; order in yourself. There is much chaos in me, much chaos in our time.

dreams.author: Elijah Cummings
dreams.text: Our children are the living messages we send to a future we will ever see... Will we rob them of their destiny? Will we rob them of their dreams? No - we will not do that.

dreams.author: Emile Durkheim
dreams.text: Reality seems valueless by comparison with the dreams of fevered imaginations; reality is therefore abandoned.

dreams.author: Virginia Woolf
dreams.text: Yet it is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.

dreams.author: Kurt Warner
dreams.text: The road to our dreams has many detours.

dreams.author: Joel Madden
dreams.text: Always wear cute pyjamas to bed, you'll never know who u will meet in your dreams.

dreams.author: Tu Youyou
dreams.text: Every scientist dreams of doing something that can help the world.

dreams.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
dreams.text: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.

dreams.author: Emma McKeon
dreams.text: If you work hard and enjoy what you are doing and go after your dreams anything is possible.

dreams.author: Kim Barnouin
dreams.text: I have dreams of becoming a professional pastry chef and having a little bakery - that's how much I love baking. I love to cook in general, but my heart lies in desserts.

dreams.author: Lady Gaga
dreams.text: I am a walking piece of art every day, with my dreams and my ambitions forward at all times in an effort to inspire my fans to lead their life in that way.

dreams.author: Candace Parker
dreams.text: Today I know that there is still work to be done, but along the way my I am achieving my dreams.

dreams.author: Manushi Chhillar
dreams.text: My parents have always encouraged me to follow my dreams and do what makes me happy.

dreams.author: Judy Garland
dreams.text: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.

dreams.author: Pam Brown
dreams.text: A horse is the projection of peoples' dreams about themselves - strong, powerful, beautiful - and it has the capability of giving us escape from our mundane existence.

dreams.author: Loretta Young
dreams.text: In my dreams, I could be a Princess, and that's what I was. Like most little girls, I believed nothing less than a Prince could make my dreams come true.

dreams.author: John Updike
dreams.text: To be a human being is to be in a state of tension between your appetites and your dreams, and the social realities around you and your obligations to your fellow man.

dreams.author: Joe Montana
dreams.text: Winners, I am convinced, imagine their dreams first. They want it with all their heart and expect it to come true. There is, I believe, no other way to live.

dreams.author: Bram Stoker
dreams.text: How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads; to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams.

dreams.author: Booker T. Washington
dreams.text: If you can't read, it's going to be hard to realize dreams.

dreams.author: Bad Bunny
dreams.text: If a small-town boy like me who bagged groceries was able to make his dreams come true, you can too.

dreams.author: Marlee Matlin
dreams.text: I hope I inspire people who hear. Hearing people have the ability to remove barriers that prevent deaf people from achieving their dreams.

dreams.author: Luka Modric
dreams.text: Fight for your dreams and success. This is what has always guided me.

dreams.author: Narendra Modi
dreams.text: We want an Afghanistan that is shaped by the dreams of the great Afghan people, not by irrational fears and overreaching ambitions of others.

dreams.author: Arna Bontemps
dreams.text: Let us keep the dance of rain our fathers kept and tread our dreams beneath the jungle sky.

dreams.author: Tyler Perry
dreams.text: I don't think the dreams die - I think that people give up. I think it gets too hard.

dreams.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
dreams.text: My own dreams fortunately came true in this great state. I became Mr. Universe; I became a successful businessman. And even though some people say I still speak with a slight accent, I have reached the top of the acting profession.

dreams.author: Daya
dreams.text: Believe in yourself, go after your dreams, and don't let anyone put you in a box.

dreams.author: Vin Diesel
dreams.text: It's insecurity that is always chasing you and standing in the way of your dreams.

dreams.author: Eduardo Galeano
dreams.text: I wanted to be a soccer player, and I became the best of the best, the number one, better than Maradona, better than Pele, and even better than Messi - but only at night, nighttime, during my dreams. When I wake up, I realized that I have wooden legs and that I'm doomed to be a writer.

dreams.author: Kane
dreams.text: Pursue your dreams but have a backup plan.

dreams.author: James A. Michener
dreams.text: The permanent temptation of life is to confuse dreams with reality. The permanent defeat of life comes when dreams are surrendered to reality.

dreams.author: Renzo Piano
dreams.text: The difference between a builder and an architect is that an architect also cares about desire, about dreams.

dreams.author: Paul Watson
dreams.text: Follow your dreams and use your natural-born talents and skills to make this a better world for tomorrow.

dreams.author: Leila Lopes
dreams.text: I'm just a normal girl who dreams, who fights for what I believe.

dreams.author: Dave Matthews
dreams.text: Take what you can from your dreams, make them as real as anything.

dreams.author: Robert Kraft
dreams.text: A lot of people have their big dreams and get knocked down and don't have things go their way. And you never give up hope, and you really just hold on to it. Hard work and perserverance. You just keep getting up and getting up, and then you get that breakthrough.

dreams.author: Lauren Daigle
dreams.text: You have to know your identity. It's the biggest thing in wanting to pursue creative dreams.

dreams.author: Roger Vivier
dreams.text: To wear dreams on one's feet is to begin to give a reality to one's dreams.

dreams.author: Greg Anderson
dreams.text: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live.

dreams.author: Desmond Tutu
dreams.text: When we see the face of a child, we think of the future. We think of their dreams about what they might become, and what they might accomplish.

dreams.author: Wes Craven
dreams.text: Some people ask why people would go into a dark room to be scared. I say they are already scared, and they need to have that fear manipulated and massaged. I think of horror movies as the disturbed dreams of a society.

dreams.author: Winnie Harlow
dreams.text: I am the underdog, and I want to prove that one can follow one's dreams despite all the flaws and setbacks.

dreams.author: W. Clement Stone
dreams.text: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.

dreams.author: Nipsey Hussle
dreams.text: I hope my story inspires everyone out there to keep hustling and chasing their dreams.

dreams.author: Aung San Suu Kyi
dreams.text: Freedom and democracy are dreams you never give up.

dreams.author: Romain Rolland
dreams.text: If there is one place on the face of earth where all the dreams of living men have found a home from the very earliest days when man began the dream of existence, it is India.

dreams.author: Scott Adams
dreams.text: Beware of advice about successful people and their methods. For starters, no two situations are alike. Your dreams of creating a dry-cleaning empire won't be helped by knowing that Thomas Edison liked to take naps.

dreams.author: Paula Radcliffe
dreams.text: Never set limits, go after your dreams, don't be afraid to push the boundaries. And laugh a lot - it's good for you!

dreams.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
dreams.text: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service.

dreams.author: Lil Tjay
dreams.text: I want to follow my dreams. I want to make sure that I put myself first and accomplish what I need to accomplish.

dreams.author: Les Brown
dreams.text: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.

dreams.author: Derek Jeter
dreams.text: My office is at Yankee stadium. Yes, dreams do come true.

dreams.author: Bill Duke
dreams.text: Dreams that are planned are called frustration.

dreams.author: Salvador Dali
dreams.text: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdads of his dreams to rise from the dust.

dreams.author: Ileana Ros-Lehtinen
dreams.text: No matter where you are from, no matter what your background is, no matter what your socioeconomic status is, every person can achieve his or her dreams.

dreams.author: Nita Strauss
dreams.text: You see opportunity... Opportunity is like a window: every once in a while, it opens, if you're ready for that opportunity. So be prepared, work hard, and follow your dreams.

dreams.author: Kevin Hart
dreams.text: I stayed true to my dreams and, eventually, they came true.

dreams.author: Tim Berners-Lee
dreams.text: Anyone who has lost track of time when using a computer knows the propensity to dream, the urge to make dreams come true and the tendency to miss lunch.

dreams.author: Benjamin E. Mays
dreams.text: It isn't a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled, but it is a calamity not to dream.

dreams.author: Giotto di Bondone
dreams.text: Take pleasure in your dreams; relish your principles and drape your purest feelings on the heart of a precious lover.

dreams.author: Kevin Kwan
dreams.text: One of the dreams on my wish list is to spend more time in Thailand.

dreams.author: Saroo Brierley
dreams.text: At the end of the day, I think people just need to start listening to their hearts and their gut feelings and their dreams, because that's what I did.

dreams.author: John C. Maxwell
dreams.text: The dreams and passions stored within hearts are powerful keys which can unlock a wealth of potential.

dreams.author: Andre Leon Talley
dreams.text: I'd like to be remembered as someone who made a difference in the lives of young people - that I nurtured someone and taught them to pursue their dreams and their careers, to leave a legacy.

dreams.author: Liang Chow
dreams.text: I never thought in my wildest dreams that I would have my very own school - no way. And I had no idea I'd be coaching girls. It's wild.

dreams.author: Emily Bronte
dreams.text: I have dreamed in my life, dreams that have stayed with me ever after, and changed my ideas; they have gone through and through me, like wine through water, and altered the color of my mind.

dreams.author: Twyla Tharp
dreams.text: In dreams, anything can be anything, and everybody can do. We can fly, we can turn upside down, we can transform into anything.

dreams.author: Rush Limbaugh
dreams.text: Capitalism is always evaluated against dreams. Utopia is a dream. It doesn't exist.

dreams.author: Ajith Kumar
dreams.text: Aren't we all dreamers? It's only because man dreamt of flying that we are travelling in planes. Behind all inventions, we see the dreams of people.

dreams.author: Kristi Yamaguchi
dreams.text: Having achieved my own dreams, I want to give to kids who are less fortunate, who struggle with everyday obstacles. I want to give them something positive in their lives: support.

dreams.author: Liz Murray
dreams.text: Like my mother, I was always saying, 'I'll fix my life one day.' It became clear when I saw her die without fulfilling her dreams that my time was now or maybe never.

dreams.author: Julie Payette
dreams.text: I'm a true believer in the strength of teamwork, in the power of dreams, and in the absolute necessity of a support structure.

dreams.author: Rachel Griffiths
dreams.text: There's nothing as exciting as a comeback - seeing someone with dreams, watching them fail, and then getting a second chance.

dreams.author: Man Ray
dreams.text: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realize them.

dreams.author: Jocko Willink
dreams.text: There is one thing that gets you out of bed in the morning, and that is discipline. Because your dreams and your goals are not there waking up for you in the morning.

dreams.author: David Lynch
dreams.text: I don't remember my dreams too much. I hardly have ever gotten ideas from nighttime dreams. But I love daydreaming and dream logic and the way dreams go.

dreams.author: Juan Felipe Herrera
dreams.text: I want to take everything I have in me, weave it, merge it with the beauty that is in the Library of Congress, all the resources, the guidance of the staff and departments, and launch it with the heart-shaped dreams of the people.

dreams.author: Tiffany Darwish
dreams.text: Life is short. You've got to live your dreams.

dreams.author: James Cameron
dreams.text: There are many talented people who haven't fulfilled their dreams because they over thought it, or they were too cautious, and were unwilling to make the leap of faith.

dreams.author: Hugh Hefner
dreams.text: In my wildest dreams, I could not have imagined a sweeter life.

dreams.author: Wallace Stevens
dreams.text: Death is the mother of Beauty; hence from her, alone, shall come fulfillment to our dreams and our desires.

dreams.author: Julia Cameron
dreams.text: A God Jar is anything you wish it to be, in which you can put your wishes, dreams, problems, prayers. You may want to think of it as a spiritual mailbox.

dreams.author: Ritesh Agarwal
dreams.text: I was a small-town boy with big dreams.

dreams.author: Jay Weatherill
dreams.text: You'll be much more successful if you follow your dreams and follow your passions.

dreams.author: Kendall Jenner
dreams.text: You can't take anything personally in this business. Follow your dreams, but there is a lot of criticism. You have to brush it off. Everybody is looking for something different.

dreams.author: Myles Munroe
dreams.text: Every human heart cries and yearns for the same thing: a chance to fulfill his or her own dreams and desires. Even the poorest man has a dream.

dreams.author: Erich Fromm
dreams.text: Both dreams and myths are important communications from ourselves to ourselves. If we do not understand the language in which they are written, we miss a great deal of what we know and tell ourselves in those hours when we are not busy manipulating the outside world.

dreams.author: Henry Norris Russell
dreams.text: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.

dreams.author: Jane Pauley
dreams.text: I envy people with dreams and passions, but I don't think that way. I still don't have a 'bliss' to follow. For people like me - I suspect that's most people - holding out for a 'dream' or a 'passion' is paralyzing. I just like having work I enjoy that feels meaningful. That's hard enough... but it's enough.

dreams.author: Chief Seattle
dreams.text: Our religion is the traditions of our ancestors - the dreams of our old men, given them in solemn hours of the night by the Great Spirit; and the visions of our sachems, and is written in the hearts of our people.

dreams.author: Havelock Ellis
dreams.text: Dreams are real as long as they last. Can we say more of life?

dreams.author: Robin S. Sharma
dreams.text: The starting point of discovering who you are, your gifts, your talents, your dreams, is being comfortable with yourself. Spend time alone. Write in a journal. Take long walks in the woods.

dreams.author: Kevin Costner
dreams.text: I'm a big fan of dreams. Unfortunately, dreams are our first casualty in life - people seem to give them up, quicker than anything, for a 'reality.'

dreams.author: Princess Diana
dreams.text: I want my boys to have an understanding of people's emotions, their insecurities, people's distress, and their hopes and dreams.

dreams.author: Babar Azam
dreams.text: The World Cup is a very big event. Every player dreams of playing in one, and it was my dream, too.

dreams.author: Jean Baudrillard
dreams.text: Like dreams, statistics are a form of wish fulfillment.

dreams.author: AB de Villiers
dreams.text: There are so many dreams that I'd like to follow.

dreams.author: Douglas MacArthur
dreams.text: In my dreams I hear again the crash of guns, the rattle of musketry, the strange, mournful mutter of the battlefield.

dreams.author: Norman Cousins
dreams.text: People are never more insecure than when they become obsessed with their fears at the expense of their dreams.

dreams.author: Gerard De Nerval
dreams.text: Our dreams are a second life. I have never been able to penetrate without a shudder those ivory or horned gates which separate us from the invisible world.

dreams.author: Brock Lesnar
dreams.text: I'm a big believer in living out your dreams and facing your fears.

dreams.author: Elijah Wood
dreams.text: Dream the impossible because dreams do come true.

dreams.author: Robert Lepage
dreams.text: Nothing is worse than having your dreams come true.

dreams.author: Peter McWilliams
dreams.text: To the degree we're not living our dreams, our comfort zone has more control of us than we have over ourselves.

dreams.author: Arca
dreams.text: Arthur Russell is very important to me on many levels, and when I read Tim Lawrence's biography on him, 'Hold on to Your Dreams,' one of the things I took away was: first thought, best thought. I live by that when I make my own music.

dreams.author: Marine Le Pen
dreams.text: We are in a world where globalization, which is an ideology, has forgotten and put aside the people, the people's interests, aspirations, and dreams.

dreams.author: Susan Sontag
dreams.text: I was not looking for my dreams to interpret my life, but rather for my life to interpret my dreams.

dreams.author: Tika Sumpter
dreams.text: I know it's cliche to say, 'When you do something you love you never work a day in your life.' But it is true: When you do something you love, life gets to be a little bit easier and enjoyable. So I just want people to follow their dreams.

dreams.author: Lester B. Pearson
dreams.text: Of all our dreams today there is none more important - or so hard to realise - than that of peace in the world. May we never lose our faith in it or our resolve to do everything that can be done to convert it one day into reality.

dreams.author: Kailash Satyarthi
dreams.text: The first 'D' is to dream: dream big - not for yourself, but for the country and for the world. The second 'D' is to discover: discover your full potential and the opportunities that surround you; and the third 'D' is to do. 'Do' means to act on your dreams and make best use of the opportunities you have discovered.

dreams.author: Angelique Kerber
dreams.text: Just follow your dreams and be patient.

dreams.author: Alek Wek
dreams.text: I still have dreams in which someone is coming to the door.

dreams.author: Robert H. Schuller
dreams.text: High achievers spot rich opportunities swiftly, make big decisions quickly and move into action immediately. Follow these principles and you can make your dreams come true.

dreams.author: Rani Mukerji
dreams.text: I am quite a dreamer. I think we all are dreamers. We all don't like to live a practical life all the time. There is a thin line between our hopes and dreams.

dreams.author: Steve Harvey
dreams.text: Men don't come up to you to just talk. We come up to you with a plan. We're looking across the room at you, and we don't care about your hopes and dreams. We don't care about what your future holds. We saw something we wanted.

dreams.author: Stromae
dreams.text: It's good to think about real life, no? Because real life isn't just dreams and happiness.

dreams.author: Manoj Bajpayee
dreams.text: I am a mix of both my parents. Like my father, I don't let my dreams die; I'm shy and respect women. However, if I am pushed against the wall, I attack like my mother.

dreams.author: Future
dreams.text: I want that longevity in the career, so if you don't know how to get it, you trying to chase that high, you trying to continue to chase your dreams and conquer things you never thought you could get. And you just want to get there too soon, so you taking the wrong moves to try and compensate what's not happening.

dreams.author: Jackie Gleason
dreams.text: Our dreams are firsthand creations, rather than residues of waking life. We have the capacity for infinite creativity; at least while dreaming, we partake of the power of the Spirit, the infinite Godhead that creates the cosmos.

dreams.author: Chaske Spencer
dreams.text: I have my own production company called Urban Dreams.

dreams.author: Zelda Fitzgerald
dreams.text: We grew up founding our dreams on the infinite promise of American advertising. I still believe that one can learn to play the piano by mail and that mud will give you a perfect complexion.

dreams.author: Roger Federer
dreams.text: When I won in 2003, never in my wildest dreams did I ever think I would win Wimbledon and have my kids seeing me lift the trophy, so this is pretty surreal. And yeah, I was almost shocked in the moment that it all came together so nicely.

dreams.author: Jon Stewart
dreams.text: I'm not just a boy toy. I have feelings and dreams like anybody else.

dreams.author: Kate Winslet
dreams.text: By nature, I'm a very positive person, and because I'm happy in myself, and in my life, and I've got a great husband, and beautiful children, and I have a job that I love that calls for a certain amount of emotional expression, I get to realise a lot of my dreams and aspirations.

dreams.author: W. Bruce Cameron
dreams.text: I don't think my father considered allowing a teenager to follow his dreams was necessarily good parenting, or even parenting. I think he thought I was a teenager with teenage impulses. I'm pretty sure he knew that if he just let me follow those impulses, it would wind up being very expensive and perhaps even life-endangering.

dreams.author: Jean Paul Gaultier
dreams.text: I don't like dreams or reality. I like when dreams become reality because that is my life.

dreams.author: Dario Argento
dreams.text: Films are dreams. Many, many critics say to me that my films are not good because they are too unbelievable, but this is my style. I tell stories like they are dreams. This is my imagination. For me, it would be impossible to do a film that is so precise, that resembles real life.

dreams.author: Ruth Handler
dreams.text: They were using the dolls to project their dreams of their own futures as adult women.

dreams.author: Farrah Abraham
