friendship.text: There is a perfectly good alternative to the European Union - it is called the European Free Trade Association, founded in 1960. Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein are members. E.F.T.A. stands for friendship and cooperation through free trade.

friendship.author: Fiona Hill
friendship.text: Russia and China thawed their frosty relationship in the 1990s and signed a friendship treaty in 2001, but China's rise has increased tensions in every regional relationship.

friendship.author: Robert Parish
friendship.text: I cannot thank Don DeDonatis enough for his leadership of USSSA, his stewardship of our business initiatives, and his friendship to me over the years.

friendship.author: Astrid Kirchherr
friendship.text: The most important thing I gave the Beatles was my friendship. They trusted me: there was no fear in being photographed.

friendship.author: Phan Thi Kim Phuc
friendship.text: There's such a connection between Vietnam and America, but it should be one of friendship. Not bitterness. Not enemies.

friendship.author: Emma Willis
friendship.text: It wasn't love at first sight with Matt - we were friends at the beginning, and our friendship developed.

friendship.author: Declan Donnelly
friendship.text: We always said our career was built on our friendship and that our friendship was the secret of our success. The career just happened by accident.

friendship.author: Declan Donnelly
friendship.text: The first meaningful friendship moment we had was when Ant sent me a Fred Flintstone Christmas card and it said, 'To Dec from Ant, have a yabba dabba do Christmas.'

friendship.author: Declan Donnelly
friendship.text: Ours is a career built on a friendship, not a friendship built on a career.

friendship.author: Matthew Hussey
friendship.text: Friendship language is, 'You look nice tonight.' Desire language is, 'You look hot tonight.'

friendship.author: Rutger Bregman
friendship.text: The real 'Lord of the Flies' is a tale of friendship and loyalty; one that illustrates how much stronger we are if we can lean on each other.

friendship.author: Aaron Dessner
friendship.text: Big Red Machine is really a community effort: I guess it involves almost 30 musicians. It does come out of our friendship, but it's really something that is deeply collaborative.

friendship.author: Kevin Magnussen
friendship.text: But amongst the drivers I don't have friends at all. They are not my friends. It would never work to have a friendship, so I don't make any effort to make friends.

friendship.author: Diana Penty
friendship.text: The bonds of friendship that I forged in my college days are still going strong.

friendship.author: Ananya Birla
friendship.text: I believe that friendship is life's most precious and amazing gift and an incredibly powerful force.

friendship.author: Jasmin Bhasin
friendship.text: When I am linked with close friends, it affects my friendship with them, and that's upsetting.

friendship.author: Jasmin Bhasin
friendship.text: Love can happen any moment, anywhere, but I am also a person who believes more in friendship than love, relationships, and affairs.

friendship.author: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff
friendship.text: With the publication of my book, Melania and Me: The Rise and Fall of My Friendship With the First Lady,' I have exercised my right to free expression.

friendship.author: Ruth Westheimer
friendship.text: I hear you younger people saying how many friends they have on the Internet. That's nonsense. That's not friends, that's acquaintances. The word 'friendship' has lost its significance.

friendship.author: Ruth Westheimer
friendship.text: A friendship has to be cultivated. A friendship you have to give time.

friendship.author: Andrew Ridgeley
friendship.text: It's very difficult to put it into words or really put your finger on exactly what it was that people found so attractive about Wham! But it was a lot to do with George and me and our friendship.

friendship.author: Andrew Ridgeley
friendship.text: I had always been aware of George's importance to me, of the bond of friendship and of the sparkle and light, effervescence and electricity that suffused the music we made.

friendship.author: Andrew Ridgeley
friendship.text: We were bringing Wham! to a close, but we weren't bringing our friendship to a close.

friendship.author: Andrew Ridgeley
friendship.text: Despite the pain of his death, George is still very much alive in my memory today. A few years on from that tragic Christmas, I'll sometimes catch myself thinking of our friendship and those years together as young kids in Wham!

friendship.author: Rick Famuyiwa
friendship.text: I met Forest Whitaker on 'Our Family Wedding' and we struck up a real bond and friendship.

friendship.author: Maxwell Jacob Friedman
friendship.text: Shawn Spears, he is a scumbag. He decided, after years of friendship with one of the greatest men to ever live Cody Rhodes, to waffle him with a chair. No one should be laying a finger on that man, he is a saint.

friendship.author: Michael McElhatton
friendship.text: Roose is a very cold, pragmatic guy, and he's a survivor. He makes choices based on that, and friendship goes out the window.

friendship.author: Rajesh Roshan
friendship.text: In the earlier days, people used to be very emotional about making films. There used to be a great friendship between music directors and directors; today that is missing.

friendship.author: Ashok Saraf
friendship.text: Actually Pu La was my father's friend and their friendship was very typical , as friends should be, fame did not come in between.

friendship.author: Ashok Saraf
friendship.text: I remember that Pu La had come for one of my premieres and I was patiently waiting to hear his verdict of my acting, but when he came out of the theatre during interval, all he asked me was about my father and his well being, such was their friendship.

friendship.author: Pooja Bedi
friendship.text: I don't discriminate between a boy and girl when it comes to friendship.

friendship.author: Sergei Polunin
friendship.text: I realized it's important to have love in your life, it's important to have friendship, it's very important to have mentors and family.

friendship.author: Lauren Ash
friendship.text: I think most humans have experienced a time in their life where they were deeply in love, whether it's romantic or familial or friendship love, with someone who didn't feel the same way back.

friendship.author: Waheeda Rehman
friendship.text: It was the ill-fated Dil Diya Dard Liya in 1966, where she played my friend. Though the film didn't do well, it is remembered for its powerful theme. Shyama was an entertaining friend during the shooting and we continued our friendship even after the film was over.

friendship.author: Waheeda Rehman
friendship.text: Nanda and I never discussed work. Our work never came in the way of our friendship. We were both down-to-earth and very Indian. Both of us attempted glamorous roles but soon realised that it's better to play characters that were close to our personalities.

friendship.author: Shavo Odadjian
friendship.text: When I moved from Armenia to L.A., I moved to North Kingsley Drive. That was my street, that's where I grew up and I saw everything there. I started skateboarding there. I witnessed homelessness, the poor, you know, I noticed gangs. I learned about friendship.

friendship.author: Devin McCourty
friendship.text: I think it's always good when you work out with your teammates. You just develop a stronger friendship, a stronger bond.

friendship.author: Rory MacDonald
friendship.text: I believe in friendship.

friendship.author: Tom Malinowski
friendship.text: Because of the friendship and common interests our two nations share, the U.S. has a stake in Ethiopia's prosperity, stability and success.

friendship.author: Cedi Osman
friendship.text: I didn't know I was going to be really close with LeBron. I knew that we were going to be team-mates but I didn't know that we were going to be this close. We have a really good friendship.

friendship.author: Kathy Burke
friendship.text: 'Walking and Talking' is my love letter to books, '70s television, music and friendship.

friendship.author: Shamita Shetty
friendship.text: Unfortunately, most actors are so insecure that to build a friendship on that kind of foundation is very difficult. So I definitely know a lot of people in this industry, but I don't have any 4 A. M. friends as such.

friendship.author: Divya Agarwal
friendship.text: There is a very thin line between relationship and friendship.

friendship.author: Jagapathi Babu
friendship.text: I believe in friendship over money and that's how I lost a lot.

friendship.author: Emma Corrin
friendship.text: Someone at school said I dance like a spider, and I've never got beyond that. It's always been a running joke in my friendship groups.

friendship.author: Dawn O'Porter
friendship.text: One of the main reasons I wanted to write about female friendship is because it's so powerful and underestimated.

friendship.author: Dawn O'Porter
friendship.text: I have an odd relationship with motherhood. I've never had that relationship of this unconditional friendship, deep bond that you have with somebody, but I have it now with my son.

friendship.author: Ruth Jones
friendship.text: I knew I wanted to write about female friendship. I've got a few friends I've known since we were teenagers, who have spanned the decades, and I do find that a fascinating thing, that friendship can last that length of time.

friendship.author: Ruth Jones
friendship.text: I wanted to write a book about female friendship, because it's a constant that goes right through to the end of our days. Over time, romantic love changes and often becomes something different, but friendship stays pretty much the same.

friendship.author: Joe Gatto
friendship.text: Literally, our show is friendship on display. It's not a written comedy show. It's not a reality show. It's just four friends making each other laugh. And who doesn't enjoy watching people enjoy their friends?

friendship.author: Justin Rose
friendship.text: Sergio and I have played a lot of golf together since we were 14 years old. We have a great friendship and a good rivalry.

friendship.author: James Murray
friendship.text: We wanted to create a show that put our friendship on display.

friendship.author: James Murray
friendship.text: Impractical Jokers' is all about friendship.

friendship.author: Dino Morea
friendship.text: I have great friends in film industry but professionalism and friendship are two different cups of tea.

friendship.author: Gilbert Burns
friendship.text: We'll always have respect, but there's no friendship inside the octagon, no smiles or fun games. I'm there to knock you out or submit you. Worst case scenario, I want to dominate the entire fight.

friendship.author: Gilbert Burns
friendship.text: Sometimes the opponent is more cool, sometimes he's not, but there's no friendship inside the octagon, only when the fight is over.

friendship.author: Fearne Cotton
friendship.text: My friendship circle is minuscule.

friendship.author: Lou Sanders
friendship.text: Usually, you only know a neighbour due to their proximity rather than their personality. It's 'can you take my parcel' rather than 'I think our souls are the perfect mix for friendship.'

friendship.author: Prachi Desai
friendship.text: To be honest, nobody in this industry is your friend, but you can be friendly with everybody. I share a great rapport with a lot of people. But it's not the kind of friendship that I have with my school friends.

friendship.author: Randi Zuckerberg
friendship.text: I've known Brisa Trinchero for years. Our friendship blossomed in our love for the arts, but it's come into full bloom as I've watched Brisa growing her own company from the ground up. She's a relentless worker with a big heart and an imaginative mind.

friendship.author: Jackky Bhagnani
friendship.text: Friendship means everything to me.

friendship.author: David Essex
friendship.text: Love and friendship are really the key, I believe, to a relationship - although I can't claim to be an expert!

friendship.author: Ethel Barrymore
friendship.text: The best time to make friends is before you need them.

friendship.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
friendship.text: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.

friendship.author: Giotto di Bondone
friendship.text: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.

friendship.author: Plautus
friendship.text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.

friendship.author: W. Somerset Maugham
friendship.text: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.

friendship.author: Len Wein
friendship.text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.

friendship.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
friendship.text: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.

friendship.author: Arnold H. Glasow
friendship.text: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.

friendship.author: Herman Melville
friendship.text: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.

friendship.author: Jennifer Aniston
friendship.text: Where would you be without friends? The people to pick you up when you need lifting? We come from homes far from perfect, so you end up almost parent and sibling to your friends - your own chosen family. There's nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend. Nothing.

friendship.author: Thomas A. Edison
friendship.text: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.

friendship.author: Barack Obama
friendship.text: To avoid being mistaken for a sellout, I chose my friends carefully. The more politically active black students. The foreign students. The Chicanos. The Marxist professors and structural feminists and punk-rock performance poets.

friendship.author: Charles Caleb Colton
friendship.text: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.

friendship.author: Robert E. Lee
friendship.text: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.

friendship.author: Dag Hammarskjold
friendship.text: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.

friendship.author: Henry Adams
friendship.text: Friends are born, not made.

friendship.author: Doug Larson
friendship.text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!

friendship.author: John Webster
friendship.text: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.

friendship.author: Taylor Swift
friendship.text: All you need to do to be my friend is like me.

friendship.author: Elizabeth Taylor
friendship.text: You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal.

friendship.author: Jean de la Bruyere
friendship.text: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.

friendship.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
friendship.text: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.

friendship.author: Pam Brown
friendship.text: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.

friendship.author: Saint Augustine
friendship.text: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.

friendship.author: Justin Bieber
friendship.text: Friends are the best to turn to when you're having a rough day.

friendship.author: Saint Francis de Sales
friendship.text: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.

friendship.author: Sarah Orne Jewett
friendship.text: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.

friendship.author: Mario Puzo
friendship.text: Friendship and money: oil and water.

friendship.author: Charles Kingsley
friendship.text: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, Can never know what true friendship means.

friendship.author: Joseph Roux
friendship.text: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.

friendship.author: Mignon McLaughlin
friendship.text: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.

friendship.author: Richard Burton
friendship.text: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.

friendship.author: George MacDonald
friendship.text: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.

friendship.author: Shirley MacLaine
friendship.text: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.

friendship.author: E. W. Howe
friendship.text: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.

friendship.author: George Santayana
friendship.text: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.

friendship.author: Sophocles
friendship.text: You win the victory when you yield to friends.

friendship.author: Hilaire Belloc
friendship.text: When friendship disappears then there is a space left open to that awful loneliness of the outside world which is like the cold space between the planets. It is an air in which men perish utterly.

friendship.author: Zora Neale Hurston
friendship.text: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.

friendship.author: Francesco Guicciardini
friendship.text: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.

friendship.author: Laurence J. Peter
friendship.text: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.

friendship.author: Amos Bronson Alcott
friendship.text: Our friends interpret the world and ourselves to us, if we take them tenderly and truly.

friendship.author: Unknown
friendship.text: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.

friendship.author: Frederick William Faber
friendship.text: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.

friendship.author: Aristotle
friendship.text: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.

friendship.author: Robert Hall
friendship.text: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.

friendship.author: Augustine Birrell
friendship.text: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.

friendship.author: Charles Eastman
friendship.text: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.

friendship.author: Henry David Thoreau
friendship.text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.

friendship.author: Joseph Brodsky
friendship.text: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.

friendship.author: Katherine Mansfield
friendship.text: I always felt that the great high privilege, relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.

friendship.author: Jodie Foster
friendship.text: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.

friendship.author: Eugene Kennedy
friendship.text: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?

friendship.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
friendship.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.

friendship.author: Judy Holliday
friendship.text: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.

friendship.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
friendship.text: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.

friendship.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
friendship.text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.

friendship.author: George Jean Nathan
friendship.text: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.

friendship.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck
friendship.text: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.

friendship.author: Thomas Jefferson
friendship.text: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.

friendship.author: Francis Quarles
friendship.text: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.

friendship.author: Honore de Balzac
friendship.text: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.

friendship.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
friendship.text: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.

friendship.author: Khalil Gibran
friendship.text: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.

friendship.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
friendship.text: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.

friendship.author: Elbert Hubbard
friendship.text: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.

friendship.author: Alice Miller
friendship.text: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends - you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.

friendship.author: Emil Ludwig
friendship.text: Many a person has held close, throughout their entire lives, two friends that always remained strange to one another, because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity, the other by difference.

friendship.author: Robert Staughton Lynd
friendship.text: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.

friendship.author: Euripides
friendship.text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.

friendship.author: Mencius
friendship.text: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.

friendship.author: Confucius
friendship.text: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.

friendship.author: Thomas Aquinas
friendship.text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.

friendship.author: Aristotle
friendship.text: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.

friendship.author: Henry David Thoreau
friendship.text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.

friendship.author: Henri Nouwen
friendship.text: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.

friendship.author: Henry Adams
friendship.text: A friend in power is a friend lost.

friendship.author: Baltasar Gracian
friendship.text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.

friendship.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
friendship.text: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.

friendship.author: Oscar Wilde
friendship.text: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.

friendship.author: Samuel Pepys
friendship.text: Mighty proud I am that I am able to have a spare bed for my friends.

friendship.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
friendship.text: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.

friendship.author: Thomas Jefferson
friendship.text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.

friendship.author: E. W. Howe
friendship.text: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.

friendship.author: Jean de La Fontaine
friendship.text: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.

friendship.author: Chanakya
friendship.text: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.

friendship.author: Khalil Gibran
friendship.text: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.

friendship.author: Henry David Thoreau
friendship.text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.

friendship.author: Aristotle
friendship.text: He who hath many friends hath none.

friendship.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
friendship.text: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.

friendship.author: Oscar Wilde
friendship.text: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.

friendship.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
friendship.text: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.

friendship.author: Confucius
friendship.text: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.

friendship.author: Euripides
friendship.text: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.

friendship.author: Baltasar Gracian
friendship.text: Never have a companion that casts you in the shade.

friendship.author: Khalil Gibran
friendship.text: Your friend is your needs answered.

friendship.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
friendship.text: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.

friendship.author: Oscar Wilde
friendship.text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

friendship.author: Henry David Thoreau
friendship.text: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.

friendship.author: Orson Welles
friendship.text: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.

friendship.author: Ann Landers
friendship.text: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

friendship.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
friendship.text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.

friendship.author: Jean de La Fontaine
friendship.text: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.

friendship.author: John Wooden
friendship.text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.

friendship.author: Bruce Lee
friendship.text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.

friendship.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
friendship.text: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.

friendship.author: Saint Basil
friendship.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.

friendship.author: Confucius
friendship.text: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.

friendship.author: Rabindranath Tagore
friendship.text: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.

friendship.author: Simone de Beauvoir
friendship.text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

friendship.author: Joseph Campbell
friendship.text: Love is a friendship set to music.

friendship.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
friendship.text: Friendship is a sheltering tree.

friendship.author: Thomas Jefferson
friendship.text: Peace, commerce and honest friendship with all nations; entangling alliances with none.

friendship.author: Edgar Allan Poe
friendship.text: There is something in the unselfish and self-sacrificing love of a brute, which goes directly to the heart of him who has had frequent occasion to test the paltry friendship and gossamer fidelity of mere Man.

friendship.author: Lord Byron
friendship.text: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.

friendship.author: Jerry Lewis
friendship.text: I have a loyalty that runs in my bloodstream, when I lock into someone or something, you can't get me away from it because I commit that thoroughly. That's in friendship, that's a deal, that's a commitment. Don't give me paper - I can get the same lawyer who drew it up to break it. But if you shake my hand, that's for life.

friendship.author: Regina Brett
friendship.text: I usually give a book 40 pages. If it doesn't grab me by then, adios. With young adult books, you can usually tell by Page 4 if it's worth the time. The author establishes the conflict early, sometimes in the first sentence. The themes of hope, family, friendship and overcoming hardship appeal to most everyone.

friendship.author: Robert Southey
friendship.text: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.

friendship.author: Simon Sinek
friendship.text: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.

friendship.author: Ray Bradbury
friendship.text: If we listened to our intellect, we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go into business, because we'd be cynical. Well, that's nonsense. You've got to jump off cliffs all the time and build your wings on the way down.

friendship.author: Anton Chekhov
friendship.text: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.

friendship.author: Jacqueline Leo
friendship.text: One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.

friendship.author: Maria Shriver
friendship.text: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.

friendship.author: Jeremy Taylor
friendship.text: Love is friendship set on fire.

friendship.author: Cornelius Vanderbilt
friendship.text: There is no friendship in trade.

friendship.author: Christie Brinkley
friendship.text: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.

friendship.author: Albert Camus
friendship.text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.

friendship.author: St. Jerome
friendship.text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.

friendship.author: Yolanda Hadid
friendship.text: I have learned that friendship isn't about who you've known the longest, it's about who came and never left your side.

friendship.author: Anna Deavere Smith
friendship.text: Friendship is a wildly underrated medication.

friendship.author: Rachel Simmons
friendship.text: A healthy friendship is one where you share your true feelings without fearing the end of the relationship. It's also one where you sometimes have to let things that bug you slide. The tough moments will make you wiser about yourself and each other. They will also make you stronger and closer as friends.

friendship.author: Rene Girard
friendship.text: We are aware that globalization doesn't mean global friendship but global competition and, therefore, conflict. That doesn't mean we will all destroy each other, but it is no happy global village, either.

friendship.author: Samuel Johnson
friendship.text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.

friendship.author: Henry Ward Beecher
friendship.text: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.

friendship.author: Edward Young
friendship.text: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.

friendship.author: Jane Austen
friendship.text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.

friendship.author: Charles Lamb
friendship.text: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and have her nonsense respected.

friendship.author: Roger Ailes
friendship.text: I only understand friendship or scorched earth.

friendship.author: Christian Dior
friendship.text: All I required to be happy was friendship and people I could admire.

friendship.author: Marilyn Monroe
friendship.text: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.

friendship.author: Joseph Addison
friendship.text: True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one's self, and in the next, from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.

friendship.author: Voltaire
friendship.text: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.

friendship.author: Samuel Butler
friendship.text: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.

friendship.author: Amy Grant
friendship.text: Faith is salted and peppered through everything at Christmas. And I love at least one night by the Christmas tree to sing and feel the quiet holiness of that time that's set apart to celebrate love, friendship, and God's gift of the Christ child.

friendship.author: Edinson Cavani
friendship.text: Football is about sacrifice, dedication, a lot of work, and friendship off the pitch.

friendship.author: Michelle Obama
friendship.text: The fact is, with every friendship you make, and every bond of trust you establish, you are shaping the image of America projected to the rest of the world. That is so important. So when you study abroad, you're actually helping to make America stronger.

friendship.author: Shehbaz Sharif
friendship.text: Pak-China friendship is higher than Himalayas, deeper than ocean, sweeter than honey, and stronger than steel.

friendship.author: Mao Zedong
friendship.text: The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.

friendship.author: Thiruvalluvar
friendship.text: The enemies cannot destroy the king who has at his service the respect and friendship of the wise men who can find fault, disagree, and correct him.

friendship.author: Charles Dickens
friendship.text: Fan the sinking flame of hilarity with the wing of friendship; and pass the rosy wine.

friendship.author: Anne Lamott
friendship.text: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.

friendship.author: Lauren Conrad
friendship.text: Some people are willing to betray years of friendship just to get a little bit of the spotlight.

friendship.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
friendship.text: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.

friendship.author: John F. Kelly
friendship.text: We have a saying in the Marine Corps and that is 'no better friend, no worse enemy, than a U.S. Marine.' We always hope for the first, friendship, but are certainly more than ready for the second.

friendship.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun
friendship.text: Real friendship, like real poetry, is extremely rare - and precious as a pearl.

friendship.author: Emily Bronte
friendship.text: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?

friendship.author: Harbhajan Singh
friendship.text: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.

friendship.author: Truman Capote
friendship.text: Friendship is a pretty full-time occupation if you really are friendly with somebody. You can't have too many friends because then you're just not really friends.

friendship.author: Lisa See
friendship.text: People come in and out of our lives, and the true test of friendship is whether you can pick back up right where you left off the last time you saw each other.

friendship.author: Arthur Ashe
friendship.text: We must reach out our hand in friendship and dignity both to those who would befriend us and those who would be our enemy.

friendship.author: Alfred A. Montapert
friendship.text: All lasting business is built on friendship.

friendship.author: Vlade Divac
friendship.text: To build a friendship takes so much time and so many years. To ruin it, just seconds.

friendship.author: Seneca
friendship.text: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.

friendship.author: Toyah Willcox
friendship.text: You should never undermine friendship and loyalty.

friendship.author: Samuel Richardson
friendship.text: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.

friendship.author: Michel de Montaigne
friendship.text: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.

friendship.author: Thomas Moore
friendship.text: Came but for friendship, and took away love.

friendship.author: Jane Green
friendship.text: I think friendship is more important than love, but that love that grows out of friendship is the very best of all.

friendship.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
friendship.text: All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon the sand.

friendship.author: Dustin Lance Black
friendship.text: If you do something with acceptance and kindness, you can create a true friendship.

friendship.author: William Wycherley
friendship.text: Good fellowship and friendship are lasting, rational and manly pleasures.

friendship.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
friendship.text: The steady discipline of intimate friendship with Jesus results in men becoming like Him.

friendship.author: Lou Holtz
friendship.text: When the bank asks me about my assets, I include my friendship with Regis Philbin.

friendship.author: Mariella Frostrup
friendship.text: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.

friendship.author: Stendhal
friendship.text: Friendship has its illusions no less than love.

friendship.author: Dalai Lama
friendship.text: Even an animal, if you show genuine affection, gradually trust develops... If you always showing bad face and beating, how can you develop friendship?

friendship.author: Chelsea Handler
friendship.text: The love that comes from friendship is the underlying facet of a happy life.

friendship.author: Kenny Rogers
friendship.text: There has to be chemistry in a duet, but if you go beyond the point of friendship and attraction, you lose something.

friendship.author: Brett Kavanaugh
friendship.text: I was in high school - and I went to an all-boys Catholic high school, a Jesuit high school, where I was focused on academics and athletics, going to church every Sunday at Little Flower, working on my service projects, and friendship, friendship with my fellow classmates and friendship with girls from the local all-girls Catholic schools.

friendship.author: H. L. Mencken
friendship.text: One of the most mawkish of human delusions is the notion that friendship should be eternal, or, at all events, life-long, and that any act which puts a term to it is somehow discreditable.

friendship.author: Alexander Graham Bell
friendship.text: I have discovered that my interest in my dear pupil, Mabel, has ripened into a far deeper feeling than that of mere friendship. In fact, I know that I have learned to love her very sincerely.

friendship.author: Oscar Wilde
friendship.text: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.

friendship.author: Malcolm Arnold
friendship.text: Music is the social act of communication among people, a gesture of friendship, the strongest there is.

friendship.author: Montesquieu
friendship.text: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.

friendship.author: Francois Lelord
friendship.text: Very different from eros is philia, a serene love much more akin to friendship, with its reciprocal kindnesses. You love each other for the happy experiences and pleasures you share.

friendship.author: Charles de Lint
friendship.text: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.

friendship.author: Petrarch
friendship.text: Suspicion is the cancer of friendship.

friendship.author: Pietro Aretino
friendship.text: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.

friendship.author: Marie de France
friendship.text: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!

friendship.author: Ram Dass
friendship.text: We come into relationships often very much identified with our needs. I need this, I need security, I need refuge, I need friendship. And all of relationships are symbiotic in that sense. We come together because we fulfill each others' needs at some level or other.

friendship.author: J. Paul Getty
friendship.text: During the 1950s, Aristotle Onassis and I formed what grew to be a close friendship and association in several business ventures.

friendship.author: Alain de Botton
friendship.text: The arrogance that says analysing the relationship between reasons and causes is more important than writing a philosophy of shyness or sadness or friendship drives me nuts. I can't accept that.

friendship.author: Joe Biden
friendship.text: You've got to reach a hand of friendship across the aisle and across philosophies in this country.

friendship.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
friendship.text: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.

friendship.author: Emil Zatopek
friendship.text: Great is the victory, but the friendship of all is greater.

friendship.author: Charlotte Bronte
friendship.text: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship, we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.

friendship.author: Daryl Davis
friendship.text: If you spend five minutes with your worst enemy - it doesn't have to be about race, it could be about anything... you will find that you both have something in common. As you build upon those commonalities, you're forming a relationship and as you build about that relationship, you're forming a friendship.

friendship.author: Whitney Wolfe Herd
friendship.text: Love, friendship, networking - these are all critical connections and the foundation of a healthy, happy life.

friendship.author: Ernie Banks
friendship.text: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.

friendship.author: Salman Rushdie
friendship.text: Friendships are the family we make - not the one we inherit. I've always been someone to whom friendship, elective affinities, is as important as family.

friendship.author: Daniel Levitin
friendship.text: Our species uses music and dance to express various feelings: love, joy, comfort, ceremony, knowledge, and friendship. And each one is distinct and widely recognized within cultures. Love songs cause us to move slowly and fluidly, for example, while songs of joy inspire us to dance in a full-body aerobic way.

friendship.author: Francis Bacon
friendship.text: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.

friendship.author: Stanley Hauerwas
friendship.text: To be poor does not mean you lack the means to extend charity to another. You may lack money or food, but you have the gift of friendship to overwhelm the loneliness that grips the lives of so many.

friendship.author: Oliver Goldsmith
friendship.text: Pity and friendship are two passions incompatible with each other.

friendship.author: Larry Flynt
friendship.text: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.

friendship.author: Jena Malone
friendship.text: A lot of the powerful religious leaders, from Jesus to Buddha to Tibetan monks, they're really talking about the same things: love and acceptable, and the value of friendship, and respecting yourself so you can respect others.

friendship.author: Lucan
friendship.text: Nobody ever chooses the already unfortunate as objects of his loyal friendship.

friendship.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
friendship.text: One of the surest evidences of friendship that one individual can display to another is telling him gently of a fault. If any other can excel it, it is listening to such a disclosure with gratitude, and amending the error.

friendship.author: George Herbert
friendship.text: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.

friendship.author: Kenneth Branagh
friendship.text: Friendship is one of the most tangible things in a world which offers fewer and fewer supports.

friendship.author: Edward Gibbon
friendship.text: I understand by this passion the union of desire, friendship, and tenderness, which is inflamed by a single female, which prefers her to the rest of her sex, and which seeks her possession as the supreme or the sole happiness of our being.

friendship.author: Simone Weil
friendship.text: To want friendship is a great fault. Friendship ought to be a gratuitous joy, like the joys afforded by art or life.

friendship.author: Charles B. Rangel
friendship.text: Since the Korean War, U.S. and South Korea have established an enduring friendship with shared interests, such as denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula, combating aggression abroad and developing our economies.

friendship.author: Eustace Budgell
friendship.text: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.

friendship.author: Neale Donald Walsch
friendship.text: As told in Friendship with God, if we simply decided to believe and act as if first, we're all one, and second, life is eternal, it would render virtually everything we've done all our lives pointless.

friendship.author: William Hazlitt
friendship.text: Do not keep on with a mockery of friendship after the substance is gone - but part, while you can part friends. Bury the carcass of friendship: it is not worth embalming.

friendship.author: Ali Krieger
friendship.text: I know, firsthand, that soccer brings people together - all it takes is a ball and a few people, and the seeds of friendship are planted.

friendship.author: Emma Bunton
friendship.text: I think the way to keep a friendship is to respect that everybody is different.

friendship.author: Sting
friendship.text: Success always necessitates a degree of ruthlessness. Given the choice of friendship or success, I'd probably choose success.

friendship.author: Lucy Larcom
friendship.text: A friend is a beloved mystery; dearest always because he is not ourself, and has something in him which it is impossible for us to fathom. If it were not so, friendship would lose its chief zest.

friendship.author: James Whistler
friendship.text: The rare few, who, early in life have rid themselves of the friendship of the many.

friendship.author: George Foreman
friendship.text: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.

friendship.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
friendship.text: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.

friendship.author: Jimmy Chin
friendship.text: A lot of why I climb is for the friendship, the loyalty and trust, the shared experience of being in that moment.

friendship.author: James F. Byrnes
friendship.text: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.

friendship.author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
friendship.text: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanism of friendship.

friendship.author: Clifton Fadiman
friendship.text: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.

friendship.author: George Washington
friendship.text: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.

friendship.author: Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador
friendship.text: We will pursue a relationship of friendship and co-operation with the United States, always rooted in mutual respect and in the defence of our fellow Mexicans who live and work honourably in that country.

friendship.author: William Glasser
friendship.text: Caring for but never trying to own may be a further way to define friendship.

friendship.author: Hu Jintao
friendship.text: China has been committed to the independent foreign policy of peace and has developed friendship and cooperation with all countries on the basis of the Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence.

friendship.author: Tim Allen
friendship.text: Dad needs to show an incredible amount of respect and humor and friendship toward his mate so the kids understand their parents are sexy, they're fun, they do things together, they're best friends. Kids learn by example. If I respect Mom, they're going to respect Mom.

friendship.author: Dennis Prager
friendship.text: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?

friendship.author: Fiona Apple
friendship.text: Life is all about the friendship and the love and the music. It sounds silly, but it is. I want to have that experience as much as I can as an adult, not as a kid doing something that people are telling her she has to do. If anyone gets in my way, I'm going to get them out of my way.

friendship.author: John Wooden
friendship.text: Friendship is two-sided. It isn't a friend just because someone's doing something nice for you. That's a nice person. There's friendship when you do for each other. It's like marriage - it's two-sided.

friendship.author: Jeon Yeo-been
friendship.text: I grew up watching Hong Kong noir films. As a kid, I often imagined myself playing the lead role in such movies, performing gun fights and sacrificing myself for the sake of friendship.

friendship.author: Charles Caleb Colton
friendship.text: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.

friendship.author: Rowan Williams
friendship.text: Friendship is something that creates equality and mutuality, not a reward for finding equality or a way of intensifying existing mutuality.

friendship.author: Ron Funches
friendship.text: I think I'd probably be really good friends with Hulk Hogan. I think we'd get along, and I'd, like, chill him out because he'd be all rambunctious and rowdy, and I'd be like, 'Chill out, Hulk Hogan. Everything will be okay.' And he'd be like, 'Thanks, Ron.' And then we'd form a friendship.

friendship.author: Adam Clayton
friendship.text: From an early age I didn't buy into the value systems of working hard in a nine-to-five job. I thought creativity, friendship and loyalty and pushing the boundaries of what was acceptable was much more interesting.

friendship.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
friendship.text: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.

friendship.author: Aimee Teegarden
friendship.text: I don't know if I've ever been in a clique. The older I've gotten, the more I've realized what a true friend really is. So my friendship circle has changed a bit.

friendship.author: Rutger Bregman
friendship.text: But I think 'Love, Actually' has a very realistic view of human nature in line with the latest scientific evidence. The opening scene, where Hugh Grant's character talks about the arrivals gate at Heathrow, is about friendship and connection, it's about who we really are as a species.

friendship.author: Sydney Smith
friendship.text: Madam, I have been looking for a person who disliked gravy all my life; let us swear eternal friendship.

friendship.author: Wole Soyinka
friendship.text: I take friendship very seriously.

friendship.author: Nargis Fakhri
friendship.text: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.

friendship.author: Tim Cope
friendship.text: Ultimately, it's a sense of camaraderie and friendship with local people that is core to my journeys.

friendship.author: Marcelene Cox
friendship.text: One sure way to lose another woman's friendship is to try to improve her flower arrangements.

friendship.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
friendship.text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.

friendship.author: Delilah
friendship.text: A lot of times, in our culture and our society, we put romantic love somehow on a higher plane than self-love and friendship love. You can't do that. You have to honor and really fully invest in all these different loving relationships.

friendship.author: Luanne Rice
friendship.text: 'Safe Harbor' is a state of mind... it's the place - in reality or metaphor - to which one goes in times of trouble or worry. It can be a friendship, marriage, church, garden, beach, poem, prayer, or song.

friendship.author: Gertrude Stein
friendship.text: Before the flowers of friendship faded friendship faded.

friendship.author: Tony Todd
friendship.text: As far as 'Final Destination' and its creator, Jeffrey Reddick, are concerned, whenever Jeffrey calls, because of our friendship, I have to listen.

friendship.author: Hanya Yanagihara
friendship.text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.

friendship.author: Richard Lugar
friendship.text: I would like to raise my glass to friendship between Russia and the United States.

friendship.author: Joel Edgerton
friendship.text: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.

friendship.author: Henry Ward Beecher
friendship.text: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.

friendship.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
friendship.text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.

friendship.author: Frankie Bridge
friendship.text: As we all know, mental health matters, while we still have a long way to go, we're starting to see the wheels turning for real and meaningful change. As a parent of young boys, the fact these conversations will be happening at home, in their friendship groups and in the classroom is so important.

friendship.author: Samuel Johnson
friendship.text: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef; love, like being enlivened with champagne.

friendship.author: Rachel Simmons
friendship.text: There are no shortcuts to genuine friendship. Relationships are built over time.

friendship.author: William Hazlitt
friendship.text: Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others!

friendship.author: Grimes
friendship.text: There are a lot of musicians I've met on Twitter where it was like, 'Hey, I like your music' - and then I ended up meeting them and it turned into a friendship.

friendship.author: Jean de la Bruyere
friendship.text: Love and friendship exclude each other.

friendship.author: Martin Freeman
friendship.text: Like any friendship or marriage, familiarity breeds more contempt, and love, and everything.

friendship.author: Martin Seligman
friendship.text: On the relationship side, if you teach people to respond actively and constructively when someone they care about has a victory, it increases love and friendship and decreases the probability of depression.

friendship.author: Jeff Ross
friendship.text: People are roasting each other at parties, at work events, around the fire. It's so fun. People are busting each other's chops, and it's a sign of affection, truly. It's a true test of love and friendship: can you make a man laugh at himself? So what makes a good burn? Go after targets you love and respect. And hit 'em hard.

friendship.author: David Storey
friendship.text: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.

friendship.author: Mohanlal
friendship.text: Friendship is accepting a person with all their qualities - good and bad.

friendship.author: Jane Austen
friendship.text: General benevolence, but not general friendship, made a man what he ought to be.

friendship.author: Greg Bear
friendship.text: Ray Bradbury is, for many reasons, the most influential writer in my life. Throughout our long friendship, Ray supplied not only his terrific stories but a grand model of what a writer could be, should be, and yet rarely is: brilliant and charming and accessible, willing to tolerate and to teach, happy to inspire but also to be inspired.

friendship.author: Park Hyung-sik
friendship.text: It's so great to be able to express the friendship between men.

friendship.author: Mahmoud Ahmadinejad
friendship.text: Those who insist on having hostilities with us, kill and destroy the option of friendship with us in the future, which is unfortunate because it is clear the future belongs to Iran and that enmities will be fruitless.

friendship.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
friendship.text: If we are to judge of love by its consequences, it more nearly resembles hatred than friendship.

friendship.author: Marie Antoinette
friendship.text: Your Majesty may rest assured about my conduct towards the Comtesse de Provence; I will certainly try and gain her friendship and confidence, without going too far.

friendship.author: August Strindberg
friendship.text: Friendship can only exist between persons with similar interests and points of view. Man and woman by the conventions of society are born with different interests and different points of view.

friendship.author: Epicurus
friendship.text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.

friendship.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
friendship.text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.

friendship.author: C. S. Lewis
friendship.text: Eros will have naked bodies; Friendship naked personalities.

friendship.author: St. Jerome
friendship.text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.

friendship.author: Joyce Carol Oates
friendship.text: Primarily, 'Black Girl/White Girl' is the story of two very different, yet somehow 'fated' girls; for Genna, her 'friendship' with Minette is the most haunting of her life, though it is one-sided and ends in tragedy.

friendship.author: Zadie Smith
friendship.text: A lot of women, when they're young, feel they have very good friends, and find later on that friendship is complicated. It's easy to be friends when everyone's 18.

friendship.author: W. Bruce Cameron
friendship.text: If I'm right, the only reason our species is still around is because of our friendship with the canines.

friendship.author: Lysander Spooner
friendship.text: A traitor is a betrayer - one who practices injury, while professing friendship. Benedict Arnold was a traitor, solely because, while professing friendship for the American cause, he attempted to injure it. An open enemy, however criminal in other respects, is no traitor.

friendship.author: Lord Byron
friendship.text: Friendship is Love without his wings!

friendship.author: Anais Nin
friendship.text: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?

friendship.author: J. Donald Walters
friendship.text: Happiness is understanding that friendship is more precious than mere things, more precious than getting your own way, more precious than being in situations where true principles are not at stake.

friendship.author: Paul Theroux
friendship.text: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.

friendship.author: Jamie Campbell Bower
friendship.text: I went to boarding school in the country, so there's no real differentiation between family and friends. I went there from when I was 8 until I was 17 - it was insane. If you earn my friendship, you are my family, and I'll do anything for you.

friendship.author: William Hazlitt
friendship.text: Few things tend more to alienate friendship than a want of punctuality in our engagements. I have known the breach of a promise to dine or sup to break up more than one intimacy.

friendship.author: John Tyler
friendship.text: So far as it depends on the course of this government, our relations of good will and friendship will be sedulously cultivated with all nations.

friendship.author: Thomas Fuller
friendship.text: There is a scarcity of friendship, but not of friends.

friendship.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
friendship.text: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man, but for this to endure, it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.

friendship.author: Thomas Moore
friendship.text: A friendship that like love is warm; A love like friendship, steady.

friendship.author: William Blake
friendship.text: Opposition is true friendship.

friendship.author: Lyoto Machida
friendship.text: Separating your profession from friendship is very difficult.

friendship.author: Mortimer Adler
friendship.text: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.

friendship.author: Emily Bett Rickards
friendship.text: When you start a relationship, there's part of the friendship that dies - you can never go back.

friendship.author: Nir Eyal
friendship.text: If the food of friendship is time together, how do we make the time to ensure we're all fed? My friends and I have recently come across a way to keep each other close. It fits into our lifestyles despite busy schedules and a surfeit of children. We call it the 'kibbutz.'

friendship.author: Thiruvalluvar
friendship.text: People of noble character are afraid of keeping friendship with dishonorable people. But people of discreditable character consider friendship with the dishonorable as a blood relationship.

friendship.author: John Frusciante
friendship.text: For me my friendship with Omar Rodriguez from Mars Volta that friendship really means a lot to me because he's another creative person who works as hard as I do.

friendship.author: Alain de Botton
friendship.text: The solution as consumers is - perhaps surprisingly - to take adverts very, very seriously. We should ask ourselves what it is that we find lovely in them - the visions of friendship, togetherness, repose, or whatever. And then consider what would actually help us find these qualities in our lives.

friendship.author: Cornelia Otis Skinner
friendship.text: To cement a new friendship, especially between foreigners or persons of a different social world, a spark with which both were secretly charged must fly from person to person, and cut across the accidents of place and time.

friendship.author: Amity Shlaes
friendship.text: Anything can be done if you find friends to do it with. The lucky biographers find themselves drawn into a sort of friendship with their subject.

friendship.author: Albert Camus
friendship.text: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.

friendship.author: Alban Berg
friendship.text: I can tell you, dearest friend, that if it became known how much friendship, love and a world of human and spiritual references I have smuggled into these three movements, the adherents of programme music - should there be any left - would go mad with joy.

friendship.author: Thalia
friendship.text: Friendship is something that is cultivated.

friendship.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
friendship.text: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.

friendship.author: Marquis de Lafayette
friendship.text: Never was a man further from a partiality for Spain than I am. But I think I now have left them in a sincere and steady intention to cultivate the friendship of America.

friendship.author: Madeleine Albright
friendship.text: No matter what message you are about to deliver somewhere, whether it is holding out a hand of friendship, or making clear that you disapprove of something, is the fact that the person sitting across the table is a human being, so the goal is to always establish common ground.

friendship.author: Jennie
friendship.text: We think the friendship between us is a very important aspect for our group, and we try to keep that in a very naturally, like without love, we don't have to try too hard, but it's always needs to be there. So, we remind each other all the time that, when you're going through a hard time, we have the hard time with you.

friendship.author: Jennifer Aniston
friendship.text: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.

friendship.author: Elbert Hubbard
friendship.text: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.

friendship.author: George Santayana
friendship.text: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.

friendship.author: Thomas Jefferson
friendship.text: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.

friendship.author: Sallust
friendship.text: The firmest friendship is based on an identity of likes and dislikes.

friendship.author: Cole Sprouse
friendship.text: I think the truth about male friendship is often left out of the media, and it's that it has a million different shades, because masculinity has a million different forms.

friendship.author: Joe Lhota
friendship.text: The bracelet says 'Fear Nothing.' It was given to me by my friends, and it was made for me and my friends during the period of time that I was going through chemotherapy. And I still wear it, because it's a great reminder of friendship and how my buddies and others came together in my time of need.

friendship.author: Frankie Valli
friendship.text: I cherish the memory of being a friend of Frank Sinatra on a friendship level to the point where we really hung out. We worked in Vegas, we'd talk on the phone, and if I wasn't doing anything, I'd fly out, and I spent time in Palm Springs at his house - on a level the way friends would be, not with a whole crowd of people.

friendship.author: Adam Sandler
friendship.text: Sixth grade was a big time, in my childhood, of hoops and friendship, and coming up with funny things.

friendship.author: Plautus
friendship.text: Friendship is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.

friendship.author: Mother Angelica
friendship.text: Two of man's basic needs are to love and to share. Both of these needs are satisfied in greater or lesser degree by friendship.

friendship.author: John Cusack
friendship.text: I force people to have coffee with me, just because I don't trust that a friendship can be maintained without any other senses besides a computer or cellphone screen.

friendship.author: William Shenstone
friendship.text: The best time to frame an answer to the letters of a friend, is the moment you receive them. Then the warmth of friendship, and the intelligence received, most forcibly cooperate.

friendship.author: Sanjay Leela Bhansali
friendship.text: Friendship and loyalty shouldn't come in the way of casting.

friendship.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
friendship.text: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.

friendship.author: Oliver Goldsmith
friendship.text: Friendship is a disinterested commerce between equals; love, an abject intercourse between tyrants and slaves.

friendship.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
friendship.text: A girl does not treat a possible lover with unvarying simplicity and directness. In all its phases, love is complex; friendship is not.

friendship.author: Willa Cather
friendship.text: Only solitary men know the full joys of friendship. Others have their family; but to a solitary and an exile, his friends are everything.

friendship.author: Lynn Coady
friendship.text: There was a time when I thought dudes had friendship all figured out. The focus on eating things in front of giant screens, pretending to punch one another, competing over who can utter the grossest and most profane personal insults imaginable - this struck me as the very apex of human social exchange.

friendship.author: Robin Morgan
friendship.text: Friendship is mutual blackmail elevated to the level of love.

friendship.author: Michael Cimino
friendship.text: Friendship and sentiment and the giving of one's words are very important.

friendship.author: Aristotle
friendship.text: Friendship is essentially a partnership.

friendship.author: Henri Nouwen
friendship.text: Friendship has always belonged to the core of my spiritual journey.

friendship.author: Eddie Murray
friendship.text: When Ted Williams was here, inducted into the Hall of Fame 37 years ago, he said he must have earned it, because he didn't win it because of his friendship with the writers. I guess in that way, I'm proud to be in this company that way.

friendship.author: Robert Blair
friendship.text: Friendship! Mysterious cement of the soul, Sweet'ner of life, and solder of society.

friendship.author: Hanya Yanagihara
friendship.text: In a basic sense, 'A Little Life' is a homage to how my friends and I live our lives. I wanted to push past the definitions of how we typically define friendship. It's a different version of adulthood, but it's no less important and no less legitimate than anyone else's.

friendship.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun
friendship.text: I love life in spite of all that mars it. I love friendship, jokes and laughter.

friendship.author: Henry David Thoreau
friendship.text: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.

friendship.author: Henry Adams
friendship.text: One friend in a lifetime is much, two are many, three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.

friendship.author: Cynthia Breazeal
friendship.text: I do think, in time, people will have, sort of, relationships with certain kinds of robots - not every robot, but certain kinds of robots - where they might feel that it is a sort of friendship, but it's going to be of a robot-human kind.

friendship.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
friendship.text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.

friendship.author: Simon Sinek
friendship.text: A friend is an emotional bond, just like friendship is a human experience.

friendship.author: Jason Dolley
friendship.text: I think faith helps me a lot. God wants you to be where He wants you to be, and that's where I want to be. If I do not get a part, I understand that maybe I needed to be home at that time, maybe in school; there's always a reason. My faith is also where my core friends are, at my church, a faith-based friendship.

friendship.author: George Washington
friendship.text: Friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.

friendship.author: Ernie Banks
friendship.text: But it all comes down to friendship, treating people right.

friendship.author: Anna Freud
friendship.text: Why do we go around acting as though everything was friendship and reliability when basically everything everywhere is full of sudden hate and ugliness?

friendship.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
friendship.text: Have you ever thought how humiliating and distressing it was to be placed upon a sphere? For friendship it is a boon never to be able to be further apart than the antipodes. But suppose that you are leaving together to go on and on; it is impossible. To go beyond a certain point is to return to where you began.

friendship.author: John Wooden
friendship.text: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.

friendship.author: Mencius
friendship.text: Friendship with a man is friendship with his virtue.

friendship.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
friendship.text: Acquaintances we meet, enjoy, and can easily leave behind; but friendship grows deep roots.

friendship.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
friendship.text: Don't flatter yourselves that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. On the contrary, the nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become.

friendship.author: Jean de la Bruyere
friendship.text: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker.

friendship.author: Rachel Simmons
friendship.text: There are times in every friendship when you or your friend are too busy to call or are more focused on other relationships. It will hurt, but it's rarely personal. Making it personal usually makes things worse, and being too clingy or demanding can drive a friend even further away. Like people, friendships can get 'overworked' and need to rest.

friendship.author: Robert Kraft
friendship.text: Loyalty and friendship trumps politics for me.

friendship.author: Abby Wambach
friendship.text: It's always really challenging trying to go from player to player/coach. You have a kind of friendship basis of relationship with all of your teammates, and now you go to this power position where you have to make decisions that might hurt people's feelings.

friendship.author: Clayton M. Christensen
friendship.text: The first two lessons, which we learned early in our efforts to be good member missionaries, have made sharing the Gospel much easier: We simply can't predict who will or won't be interested in the Gospel, and building a friendship is not a prerequisite to inviting people to learn about the Gospel.

friendship.author: Jeremy Taylor
friendship.text: Secrecy is the chastity of friendship.

friendship.author: Fawn M. Brodie
friendship.text: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.

friendship.author: Rodrigo Duterte
friendship.text: To all my political opponents, all and sundry, not only the presidential bets, I would like to offer my hand to friendship.

friendship.author: Thomas Aquinas
friendship.text: Moral science is better occupied when treating of friendship than of justice.

friendship.author: Mason Cooley
friendship.text: Bad faith likes discourse on friendship and loyalty.

friendship.author: Jane Austen
friendship.text: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.

friendship.author: Stefanie Powers
friendship.text: I don't need to go onto Facebook and pretend to have friends I've never even met. To my mind, that kind of destroys the meaning of the word 'friend.' I take exception to that. Because I value and respect friendship.

friendship.author: Justin Trudeau
friendship.text: We should have a good working friendship with the United States.

friendship.author: Ian Mckellen
friendship.text: What I particularly like about Broadway is the camaraderie and the friendship of other people in other shows. Everybody knows you're opening and cares about you. There's a real village atmosphere.

friendship.author: Udo Kier
friendship.text: I'll tell you what a friendship is to me. Friendship to me is, if my friends need my little finger to live, I'm going to have it cut off. I'm going to the hospital, they cut off my finger, and maybe I have a gold finger instead, and I become famous. But I still give it to my friend.

friendship.author: Amber Rudd
friendship.text: When we look at the wider picture, the relationship between the U.K. and America, I know how valuable the friendship is between our two nations. As home secretary, I can tell the House that the importance of the relationship between our countries, the unparalleled sharing of intelligence between our countries, is vital.

friendship.author: Joseph Addison
friendship.text: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship. To raise this to the highest pitch of enjoyment, is a secret which but few discover.

friendship.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
friendship.text: Sympathy constitutes friendship; but in love there is a sort of antipathy, or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other, and both together make up one whole.

friendship.author: Sallust
