life.text: Life is about perspective and how you look at something... ultimately, you have to zoom out.

life.author: Thales
life.text: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself.

life.author: Morgan Freeman
life.text: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.

life.author: Katharine Hepburn
life.text: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.

life.author: Frederick Douglass
life.text: The life of the nation is secure only while the nation is honest, truthful, and virtuous.

life.author: Eddie Cantor
life.text: Slow down and enjoy life. It's not only the scenery you miss by going to fast - you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.

life.author: Sterling K. Brown
life.text: Empathy begins with understanding life from another person's perspective. Nobody has an objective experience of reality. It's all through our own individual prisms.

life.author: Langston Hughes
life.text: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.

life.author: Bill Gates
life.text: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don't really even notice it, so it's part of everyday life.

life.author: Dean Koontz
life.text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.

life.author: Arthur Schopenhauer
life.text: Each day is a little life: every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death.

life.author: Cecil Rhodes
life.text: Remember that you are an Englishman, and have consequently won first prize in the lottery of life.

life.author: Federico Fellini
life.text: There is no end. There is no beginning. There is only the passion of life.

life.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
life.text: Life has no meaning the moment you lose the illusion of being eternal.

life.author: Kenneth Branagh
life.text: Lighten up, just enjoy life, smile more, laugh more, and don't get so worked up about things.

life.author: Paul J. Meyer
life.text: Life is a painting, and you are the artist. You have on your palette all the colors in the spectrum - the same ones available to Michaelangelo and DaVinci.

life.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
life.text: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control; these three alone lead life to sovereign power.

life.author: Rudolf Steiner
life.text: A healthy social life is found only when, in the mirror of each soul, the whole community finds its reflection, and when, in the whole community, the virtue of each one is living.

life.author: Leo Tolstoy
life.text: An arrogant person considers himself perfect. This is the chief harm of arrogance. It interferes with a person's main task in life - becoming a better person.

life.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
life.text: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.

life.author: Anthony Hopkins
life.text: My philosophy is it's none of my business what people say of me and think of me. I am what I am, and I do what I do. I expect nothing and accept everything. And it makes life so much easier.

life.author: Esme Bianco
life.text: You can't get anywhere in life without taking risks.

life.author: John N. Mitchell
life.text: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.

life.author: Solomon Ortiz
life.text: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.

life.author: Suze Orman
life.text: If a child, a spouse, a life partner, or a parent depends on you and your income, you need life insurance.

life.author: Sarah Louise Delany
life.text: Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.

life.author: Christopher Morley
life.text: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.

life.author: Walter Anderson
life.text: Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness, immobilized by the gravity of my loss, or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have - life itself.

life.author: Robert A. Heinlein
life.text: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.

life.author: Jose Rizal
life.text: It is a useless life that is not consecrated to a great ideal. It is like a stone wasted on the field without becoming a part of any edifice.

life.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
life.text: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.

life.author: Lewis Carroll
life.text: One of the secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.

life.author: C. S. Lewis
life.text: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.

life.author: Jeff Buckley
life.text: The most audacious thing I could possibly state in this day and age is that life is worth living. It's worth being bashed against. It's worth getting scarred by. It's worth pouring yourself over every one of its coals.

life.author: Jim Henson
life.text: Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.

life.author: T. S. Eliot
life.text: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?

life.author: Jen Sincero
life.text: Gratitude is one of the strongest and most transformative states of being. It shifts your perspective from lack to abundance and allows you to focus on the good in your life, which in turn pulls more goodness into your reality.

motivational.author: Elon Musk
motivational.text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

motivational.author: Winston Churchill
motivational.text: If you're going through hell, keep going.

motivational.author: Thomas A. Edison
motivational.text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

motivational.author: Confucius
motivational.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

motivational.author: Nelson Mandela
motivational.text: It always seems impossible until it's done.

motivational.author: St. Jerome
motivational.text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.

motivational.author: Norman Vincent Peale
motivational.text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

motivational.author: Charles R. Swindoll
motivational.text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.

motivational.author: Helen Keller
motivational.text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

motivational.author: Walt Disney
motivational.text: If you can dream it, you can do it.

motivational.author: Aristotle
motivational.text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

motivational.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
motivational.text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.

motivational.author: Ralph Marston
motivational.text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.

motivational.author: Samuel Beckett
motivational.text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.

motivational.author: Arthur Ashe
motivational.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

motivational.author: Lao Tzu
motivational.text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

motivational.author: George S. Patton
motivational.text: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.

motivational.author: Mark Twain
motivational.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

motivational.author: Theodore Roosevelt
motivational.text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

motivational.author: Pope John XXIII
motivational.text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.

motivational.author: H. G. Wells
motivational.text: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

motivational.author: Tony Robbins
motivational.text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.

motivational.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
motivational.text: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.

motivational.author: Og Mandino
motivational.text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.

motivational.author: Jim Rohn
motivational.text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.

motivational.author: William James
motivational.text: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.

motivational.author: Sam Levenson
motivational.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

motivational.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
motivational.text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

motivational.author: Bo Jackson
motivational.text: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.

motivational.author: Benjamin Franklin
motivational.text: Well done is better than well said.

motivational.author: Rabindranath Tagore
motivational.text: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.

motivational.author: W. Clement Stone
motivational.text: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.

motivational.author: Benjamin Disraeli
motivational.text: Never complain and never explain.

motivational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
motivational.text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.

motivational.author: Leo Buscaglia
motivational.text: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.

motivational.author: Walter Elliot
motivational.text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.

motivational.author: Aldous Huxley
motivational.text: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.

motivational.author: Dalai Lama
motivational.text: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.

motivational.author: Maya Angelou
motivational.text: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.

motivational.author: Bradley Whitford
motivational.text: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.

motivational.author: Zig Ziglar
motivational.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

motivational.author: Nikos Kazantzakis
motivational.text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.

motivational.author: Unknown
motivational.text: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.

motivational.author: John F. Kennedy
motivational.text: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.

motivational.author: Les Brown
motivational.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

motivational.author: Ayn Rand
motivational.text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

motivational.author: Ken Venturi
motivational.text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.

motivational.author: Robert H. Schuller
motivational.text: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.

motivational.author: Horace
motivational.text: Don't think, just do.

motivational.author: Epictetus
motivational.text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.

motivational.author: Wayne Dyer
motivational.text: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.

motivational.author: Pauline Kael
motivational.text: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.

motivational.author: Carol Burnett
motivational.text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.

motivational.author: Simone de Beauvoir
motivational.text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.

motivational.author: Don Miguel Ruiz
motivational.text: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.

motivational.author: Amelia Earhart
motivational.text: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.

motivational.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
motivational.text: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.

motivational.author: Kyle Chandler
motivational.text: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.

motivational.author: Stephen Hawking
motivational.text: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.

motivational.author: Muhammad Iqbal
motivational.text: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.

motivational.author: Simone Weil
motivational.text: I can, therefore I am.

motivational.author: Thomas Paine
motivational.text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.

motivational.author: Babe Ruth
motivational.text: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.

motivational.author: George Herbert
motivational.text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.

motivational.author: William Wordsworth
motivational.text: To begin, begin.

motivational.author: Thomas Jefferson
motivational.text: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.

motivational.author: Henry Ford
motivational.text: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.

motivational.author: John Burroughs
motivational.text: Leap, and the net will appear.

motivational.author: William Blake
motivational.text: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.

motivational.author: William Butler Yeats
motivational.text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.

motivational.author: Napoleon Hill
motivational.text: A goal is a dream with a deadline.

motivational.author: Joan of Arc
motivational.text: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.

motivational.author: Helen Rowland
motivational.text: You will never win if you never begin.

motivational.author: Oprah Winfrey
motivational.text: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.

motivational.author: Bobby Knight
motivational.text: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.

motivational.author: John Dewey
motivational.text: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.

motivational.author: Khalil Gibran
motivational.text: March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.

motivational.author: George Lucas
motivational.text: You simply have to put one foot in front of the other and keep going. Put blinders on and plow right ahead.

motivational.author: Denis Waitley
motivational.text: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.

motivational.author: Dean Koontz
motivational.text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.

motivational.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
motivational.text: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.

motivational.author: Jim Elliot
motivational.text: Wherever you are - be all there.

motivational.author: John D. Rockefeller
motivational.text: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.

motivational.author: Elbert Hubbard
motivational.text: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.

motivational.author: Alfred A. Montapert
motivational.text: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.

motivational.author: Woodrow Wilson
motivational.text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.

motivational.author: Jack London
motivational.text: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.

motivational.author: Ted Turner
motivational.text: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.

motivational.author: Golda Meir
motivational.text: The dog that trots about finds a bone.

motivational.author: Albert Schweitzer
motivational.text: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.

motivational.author: Philip Sidney
motivational.text: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.

motivational.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
motivational.text: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.

motivational.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
motivational.text: Hitch your wagon to a star.

motivational.author: Julie Andrews
motivational.text: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.

motivational.author: Mark Caine
motivational.text: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.

motivational.author: Muhammad Ali
motivational.text: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.

motivational.author: Tom Stoppard
motivational.text: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.

motivational.author: Dale Carnegie
motivational.text: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

motivational.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
motivational.text: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.

motivational.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
motivational.text: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.

motivational.author: Benjamin Jowett
motivational.text: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.

motivational.author: Victor Kiam
motivational.text: Even if you fall on your face, you're still moving forward.

motivational.author: George Whitefield
motivational.text: Press forward. Do not stop, do not linger in your journey, but strive for the mark set before you.

motivational.author: Allen Ginsberg
motivational.text: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.

motivational.author: Michael Korda
motivational.text: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.

motivational.author: Persius
motivational.text: He conquers who endures.

motivational.author: Dan Millman
motivational.text: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.

motivational.author: Sophocles
motivational.text: Always desire to learn something useful.

motivational.author: Sasha Cohen
motivational.text: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.

motivational.author: Carl von Clausewitz
motivational.text: Pursue one great decisive aim with force and determination.

motivational.author: John Donne
motivational.text: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.

motivational.author: Christopher Morley
motivational.text: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.

motivational.author: Philip Emeagwali
motivational.text: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.

motivational.author: Lucille Ball
motivational.text: The more things you do, the more you can do.

motivational.author: Brian Tracy
motivational.text: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.

motivational.author: Octavio Paz
motivational.text: Deserve your dream.

motivational.author: Diane Sawyer
motivational.text: Whatever you want in life, other people are going to want it too. Believe in yourself enough to accept the idea that you have an equal right to it.

motivational.author: Stevie Wonder
motivational.text: If you don't ask, you don't get.

motivational.author: Herbert A. Simon
motivational.text: One finds limits by pushing them.

motivational.author: H. L. Hunt
motivational.text: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.

motivational.author: Eileen Caddy
motivational.text: Set your sights high, the higher the better. Expect the most wonderful things to happen, not in the future but right now. Realize that nothing is too good. Allow absolutely nothing to hamper you or hold you up in any way.

motivational.author: Richard Rorty
motivational.text: There is nothing deep down inside us except what we have put there ourselves.

motivational.author: Carl Sandburg
motivational.text: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.

motivational.author: Jessica Savitch
motivational.text: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.

motivational.author: Charles Atlas
motivational.text: Step by step and the thing is done.

motivational.author: Henry Drummond
motivational.text: The people who influence you are the people who believe in you.

motivational.author: Florence Nightingale
motivational.text: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.

motivational.author: Mia Hamm
motivational.text: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.

motivational.author: Peter Marshall
motivational.text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.

motivational.author: Natalie Gulbis
motivational.text: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.

motivational.author: Aeschylus
motivational.text: God always strives together with those who strive.

motivational.author: Matthew Henry
motivational.text: After a storm comes a calm.

motivational.author: Swami Sivananda
motivational.text: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.

motivational.author: J. D. Salinger
motivational.text: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?

motivational.author: Eliza Dushku
motivational.text: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?

motivational.author: Christopher Reeve
motivational.text: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.

motivational.author: Emile Zola
motivational.text: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.

motivational.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
motivational.text: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'

motivational.author: Shakti Gawain
motivational.text: You create your opportunities by asking for them.

motivational.author: Norman Ralph Augustine
motivational.text: Motivation will almost always beat mere talent.

motivational.author: Orison Swett Marden
motivational.text: A will finds a way.

motivational.author: John W. Gardner
motivational.text: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.

motivational.author: Jim Carrey
motivational.text: If you've got a talent, protect it.

motivational.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
motivational.text: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.

motivational.author: Daniel Webster
motivational.text: There is always room at the top.

motivational.author: Rose Kennedy
motivational.text: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.

motivational.author: Tecumseh
motivational.text: From my tribe I take nothing, I am the maker of my own fortune.

motivational.author: Katharine Hepburn
motivational.text: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.

motivational.author: Denis Diderot
motivational.text: You have to make it happen.

motivational.author: Malala Yousafzai
motivational.text: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.

motivational.author: Baruch Spinoza
motivational.text: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.

motivational.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
motivational.text: Never give in and never give up.

motivational.author: Albert Camus
motivational.text: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.

motivational.author: Virgil
motivational.text: They can conquer who believe they can.

motivational.author: Flip Wilson
motivational.text: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.

motivational.author: Phillips Brooks
motivational.text: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.

motivational.author: William Hazlitt
motivational.text: The more we do, the more we can do.

motivational.author: Norman Cousins
motivational.text: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.

motivational.author: Charlotte Whitton
motivational.text: When one must, one can.

motivational.author: Judy Collins
motivational.text: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.

motivational.author: George C. Marshall
motivational.text: Don't fight the problem, decide it.

motivational.author: Jimmy Dean
motivational.text: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.

motivational.author: Henry David Thoreau
motivational.text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.

motivational.author: Ezra Pound
motivational.text: Either move or be moved.

motivational.author: Leo Durocher
motivational.text: I come to win.

motivational.author: Thomas Fuller
motivational.text: One may miss the mark by aiming too high as too low.

motivational.author: Baltasar Gracian
motivational.text: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.

motivational.author: Edgar Cayce
motivational.text: There is progress whether ye are going forward or backward! The thing is to move!

motivational.author: Rupert Murdoch
motivational.text: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.

motivational.author: Beverly Sills
motivational.text: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.

motivational.author: Sylvia Browne
motivational.text: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.

motivational.author: Donna Brazile
motivational.text: I was motivated to be different in part because I was different.

motivational.author: Robert Henri
motivational.text: Do whatever you do intensely.

motivational.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
motivational.text: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.

motivational.text: I am not a has-been. I am a will be.

motivational.author: Oliver Herford
motivational.text: Many are called but few get up.

motivational.author: Cicely Tyson
motivational.text: You never know what motivates you.

motivational.text: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.

motivational.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.

motivational.author: Confucius
motivational.text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.

motivational.author: Og Mandino
motivational.text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

motivational.author: George S. Patton
motivational.text: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.

motivational.author: John Burroughs
motivational.text: If you think you can do it, you can.

motivational.author: Nelson Mandela
motivational.text: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.

motivational.author: Winston Churchill
motivational.text: Never, never, never give up.

motivational.author: William James
motivational.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

motivational.author: Benjamin Franklin
motivational.text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

motivational.author: Walt Disney
motivational.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

motivational.author: Jim Rohn
motivational.text: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.

motivational.author: Unknown
motivational.text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.

motivational.author: Epictetus
motivational.text: Only the educated are free.

motivational.author: Thomas A. Edison
motivational.text: There's a way to do it better - find it.

motivational.author: Wayne Dyer
motivational.text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.

motivational.author: Norman Vincent Peale
motivational.text: It's always too early to quit.

motivational.author: Robert H. Schuller
motivational.text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.

motivational.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
motivational.text: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.

motivational.author: Thomas Jefferson
motivational.text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.

motivational.author: Orison Swett Marden
motivational.text: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.

motivational.author: Theodore Roosevelt
motivational.text: Get action. Seize the moment. Man was never intended to become an oyster.

motivational.author: Baltasar Gracian
motivational.text: Know or listen to those who know.

motivational.author: Sophocles
motivational.text: Who seeks shall find.

motivational.author: Og Mandino
motivational.text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.

motivational.author: Confucius
motivational.text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.

motivational.author: John Burroughs
motivational.text: A somebody was once a nobody who wanted to and did.

motivational.author: George S. Patton
motivational.text: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.

motivational.author: Jim Rohn
motivational.text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.

motivational.text: Music - it's motivational and just makes you relax.

motivational.text: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.

motivational.author: Herman Cain
motivational.text: One of the things that I did before I ran for president is I was a professional speaker. Not a motivational speaker - an inspirational speaker. Motivation comes from within. You have to be inspired. That's what I do. I inspire people, I inspire the public, I inspire my staff. I inspired the organizations I took over to want to succeed.

motivational.author: Peter Steele
motivational.text: I like to put on hardcore when I have to clean my apartment, which I hate to do, but it's motivational. I like old heavy metal when I'm outside working on my car. Music has definite functions for me.

motivational.text: We need to accept that the commandments of God aren't just a long list of good ideas. They aren't 'life hacks' from an Internet blog or motivational quotes from a Pinterest board.

motivational.text: I'm completely honest with everyone I deal with. I genuinely care about people. I want to see people succeed and be the best that they can be. So, I wanted to write a motivational book about life, love and the pursuit of happiness.

motivational.text: You hope to bring your 'A Game' to any game, and of course you do in a final. You hope to bring experience, fitness, communication skills, motivational skills.

motivational.text: I'm a motivational speaker.

motivational.text: People always need to hear good motivational speeches.

motivational.author: A'Lelia Bundles
motivational.text: Madam Walker was a master marketer. But her brilliance was in taking it to another level by training women, by traveling, by making very motivational speeches and by providing independent income for women who otherwise would have to be maids and sharecroppers.

motivational.author: Justin Zackham
motivational.text: One day, I got so disgusted that I sat down and wrote a list called 'Justin's list of things to do before he kicks the bucket.' I wrote it for myself and shortened it to 'Justin's Bucket List.' It was there on the wall, not as a story idea but as a motivational tool for myself, which actually ended up working pretty well.

motivational.author: Marianne Vos
motivational.text: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.

motivational.text: Coy Wire played in the NFL for 9 years and is now a motivational speaker and has a book out called 'Change Your Mind.' He is an amazing person with such positive energy! When Kroy and I first met and started dating, there weren't a whole lot of people that supported us, but Coy always did.

motivational.text: Marvin's Motivational Moments actually started as something that was actually therapeutic for me. I would sit up late at night after my wife passed trying to adjust to being alone.

motivational.text: I'm a motivational speaker, so I'm going to look at something in as much of a positive way as possible.

motivational.author: Louise Mensch
motivational.text: I like motivational books, because I like the go-getting American spirit - your destiny is in your own hands, life is what you make it, don't accept your limitations, jump before you're pushed, leap before you look.

motivational.text: I taught myself how to be a speaker on Google. I just Googled 'how to be a motivational speaker.'

motivational.author: Martina Navratilova
motivational.text: I've a great family, two children to take care of. Then, of course, I do commentary for TV. But eventually, yes, I would like to pass on the knowledge and something that I would like to do.

motivational.author: Daniel H. Pink
motivational.text: Typically, if you reward something, you get more of it. You punish something, you get less of it. And our businesses have been built for the last 150 years very much on that kind of motivational scheme.

motivational.author: Shreyas Iyer
motivational.text: I'm on the playstation, or else I go out and play football. I enjoy movies and sitcoms. I love reading motivational books too.

motivational.text: The Gunnar Challenge offers new workouts every day, a meal plan and daily 'verbal vitamins,' which are a motivational video or workout tip. The thing that really makes the program work is the forum, where Challengers can communicate with each other and with me.

motivational.author: Montel Williams
motivational.text: My first book was called, 'Mountain, Get Out of My Way,' where I did an autobiographical sketch, if you will, looking back at myself and looking back at things in my life, and juxtaposing them against things that are happening in other people's lives and trying to be motivational.

motivational.text: Motivational speaking became my career. Who would ever have thought it?

motivational.text: Ever since I was a kid, I knew I could play in the NFL because I had a knack for the game. But I can't play this game forever. motivational.text: Church is definitely still present in my life. Every Sunday I'm tuned in and then throughout the week I read scriptures, I read motivational messages.

motivational.text: I'm going to write a book, continue acting, continue motivational speaking and just share with people who I am and what I've learned in my second chance of life and pass it on to people in their first chance of life.

motivational.text: My mum was massively important to everything I've done, and now her memory is a motivational tool for me.

motivational.author: Tiffany Trump
motivational.text: I don't know what it's like to have a typical father figure. He's not the dad who's going to take me to the beach and go swimming, but he's such a motivational person.

motivational.text: Our subliminal mental processes operate outside awareness because they arise in these portions of our mind that are inaccessible to our conscious self; their inaccessibility is due to the architecture of the brain rather than because they have been subject to Freudian motivational forces like repression.

motivational.author: Lizzie Velasquez
motivational.text: I told myself that I wanted to be a motivational speaker, I wanted to write a book, graduate college, have my own family, and have my own career.

motivational.text: I went to a motivational training course once, a course of self-discovery, and I found out after a week that my fear - it was not a fear of not being accepted - was a very violent fear of failure.

motivational.author: Ryan Howard
motivational.text: I was perceived to be a first- to third-rounder. I kind of had a tough junior year and fell to the fifth round. At that time, it was motivational.

motivational.author: Erin Brockovich
motivational.text: I have never moved away from my mainstay - trying to address all the environmental issues that come to me. I consult with law firms in the U.S., Australia, the U.K., Italy, Greece, and India to begin to address environmental disasters. I do motivational speaking.

motivational.author: Toni Kroos

motivational.text: One of the hidden benefits of me being a student manager at Kentucky was me having the responsibility of driving Rick Pitino to his motivational speaking engagements.

motivational.author: Jason Kelce
motivational.text: A lot of motivational speakers - players, coaches, or whatever - they kind of speak in these kind of age-old mantras, or cliches or whatnot. Kobe was very much not like that.

motivational.author: Jason Kelce
motivational.text: I've heard a lot of motivational speakers throughout the years.

positive.author: Willie Nelson
positive.text: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.

positive.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
positive.text: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.

positive.author: Ralph Marston
positive.text: You've done it before and you can do it now. See the positive possibilities. Redirect the substantial energy of your frustration and turn it into positive, effective, unstoppable determination.

positive.author: Helen Keller
positive.text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

positive.author: Martha Beck
positive.text: Every day brings new choices.

positive.author: Leah LaBelle
positive.text: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.

positive.author: Matt Cameron
positive.text: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.

positive.author: Joseph Campbell
positive.text: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.

positive.author: Kobe Bryant
positive.text: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.

positive.author: Maya Angelou
positive.text: You are the sum total of everything you've ever seen, heard, eaten, smelled, been told, forgot - it's all there. Everything influences each of us, and because of that I try to make sure that my experiences are positive.

positive.author: Donna Karan
positive.text: Delete the negative; accentuate the positive!

positive.author: Dalai Lama
positive.text: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.

positive.author: Vincent Van Gogh
positive.text: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.

positive.author: Marla Gibbs
positive.text: I truly believe that everything that we do and everyone that we meet is put in our path for a purpose. There are no accidents; we're all teachers - if we're willing to pay attention to the lessons we learn, trust our positive instincts and not be afraid to take risks or wait for some miracle to come knocking at our door.

positive.author: Demi Lovato
positive.text: No matter what you're going through, there's a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you'll find the positive side of things.

positive.author: Joyce Brothers
positive.text: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.

positive.author: Zig Ziglar
positive.text: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

positive.author: Colin Powell
positive.text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.

positive.author: Joel Osteen
positive.text: You're going to go through tough times - that's life. But I say, 'Nothing happens to you, it happens for you.' See the positive in negative events.

positive.author: Khalil Gibran
positive.text: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.

positive.author: Joyce Meyer
positive.text: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.

positive.author: Christopher McCandless
positive.text: The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.

positive.author: Henri Nouwen
positive.text: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.

positive.author: Don Miguel Ruiz
positive.text: Always Do Your Best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.

positive.author: Richard M. DeVos
positive.text: Few things in the world are more powerful than a positive push. A smile. A world of optimism and hope. A 'you can do it' when things are tough.

positive.author: Willard Scott
positive.text: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all; and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.

positive.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
positive.text: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.

positive.author: Daniel Kahneman
positive.text: It's a wonderful thing to be optimistic. It keeps you healthy and it keeps you resilient.

positive.author: Roger Clemens
positive.text: I think anything is possible if you have the mindset and the will and desire to do it and put the time in.

positive.author: John Wooden
positive.text: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.

positive.author: Michael Jordan
positive.text: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.

positive.author: William James
positive.text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.

positive.author: Walt Disney
positive.text: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.

positive.author: Pat Riley
positive.text: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges.

positive.author: Albert Einstein
positive.text: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.

positive.author: Paulo Coelho
positive.text: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.

positive.author: Elbert Hubbard
positive.text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.

positive.author: Allen Klein
positive.text: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.

positive.author: Harvey Mackay
positive.text: When you wake up every day, you have two choices. You can either be positive or negative; an optimist or a pessimist. I choose to be an optimist. It's all a matter of perspective.

positive.author: George Allen, Sr.
positive.text: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.

positive.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
positive.text: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.

positive.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
positive.text: Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be.

positive.author: Cuba Gooding, Jr.
positive.text: Don't let people disrespect you. My mom says don't open the door to the devil. Surround yourself with positive people.

positive.author: Tony Dorsett
positive.text: To succeed, you need to find something to hold on to, something to motivate you, something to inspire you.

positive.author: Ethel Waters
positive.text: Today or any day that phone may ring and bring good news.

positive.author: Pitbull
positive.text: I'm taking all the negatives in my life, and turning them into a positive.

positive.author: Samuel Johnson
positive.text: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.

positive.author: Samuel Goldwyn
positive.text: When someone does something good, applaud! You will make two people happy.

positive.author: Henry Rollins
positive.text: My optimism wears heavy boots and is loud.

positive.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
positive.text: The learner always begins by finding fault, but the scholar sees the positive merit in everything.
